Location: State Highway 22, Dubois, Clark County, Idaho, 83423, United States
Name: Dubois Dispersed Camp- BLM
Description:
BLM land- Dubois Dispersed camping in Idaho about 3 miles  off of I-15 and ~90 miles East of the Craters of the Moon National Monument and 50 miles north of Idaho Falls.  Nice open area. Free.  360 degree high views with mountains to the west.  Easy access for anyone, although the dirt road coming in had some pretty deep ruts....but just take your time.  Still at a little over 5,000 ft amsl.  One other rig here.  Area is fairly level.  Pretty clean too, with a couple of homemade rock fire pits.  Burn ban still in effect. No services, no shade, great for solar. VZW and ATT are both pretty fast here.... both around 30 mbps down/15 up.  12 TV channels on the OTA. 

Great, convenient stop. There is a gas station with a small store at the exit and a couple places to eat in the small town of Dubois too.  There is a 14 day max stay.

Location: East 2650 North Road, McLean County, Illinois, United States
Name: Merwin Nature Preserve North Entrance
Description: Small trailhead parking lot off of a very lightly trafficked county road. We hiked the preserve late in the afternoon and decided to just stay the night rather than drive to one of the overlanding spots further south. Very quiet, only a few cars passed between 8pm and 10am. No signs prohibiting overnight parking/camping but stealth should still be exercised. Not suitable for big rigs or tents - best for cars, trucks, vans etc. There is a portapotty but no other amenities.

Location: Johnson County, Wyoming, United States
Name: Big Horn National wilderness
Description: Beautiful very large camping down a very nice stone road. Any size rig ok. Large flat field off road 403. There are 6 big and small rigs beside us and a tent. Watch out for cow patties. Snow capped mountains around us.

Location: Forest Road 24, Santa Fe County, New Mexico, 87500, United States
Name: Off Caja Del Rio
Description: Dispersed camping with many sites 100 or 200 yards apart.

Location: 6253, Hualapai Mountain Road, Mohave County, Arizona, 86401, United States
Name: Hualapai Wash
Description:
Nice pull-off for one rig only. Semi-blocked off from the road by bushes. No cell signal AT&T or T-mobile. T mobile had 1 bar with our signal booster. Stayed one night in our truck camper.

Look for forest road going up steeply towards the east. Site is just before the climb.

Location: County Road 67, Langston, Jackson County, Alabama, 35769, United States
Name: Lake Gunthersville
Description: There are many campsites available on NWR land south of the lake on AL Hwy 40. Unfortunately many have a lot of trash and unkempt fire pits. There is also a lot of road noise, but that quiets down after dark.

Location: Navajo County, Arizona, United States
Name: Large Flat Area off 180
Description: Perfect space for RVs. Nice flat entrance. Wide open space. Cell service. Clean as long as you leave no trace behind.

Location: Forest Rt 247, Saint Louis County, Minnesota, United States
Name: Big Rice Lake
Description: A few rustic sites in woods, pit toilet, private. Good for one night stop. Free. A small boat launch. Plenty of free boon-docking spaces along the road to Big Rice  Lake. ATT has five bars here.

Location: 2997, 56th Street South, Gulfport, Saint Petersburg, Pinellas County, Florida, 33707, United States
Name: Gulfport Street Parking
Description: quiet and shaded side streets in nice funky neighborhood. free. no time restrictions. this particular location is in front of an empty lot on the right. would move everyday if I were to stay here multiple nights. I'm guessing it's illegal in most Florida coastal cities to "camp". one block from restaurants. few blocks from park with bathrooms.

Location: convalescent home/ novitiate, Parkcrest Street, Long Beach, Los Angeles County, California, 90808, United States
Name: Street
Description: around the corner from hartwell park.. church on one side and golf course on the other.. quiet. never bothered

Location: Cedar Pocket Road, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: Cedar Pocket Wash
Description:
0.25 miles past sign, take road to right (head-north east), beautiful camp spot on left.
Fire ring, 2-3 bars Verizon, great views, quiet. 
Dirt road bumpy, high clearance - no 4wd needed. 
Camp spots peppered throughout this lovely area! 
Happy & Safe travels friends.

Location: 3225, Shoreline Highway, Marin County, CAL Fire Northern Region, California, 94970, United States
Name: Pull off Next to Spring
Description:
As I was up a hill on a curvy road looking for a place to stay, a local recommended this to me - just go through Stinson, up a hill, you‚Äôll go around a curve and there will be a pull-off on the either side of the road but on one side there is a spring. There are stunning views of the water (sunsets) right across the street. Without getting too close to the road, I have 1 solid bar of Verizon LTE service.

This is right off of Route 1, a large enough pull-off to count as a solid place for a night. It is far better suited for vehicles/RVs, as it is close to the road/popular spring and is quite noisy at the moment (8:30PM). I got a relatively flat spot for my tent (no luck with stakes and it was quite windy, so I ended up tying my tent to my car‚Ä¶) but again, If you have a vehicle, you may be able to pull off more of an incline a little farther away. Be careful of the ditch at the base of the cliff as it is essentially the drain for the spring and is muddy (there is a concrete portion so you won‚Äôt come close to the water).

Location: Cow Canyon Road, Oneida County, Idaho, United States
Name: Cow Hollow Dispersed Camping
Description:
Dispersed camping with Juniper trees for shade and big views of the plains and Black Pines mountains. GPS is at entrance of area - take the dirt road toward the trees. 

A few fire pits/established campsites scattered around. Silty road is ok for any vehicle *when dry*. 

Amenities include shade and stars. No bathrooms, water, etc. Pack out all trash. 

Variable cell service on Verizon - sometimes 4G and downloading podcasts, other times nothing. 

Happy camping!

Location: 168, Screven Street, Georgetown, Georgetown County, South Carolina, 29440, United States
Name: Public parking  C
Description: Just off the Main Street, free public parking. Nothing posted about overnights or limited parking time. Large enough for our dually truck with a generator on the front and truck camper (30‚Äô long). Tv channels good with antenna & cell service half (2-3 bars Verizon). Cute Main Street with nice restaurants and local shopping.

Location: Clark County, Nevada, 89026, United States
Name: Jean Roach Dry Lake Dispersed Camping
Description: Public land. Paved road leading back to several pull offs. Suitable for any size rig. There are dirt roads leading off into more remote sites. Those roads are for 4x4 or high clearance vehicle. Only a mile prior to the 7 Magical Mountains from Vegas.

Location: North Fork Road, Long Barn, Tuolumne County, California, 95373, United States
Name: Multiple easy access spots
Description: Awesome spot. Was headed to another spot and found this. Been here 2 days and no probs. Still picking up other people‚Äôs trash, sorta sucks.

Location: Dallam County, Texas, United States
Name: Rita Blanca Wilderness Camp
Description: Very quite wilderness camp with no one in sight. Beautiful grasslands great view of the night sky. This is in unit 18.

Location: Foothills Loop, Lake Isabella, Kern County, California, 93205, United States
Name: BLM Land
Description: This place is awesome! Great cell phone service yet far enough away from the town to find solitude. Road is paved until you turn off to many different campsites. Bathrooms and a garbage disposal if needed

Location: Gander, Apple Valley, Washington County, Utah, 84779, United States
Name: Gooseberry Mesa Gem
Description: This is the spot! Far from the road and very private. Insane view of the canyon below. Biking/walking trail directly at the site. Great cell service on ATT. Road in is bumpy, but made it in a high clearance Sprinter.

Location: Junction Creek Road, La Plata County, Colorado, United States
Name: Tucked away woodland area
Description: Small drive off the main road. Dirt road for 8 miles out. Some cars here and there but clears out at 6. Small fire rings. Cell service, 2 bars. Good for car camping, terrain would be rough for ground tents

Location: Great Basin Highway, White Pine County, Nevada, United States
Name: BLM Elk Viewing area
Description: Large, level parking. right next to highway 50. few shaded picnic tables. 2 bars verizon.

Location: Strada Place, Mercato, Collier County, Florida, 34108, United States
Name: Mercato
Description:
Mercato shopping area
Parked close to the Whole food market, there are some condos on the top floor of shopping.
So I guess they are used to see some car in parking lot after shops close, also some bars that are open til 2-3 am, but they are located far from parking lot, a bit of noise from street.

Location: Great Basin Highway, Majors Place, White Pine County, Nevada, United States
Name: Connors Pass
Description: right at the pass and next to the road. Large gravel area next to the woods. no cell reception. some places level. l

Location: US Highway 89 Alternative, Coconino County, Arizona, 86022, United States
Name: Soap Creek
Description:
Just adding another one of many spots in this area.  Make sure to close the gate behind you when you enter the fenced area off the road.  We made it to this spot in our 26ft class c but we probably should have taken a right at the fork instead of a left. The left is pretty rocky and sketchy and not a good idea for big RVs. 
Good cell service (TMobile is roaming.)
Zero amenities here. Please take your trash and your poop out with you.

Location: River Drive, Titusville, Hopewell Township, Mercer County, New Jersey, 18977, United States
Name: Titusville River walk
Description: Lots of parking along the gravel lane between RT29 and the Delaware River. Beautiful canal towpath. No signs restricting parking and 3 bars Verizon.

Location: 1646, Southwest Chandler Avenue, Century West, Bend, Deschutes County, Oregon, 97702, United States
Name: Wide open street parking by giant pit
Description: one of my favorites for the colder seasons in bend, it is time I share with the community. huge pit of some kind on one side where I often hear coyotes yelping. great signal on all carriers. some pedestrian traffic from college kids living in the upscale apartment next door but all harmless. spent over 30 nights here without a problem. location is primo for century highway or bend's westside

Location: Williams Hill W1, Monterey County, California, United States
Name: BLM land on W1
Description: flat turn off for 4wd camper.  the BLM campground is better but this could be overflow

Location: Eleven North I, 200, 11th Avenue North, Nashville-Davidson, Davidson County, Middle Tennessee, Tennessee, 37203, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description:
Free parking next to residential apartments, no signs or hours as of today. Next to the gulch and nice neighborhood with some construction.

Publix bathroom really close.

Location: Red Oak TH, Door Run Loop, Hocking County, Ohio, 43247, United States
Name: Dorr-Run Red Oak Trailhead
Description:
We stayed 1 night at Red Oak Trailhead in Wayne National Forest. They allow free dispersed camping at designated trailheads for 14 nights. No reservation required. Not designated sites, but there were obvious areas where people had set up camp with fire rings. We chose this trailhead (there are a few on the drive in) because it seemed from the NFS website that this one allowed fire as they listed fire regulations. 

Apparently it‚Äôs quite busy with ATVs here and people camping in summer, but there was only 1 other RV parked off the road a bit when we pulled in. You only need a permit to use the off road routes for ATVs, otherwise no permit necessary. Cleanest vault toilets we‚Äôve used.

Location: Victoria Landing, Houston Street, Eau Gallie, Melbourne, Brevard County, Florida, 32935, United States
Name: Houston St, Melbourne street parking
Description: Street parking in a nice, quiet residential area. Right in front of an assisted living center. About a 2 block walk to some local businesses with public toilets. We asked a police officer and he said we could park on any Melbourne city street overnight as long as there isn‚Äôt a sign stating no parking. Very easy to find a big spot for our van. Saw some neighbors in the morning and no one seemed to mind.

Location: US 70, Glencoe, Lincoln County, New Mexico, 88324, United States
Name: Nice, easy spot near highway in Forest Service land
Description: Just off the highway, some nice loops here to get off trail and rest!

Location: Muir Beach (GGNRA), Green Gulch Trail, Marin County, CAL Fire Northern Region, California, 94941, United States
Name: Ocean view overlook, West side of road.
Description:
There is no parking on east side of road. West side of road has plenty of parking and it doesn't seem to be an issue for overnight parking here. 

minimal traffic in the evening and a wonderful view.

Location: Tyson Street, Quartzsite, La Paz County, Arizona, 85359, United States
Name: Quartzite Desert Area
Description:
Just 5 mi N of Quartzite, off 95 N .
2 other units nearby. T-mobile coverage ok had 2 bars of lte not bad.

Location: 34136, Oat Valley Road, Alderglen Springs, Sonoma County, California, 95425, United States
Name: Quiet pull out at 33500 CA-128
Description:
Large pullout, enough room for two vans or maybe small travel trailer.  Somewhat level. 

Very quiet at night, until early morning when the logging trucks begin going down hill and traffic to Mendocino picks ups. 

No signs other than no littering (which someone did). No houses near by. 

2bars of Verizon 3G

Location: Foot Bridge Road, Bluff, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: San Juan River - Big Rigs
Description: So this is a large flat area before you go down the hill closer to the river. Granted, the place down the hill closer to the river is drop-dead gorgeous. But I wouldn't recommend it for trucks pulling trailers. I think full size class C's would be fine. But I'd stay up top here if you're in a longer rig.

Location: 130, Maple Avenue, Bay Shore, Town of Islip, Suffolk County, New York, 11706, United States
Name: Fire Island Ferry parking lot
Description: Flat parking lot with piers/water on 3 sides. 24 hr Pay to Park May1-September 30. Free in off season. We saw several other lots with RVs near by. This lot was wide open when we arrived in November. A few groups of happy young adults gathered to hang out and play music, and left by 11 pm. A police car cruised by once that we saw. Bay Shore is the nearby town and it has many shops, grocery etc. Several restaurants on the pier. A great find.

Location: Forest Road 313, Hilliardville, Wakulla County, Florida, United States
Name: Apalachicola NF - 313
Description:
Turn onto CR-313, then pull off anywhere to camp 100ft from road.
Road solid WHEN DRY.

Location: 1563, North Juniper Flats Road, Cochise County, Arizona, 85603, United States
Name: Upper Juniper Flats Rd
Description: Multiple spots available a little further up on Juniper Flats Rd than previous post. These coordinates take you a little further off the road, so a bit more secluded, and great view. Lovely sunset! Great AT&T signal and one bar for Verizon. Our van is 24 feet long and fit easily. A bit bigger rigs can fit if you know how to maneuver them well.

Location: J47, Santa Rosa County, Florida, 32564, United States
Name: End of dirt ball road
Description: This site is secluded from the main trails. It‚Äôs about a mile away from the main highway. No signs saying that you can‚Äôt camp here and we weren‚Äôt bothered at all. We had one vehicle come by but they were trying to run some trails and once they realized it was a dead end they turned back around. Took 2WD to get out here but sedans may have an issue (not impossible, but there were some deep ruts getting in here). Gorgeous spot that is surrounded by trees (360) with moderate bugs. Away from any water source so bring plenty. ATT worked great. Had 2 bars and LTE, was able to watch a movie at night without any issues. I don‚Äôt own an RV but would imagine that it would be difficult to bring one here. A trailer MAY be possible but unsure.

Location: Grand County, Utah, United States
Name: BLM off Mineral Creek
Description: Awesome rock out crop off a side road from mineral bottom Creek. AWD recommended. a few scrapes on an outback but totally doable

Location: Harper Lake Road, Lockhart, San Bernardino County, California, United States
Name: Hinkley Decommissioned Oil Well
Description: Just a sand patch off the road close to hi-way and away from train tracks. Good solid ground area to stop for the night in the desert. Strong cellular 4 bars AT&T.

Location: Aultman Parkway, Camp Verde, Yavapai County, Arizona, United States
Name: Pullout by side of road
Description: Pullout by the side of the road. Hard packed dirt/gravel, level. Quiet and very little traffic, possibly because I camped on a Sunday. Good cell/Internet reception, Verizon 2-3 bars LTE. Half an hour from Sedona.

Location: 298, Avenida Madera, Siesta Key Village, Siesta Key, Sarasota County, Florida, 34242, United States
Name: Municipal lot
Description: Municipal lot behind the siesta key grocery store. Sign says no motor homes (photo attached) so I only recommend this for cars and stealth vans. Quiet and shaded

Location: Nye County, Nevada, United States
Name: Big Dune
Description: Big Dune recreation area is about 5 miles back on washboard roads. A couple of washouts so be careful. There is a huge mostly flat open area with a couple picnic tables and a fire pit. Well worth the drive for an awesome sunrise. Decent Verison service but no other amenities.

Location: Old US 60, Catron County, New Mexico, United States
Name: BLM site (2wd friendly)
Description:
A good secluded spot to hang out and get some work done full T-Mobile/sprint service (full bars)

WARNING: google maps will get you here, but you will have to open a cattle gate and drive over a ditch that may be tricky if you don‚Äôt have high clearance. Turn off of the road on to Road 80A (signed junction) and then left onto the single track road at the next junction to avoid this tricky spot (you do not have to open any cattle gates to get here).

If it is at all wet I wouldn‚Äôt recommend coming here, and the berm in the middle of the road may be an issue for very low vehicles, but otherwise most vans/cars should be able to get here. You could probably get a class C here but I wouldn‚Äôt go any bigger than that.

WARNING: There is tall grass at this site so be careful not to park on top of the tall grass, especially if there is high fire danger.

The pull off is a little overgrown but you should be able to see tracks heading into the woods. There is a well hidden spot ~50 m down this track.

There is some road noise, but otherwise a pretty nice secluded spot. I was here 3 days and didn‚Äôt see anyone on the adjacent road even.

Location: 8631, Bell Street, Los Alamos, Santa Barbara County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 93440, United States
Name: Frontage Road.
Description: There‚Äôs a turn out that overlooks a vineyard. Even though the freeway is nearby, it isn‚Äôt very loud. The space is large enough for any size vehicle. There are cars passing by, going into the small town of Los Alamos.

Location: Avalon Resevoir Campground, Avalon Road, Eddy County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Avalon Lake Dispersed Camping
Description: Avalon Lake dispersed camping, further down than the big open area up above. Spot right next to the lake pretty secluded, high clearance recommended. LTE & a couple bars service Straight Talk!

Location: Red Cloud Road, Lincoln County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Gallinas Group Site
Description:
This site is in the Cibola National Forest.  There are no signs saying ‚Äúno camping‚Äù, ‚Äúno overnight‚Äù or ‚Äúday use only‚Äù.

Big wide open space with multiple fire rings. There are two large trash cans and clean pit toilets at the entrance.

There are lots of options off of this road and good T-mobile, AT&T and Verizon reception.

Location: Carl's Jr., West Arby Avenue, Spring Valley, Clark County, Nevada, 89113, United States
Name: Street Parking. W Arby Ave
Description: We parked on the side street of a big empty lot. No signs saying' no overnight parking'. Stayed a couple of nights without any issues. Close to lots of restaurants, grocery and shopping so super convenient. There were several semi-trucks parked and even a converted shuttle bus. Kind of noisy but we sleep with a sound machine and it was totally fine! Not a terrible view of the mountain range too so something decent to look at other than all the buildings and cars!

Location: Old Old RT-66, Yavapai County, Arizona, United States
Name: Hwy 66 loop campsite
Description: Perfect camp spot further off the highway, room for a few rigs. Many spots to choose from with fire pits. Stayed for a night in beginning of December.

Location: Hackamore Road, Apache Junction, Pinal County, Arizona, 85270, United States
Name: Pull off near Apache Junction
Description: Lots of pull offs along this road. Quite a few trailers and some tents. If you want to be a bit further away from others, this spot is great. You can still hear some genies running but quiet otherwise. Great view of the mountains. Road has a lot of big holes so need to take it slowly. Fire rings of stone already set up. Don‚Äôt forget to take your trash with you when you leave.

Location: Buffalo Prairie Drive, Cooper County, Missouri, 65322, United States
Name: Roberts Bluff
Description: gravel road not far from I-70. this is a public fishing spot with boat ramp access. Any low clearance vehicle could make it to the spot. 3 primitive mostly flat campsites with parking spots (of various sizes) and fire rings along the Lamine river. spent one night here in a van and had no problems. there was one other vehicle here overnight as well. minimal trash and a bit of highway traffic noise, but way better than sleeping in a parking lot. got 4 bars of Verizon service.

Location: Donahoe Spur Road, Engineer Springs, San Diego County, California, 91917, United States
Name: Otay Camp
Description:
Nice spot on a hillside in the San Ysidro mountains with a fire ring. We‚Äôve stayed here four nights over the course of a month and have never had any issues, wind is mild, 3 bars service for Verizon and att.  On weekends there is some traffic on the surrounding trails and the occasional border patrol truck goes by but all in all very peaceful.
If you try to get here using google maps it‚Äôll bring you to a locked BLM gate but if you continue on to the Otay mountain trailhead you‚Äôll be able to find your way.

Location: 885, West Washington Avenue, Sunnyvale, Santa Clara County, California, 94807, United States
Name: Washington park
Description: Stayed here two nights without any issues. No signs posted and other cars in the parking lot. Quiet and appears safe.

Location: FR 11, Marion County, Florida, United States
Name: Pull off spot
Description: Secluded, easy access for one van or small to midsize RV. Take NE 231st Ave north off 40 for one quarter mile. Spot on right side of road.  3.7 miles west of Juniper Springs recreation area. Dark and quiet except for occasional car passing.

Location: Spur 406, Val Verde County, Texas, United States
Name: Amistad free boondocking spur 406
Description: This is the actual location for free boondocking at spur 406. Head down a dirt road after the last campsite, several pullouts along the way and a big turnaround at the end so could handle big rigs. no lake view or easy access to the lake -simply drive down spur 406 for that- , but really quiet and peaceful.

Location: Tate's Hell State Forest High Bluff Coastal Hiking Trail West Loop Trailhead, US 98;US 319, Green Point, Franklin County, Florida, United States
Name: High Bluff Coastal Hiking Trail West Trailhead
Description: Small unpaved parking lot far off the main road. Narrow drive best suited for van or small camper. VERY quiet, no signs posted prohibiting overnight parking or camping. Stayed 12/19/21, would return if I‚Äôm in the area again.

Location: San Jon Community Center, Oak Avenue, San Jon, Quay, New Mexico, 88434, United States
Name: San Jon Community Park
Description: Great spot just off of I-40.  Clean level spots. Sign verified overnight stays are welcome.  Felt safe. Close to fuel and Post office. Tables with shade covers and some trees.

Location: North 12th Street, El Centro, Imperial County, California, 92243, United States
Name: Street parking
Description:
I was driving in the city and saw a spot where a few people (diesels, and rv‚Äôs) were parked along the street for the night. 12th street dead-end.
It‚Äôs less stinky then the Walmart with the sewage water. 
Close to target, Walmart, Costco, Lowes, dollar store, and much more 
Full AT&T 5g service

Location: Waterstone Outdoors, North Court Street, Fayetteville, Fayette County, West Virginia, 25840, United States
Name: Fayetteville Huse Memorial Park
Description: Spent a night here in our van. No signs about no overnight parking found (other streets had them but the park did not). We pulled towards the back behind the baseball field and it was very quiet. Nobody bothered us and we left early in the AM.

Location: Hidden River Parkway, Tampa, Hillsborough County, Florida, 33637, United States
Name: Park n Ride Lot off i75
Description: Easy overnight parking in any empty lot. Lot is for the park n ride bus service. Can fit any size rig but some kind if low trees at the entrance. Clean up after yourself and be discreet if possible.

Location: Yuma County, Arizona, 85352, United States
Name: Patch of desert about a mile south of Tacna, off I8
Description: Take the exit for Tacna and head south. The road quickly turns to loose rutted washboard sand and might be impassable when wet. 2wd should be able to manage. About a mile down the road, you see a sign for Dept of Defense land in front and to the right. Don't go there! Note the "Unexploded Ordinance" warning! Instead, turn left on a dirt road and in a short distance, there are numerous flat firm spots to camp on. I could here the interstate noise and what I suspect was a drone patrolling the border going back and forth, but noise eventually subsided and was quiet after. Not very scenic or interesting, but a good spot to park for the night.

Location: 49, Bear Canyon Road, Otero County, New Mexico, 88339, United States
Name: Middle of Nowhere NM
Description: Big open spot with large fire pit.  Plenty of room for 3-5 vehicles.  Parked our Jeep, Explorer, and overland trailer.  Super windy‚Ä¶gorgeous views.  NO Internet.

Location: 4007, Encinal Canyon Road, Malibu, Los Angeles County, California, 90265, United States
Name: Sunset Point - pull out
Description:
Nice gravel pull out on Encimal Canyon Road. No parking restrictions 

Not really flat but ok with our van

Nice view of the ocean on sunset, a lot of people during that period of the day, but really quiet after that (only one other van). The road is also quiet during the night

Verizon OK, no other services

Location: Southside Connector Service Road, Jacksonville, Duval County, Florida, 32260, United States
Name: Cracker Barrel
Description: Cracker barrel parking lot. Some road noise. No RV designated spots.

Location: East Hewitt Station Road, Pinal County, Arizona, United States
Name: national forest land
Description: nice view.  need high clearance vehicle.  there is a fire ring.  there are other spots in the general vicinity.

Location: Round the Mountain Trail, Warwick, Franklin County, Massachusetts, 01378, United States
Name: Mount Grace State Forest Parking Lot
Description:
A large parking lot at the base of Mount Grace State Forest. There are unstaffed ranger buildings nearby as well as a small shelter for hikers that has electricity and lights. Very quiet and dark at night. 

Multiple trails to summit the mountain or go around it. Many good spots for tent camping including in a field next to the parking lot.

Location: Monticello Shopping Center, Monticello Avenue, Williamsburg, Williamsburg (city), Virginia, 23185, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description:
Some street parking just outside some apartment complexes. Plenty of other cars parked along the street so one can blend right in like they belong. 

If you can nab a street spot in between the apartment buildings, all the better. Otherwise, you are on the road and noise becomes a bit of a concern. 

Overall, a place to consider if others end up getting shut down or heavily policed.

Location: Alamo Road, Chaves County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Alamo Road
Description: Down this road is Shooting range for the locals but there's lot of side roads for some quite camping Must be self contained No amenities No trash can No water Pack in Pack out 20mins from Roswell Beautiful Desert Pecos diamonds all around Stay Away from the road you'll be cover in dust

Location: Cottonwood Springs Road, Riverside County, California, United States
Name: Joshua Tree south power lines
Description: Road parallels power lines. There is a site at each power line tower. Road is on both sides of the highway

Location: Point of Rocks roadside park, Point of Rocks Roadside Park, Jeff Davis County, Texas, United States
Name: Point of Rocks
Description: Of all the rest stops I have been to this is clearly the best. The rocks are spectacular and offer some amazing opportunities to do some bouldering. There are picknik tables and trash and but no water. There is ample space for all types of rigs. It feels much more like a campground than a rest stop.

Location: Graham County, Arizona, United States
Name: Black Hills Rockhound Area,  BLM land.
Description: Many nice camping spots for RVs, trailers or tents, though a little rocky in places for tents. Beautiful views. Great fire agate, agate and chalcedony rockhounding area. So many cool looking rocks! Nice and quiet. Most people come for the day, a few camp here. Plenty of room not to be bothered. We camped just before the main camping area and had it all to ourselves for a week.

Location: 8009F, Freeman, Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: Freeman Rd. BLM- Sonoran Natl. Mon.
Description: Numerous BLM truly dispersed camping sites. Just of I-8 at Freeman Rd exit. I got 1 mile in easily with my SUV and 25 ft snowmobile to tiny home conversion. No other RVs in sight although there were 10 other rigs here. This is a huge place. T-mobile 5G 4 bars super fast.

Location: Parole Mine, Pipeline Road, Luna County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Luna County
Description:
Could fit multiple RVs here. There are fire rings too. No service though! Discovered this while looking at the abandoned mines and ruins down the road.

EDIT Nov 28th, 2023: two bars 4g w/Verizon.

Location: North Castle Hot Springs Road, Peoria, Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: Baldy Mountain Recreational Area
Description: Free camping near the gun range. Lots of broken glass and bullet casings. Beautiful mountain views and frequent Burro sightings.

Location: Aucilla Landing, Aucilla Landing Road, Taylor County, Florida, 32336, United States
Name: Aucilla Boat Ramp
Description: This ramp is a different place from the other Aucilla posting, at least the photos are different. Here, this is in a small area on a small river with a boat ramp, portajohn, table and looks great for kayaking and bass fishing. Be quiet and respectful as people live on this river. No sunsets from here but it is a beautiful spot for one night.

Location: 18208, US 90, Ryan, Presidio County, Texas, 79843, United States
Name: Picnic area
Description: Picnic area, stay 1 night, nobody bothers me. Grill, shadow, no sign. Good AT&T.

Location: Shadmoor State Park, Montauk Point State Parkway, Montauk, Town of East Hampton, Suffolk County, New York, 11954, United States
Name: shadmoor state trail
Description: Parking at the beginning of a trail, no sign no overnight so we stayed 1 night in winter, road noise but not too much in the middle of the night

Location: 14601, Old State Road 4A, Monroe County, Florida, 33042, United States
Name: End of the State Road 939A on Sugarloaf Key
Description: Dead end 2 lane road. Leads to one walking trail. Parking spots only for cars, SUVs, motorcycles, bicycles, vehicles <20‚Äô, RVs that can do 3 pt turns. See photo. Nothing larger than 20‚Äô including buses, trailers, trucks and cargo vans.

Location: Corps Road, Clark County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Iron Mountain Trail Parking
Description: Quiet, large gravel parking area away from the main road. One of a few different parking areas in the Iron Mountain trail system, but this one was close to trails we were interested in. Lots of trails that take you to the edge of DeGray lake and they were excellent for a morning jog. We heard one car drive by in the morning. No one bothered us, very quiet, no signs prohibiting overnight parking. Had the whole park to ourselves and really enjoyed our stay. Medium Verizon signal.

Location: Exxon, FM 11, Bakersfield, Pecos County, Texas, United States
Name: 24 Miles To Next Station
Description:
This is an empty lot behind the Exxon station on the North side of the highway. It is set back a little further from the road so you don't hear as much of the road noise. Stayed here one night because we didn't have enough gas to make it to the next station, and the two stations at this exit were dry until morning. 

The lot is very level, shared it with a few rigs and semis. Plenty of room for bigger setups.

4 bars on verizon with high throughput.
The gas station has a porta-jon and two flush toilets (when they are open). Nice sunsets!

Location: Burro Creek Camp Ground Road, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: Pull out Along abandoned Burro Creek Ground rd.
Description:
Pull-off of Burro Creek  Ground rd which is a un-maintained old rd , a continuation rd where Burro Creek BLM Campground is located.
Level spot,  spacious with great views but can hear the hwy 93 noise,  otherwise peaceful . There is a fire ring. Others have infrequently used this nice spot.

Location: 1, Old Ferry Dock Road, Magnolia Bluffs, Franklin County, Florida, 32328, United States
Name: Old Ferry dock
Description: Gravel parking with water view, no service, no sign "no overnight parking" but not sure if it is legal to stay here. You can here the noise of the cars from the road in the distance, other than that a fairly nice place.

Location: 648, Industrial Drive, Railroad Square Art Park, Tallahassee, Leon County, Florida, 32310, United States
Name: Rail Road Square
Description: Several big parking spots between art galeries, antiques stores, graffiti murals. Several caf√©s in the area, that close early at night. Quiet, no service.

Location: I 10, Lake City, Columbia County, Florida, 32055, United States
Name: Warmouth Pond Osceola National Forest
Description: A big flat terrain next to a small lake. The access road is muddy, don't drive there after rain unless you have a good 4x4. Because of the deep potholes not recommended for vehicles with low clearance. No services but beautiful reflection of the trees in the morning, I assume that it is good to swim in summer time. Good cell phone signal.

Location: National Forest Rd 108, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Arizona Stairs
Description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This place started as a spot with wrong GPS coordinates. See first check-in for original description. 'New' description below; please update if not factual.

This place is excellent: it's a forest road with only a couple of campsites and they are very clearly defined. you can't drive off the road except on the few offshoot dirt tracks that each lead to a single campsite. There maybe 4 but it maybe only three. It's a beautiful mountainous spot with great temperature right now in mid June. I highly recommend it but I wouldn't show up at dark because I'm guessing the few spots get taken up. It's a perfectly drivable gravel forest road but it's a decent trek out to not get a spot if you are scrambling at the end of the day. I definitely recommend it but with those considerations.

Location: Alamo Road, Chaves County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Alamo rd pulloff
Description: a pulloff right off Alamo rd.  Alamo rd is unpaved so there were not a lot of cars going by.  some cars went by late in the afternoon and some in the morning, but at night it was quiet.  did hear shooting in the distance in the afternoon, but that also stopped once it got dark, it's from the Nike W10 Missile site most likely.  Perfect Tmobile TG signal.

Location: 376, South Llano Street, Fredericksburg, Gillespie County, Texas, 78624, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description:
Empty, quiet, dead-end street. 
10min walk from heart of Maine St. 
Groceries and public park w restroom right across the street.
we stayed one night in our 26ft skoolie, very quiet!!

Location: 1101, West Kill Road, Town of Blenheim, Schoharie County, New York, 12093, United States
Name: Burnt Rossman State Forest - Westkill Campsite
Description: Established DEC primitive Campsite. Accessible year round. Westkill Rd is a nice paved rd & plowed in the winter. Nice size firepit. Easy to pull truck with rv right into site. Alongside the Betty brook. Nice spot! No cell service on Verizon.

Location: Old US Highway 89, Garfield County, Utah, 84735, United States
Name: Riverside #2
Description: Couldn‚Äôt get into the river spot up the road (about a foot of snow with no tracks, February 2nd) so I checked satellite and found this gem. Very short road in with one muddy section was able to plow through the frozen snow. River access & big enough for several rigs. Spent all weekend here and only saw one truck drive old hwy 89. Some far noise from main hwy. amazing stars, golden pink rock formations in distance, abundant sunshine and nice trees. Many spot along the old hwy. fast T-Mobile service

Location: East Park Link Drive, Pinal County, Arizona, 85246, United States
Name: BLM/AZ trust land
Description: Nice area in the Saguaros right on a fence line between AZ Trust land and BLM.

Location: Lelong Drive, Faubourg St. John, New Orleans, Orleans Parish, Louisiana, 70119, United States
Name: Street parking along LeLond Dr, avenue going to NOMA
Description: Access to beautiful City Park, no parking restriction on Lelong Dr. Stayed there 2nights, changing spot in between. Quiet at night but cars going and coming in the evening. Also a great parking base during the day, to ride your bike to neighborhoods. 5km away from Vieux Quartier Francais, great bike ride . Toilets in the park, further East of this place, beside the school

Location: LA 27, Holly Beach, Cameron Parish, Louisiana, United States
Name: old parking
Description: Nice place to stay. An other one some miled to tve north. Stay 1 night.

Location: Happy Camp Canyon Road, Cochise County, Arizona, United States
Name: Indian Bread Rocks further down the road
Description: if you don't find spots near the front of the Dispersed Camping area keep following the road back. The road will become rocky, if you feel comfortable keep going. We navigated this in a Promaster and found a few more spots further back.

Location: 688, Hygeia Avenue, Leucadia, Encinitas, San Diego County, California, 92024, United States
Name: Hygeia Street Parking
Description: We had no problem parking here overnight with our 18ft camper trailer. Arrived 4:30 pm and left 9am. Quite a quiet street, everyone walks their dogs here.10 min walk to a really nice beach. Lots of restaurants and shops.

Location: 1598, Shady Hollow Boulevard West, Golden Gate Estates, Collier County, Florida, 34120, United States
Name: Crew bird Rookery Swamp
Description: don't stay in the trail parking. we stayed at the end of the gravel road and a frindly Police officer told us, thats fine. Theres a lot of wildlife around, snakes, alligator, bears... wake up to the sounds of the birds. not for big rigs. Pit toilets on the trail head.

Location: Pinal County, Arizona, United States
Name: Farther down the wash, blm sites dispersed
Description: Many pull offs around this section of blm. We choose a far site down the wash. Many larger rigs in the beginning of the road but you have ability to go as far as your vehicle allows as the road gets more difficult as you continue. Surprisingly a lot of privacy here

Location: 31, Huntington, Frances, Northwood, Irvine, Orange County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 92620, United States
Name: Orchard Park
Description: There aren‚Äôt any ‚Äúno parking‚Äù signs directly in front of the park. There are apartments complexes across the street which often make it ideal to stay a night or two. Clean bathrooms and plenty of space to walk your dogs if needed.

Location: Trivia Drive, Evans Estates, Cabot, Lonoke County, Arkansas, 72023, United States
Name: Trivia Drive
Description: Right off of Arkansas HWY 5. You will get some highway noise at night. Don‚Äôt be surprised to see and 18 Wheeler as they typically park here as well as some passenger vehicles. Overall fairly dark at night. 24 Hour gas station nearby as well.

Location: South Cheyenne Avenue, Oakshire, Tulsa, Tulsa County, Oklahoma, 74119, United States
Name: Boondocking Tulsa
Description:
Location is not exact but somewhere along Cheyenne street and no further north than 16th street. It's very residential and I wasn't able to find a spot that felt between houses but it works for an evening or two. I would probably say this is best for stealth set ups. Not loud but not quiet but the closest free overnight I could find to downtown. 

There's a Planet Fitness a few miles down that seems to be
very good for non stealth set ups btw.

Location: Crazy Horse Road, Eddy County, New Mexico, 88221, United States
Name: BLM land hackberry
Description: nice level area on BLM land near hackberry 100

Location: CAL Fire San Bernardino Unit, California, United States
Name: Sheephole Valley Wilderness
Description:
Fantastic sunrises and sunsets. Hiking the nearby boulders is incredible.

Please please carry out what you bring in.  Thank you.  Let‚Äôs keep our planet beautiful.

Location: Painted Canyon Road, Riverside County, California, United States
Name: Painted Canyon Road
Description:
Parking and camping spot, Good place to stop, 2 hours from Mexicali. Nestled in the canyon. Some washboard to get there, sandy road but doable with any vehicle. Lots of spots to camp.
We camped when you enter the place. On the right are the pit toilets and when you go straight you can camp behind a rock off the access road

Location: 28927, Plaza Drive, Merced County, California, 95322, United States
Name: Side Street
Description: An empty side street by empty commercial property behind truck stops. Wide street with parking on both sides. Trucks and RVs down both sides. More quiet than truck stop lots. Not a bad nights sleep, hwy not far away but far enough that sound isn‚Äôt bad.

Location: Eddy County, New Mexico, 88268, United States
Name: blm near whites city
Description: nice pull off place after passing devils playground. 2wd rv was fine but bumpy.  peaceful and beautiful

Location: American Girl Mine Road, Imperial County, California, United States
Name: American Girl Mine
Description: Acres and acres if BLM. Easy access and flat land

Location: [FR 1847] **4WD**, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85290, United States
Name: Beeline Phoenix
Description: Several spots exist along this forest road. it seems like it would be busy with offroaders during the weekends. No other campers on a weekday. Gun range nearby but was not to disturbing, in this area.

Location: 15175, Eagle Nest Lane, Miami Lakes, Miami-Dade County, Florida, 33014, United States
Name: Stealth camp
Description: Plenty of free street parking at night. Stealth ideal.

Location: 9501, Avenue B, Bombay Beach, Imperial County, California, 92257, United States
Name: Bombay Beach
Description:
Open lot right on the beach. Several other vehicles here - skoolies, vans, trucks, small RVs. No amenities other than one trash can. Not sure about safety if no other overlanders are around. But it felt safe to me with the community. 

Look for the star and you know you‚Äôve found the right place.

Restaurant and store nearby (about 1/2 mile).

Gravelly lot wouldn‚Äôt be so good for tenting.

Location: 2600, Smallwood Road, McDuffie County, Georgia, 30824, United States
Name: Clarks Hill WMA
Description: Good free spot managed by Georgia WMA and close to lake. Dozens of free camping spots and not crowded.

Location: Kool Corner, Yuma County, Arizona, United States
Name: Boondocking spot 4 miles before Mittry Lake
Description: Just left 4.5 miles before Mittry lake. From 95 drive 8 miles on the 7 avenue turn left on the metal bridge and you just have the choice of the level. We used this spot since 2017 wonderful view of agriculture land. Good phone and antenna reception.

Location: Coal Road, Augusta County, Virginia, 22952, United States
Name: Coal road
Description: several camping and pull off sites on Cole road, several creek crossings.

Location: 50 Year Trail, Pima County, Arizona, 85739, United States
Name: Near 50 Year Trail
Description: This is one of the spots on state land. Permit required. Quite good views. Good connection to 50 Year Trail. 2 bars Verizon. High clearance recommended. May not be suitable for very big rigs because the road is narrow and has some rough parts.

Location: Puerto Canyon Road, Santa Cruz County, Arizona, United States
Name: Mesquite Grove
Description: Large clearing next to a dry creek surrounded by Mesquite trees. Pretty views. Shady with fire ring. Minimal 5g/LTE on T-Mobile.

Location: Pinal County, Arizona, United States
Name: Near Gila River
Description: land with lots of space and fire ring, access to the river.

Location: Lee Street, Wragg Borough Homes, Charleston, Charleston County, South Carolina, 29424, United States
Name: Martin Luther King pool
Description: This is a community park area with unrestricted street parking (except 3rd Thursdays 1030a1230p) around the block . it's quiet for a nice rest. plenty of green space for pet walking.

Location: Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: Sentinel Volcanic Field
Description: Great spot! The road in is well graded and not washboarded, however this was the first real spot off the road once onto BLM land (about 1.5 mi on gravel). There were a couple small spots directly on the road but this one is quite large and flat, and could fit many vehicles. Only downside is that there's a steep bank to get off the road so limits those with low clearance and/or longer rigs or trailers. Highway noise is minimal and the train is far enough away that it wasn't bothersome. Not a single vehicle went by on the road for the two days we were here over the weekend. Great signal: full bars on TMobile and Google Fi.

Location: 229, Mimosa Drive, Lake Daniel, Greensboro, Guilford County, North Carolina, 27403, United States
Name: Off Street Parking
Description: A local informed me of a little gravel area off the end of Friendly avenue.  Moved during day hours but parked two nights here without issue.

Location: Franconia Road, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: BLM just off I-40
Description: Several other rigs here. Lots of spaces along the road. The road up to the hill is a little steep at first but no problem. Good cell phone.

Location: 789, Arsenal Place, Water Avenue Historic District, Selma, Dallas County, Alabama, 36701, United States
Name: Church Street Boondocking
Description:
It is a public street right off downtown Selma. Quiet enough on a weekday night and it felt very safe. Try to park between houses and or arrive late, leave early.

Big rigs are probably fine!

Location: 30th Street South, Chestnut Hill Historic District, Highland Residence Park, Birmingham, Jefferson County, Alabama, 35233, United States
Name: Street Parking Off Red Cat Coffee
Description: Street Parking on 4th Ave and 33 street. Quiet enough neighborhood and felt very safe. It's within walking distance of downtown, good for a couple of days. Stealth feels 100% optional.

Location: 7135, Sunrise Highway, Laguna Junction, Mount Laguna, CAL Fire San Diego Unit, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 91962, United States
Name: Pull out
Description: Went to the S1 pull out down the road and it was super windy there, found this pullout to be more out of the wind and a lot calmer. Stayed 1 night no problem, only 1 car pulled up around 8pm for an hour and then left and after that it was just me for the night.

Location: 1846, Six Mile Highway, Pickens County, South Carolina, 29630, United States
Name: Issaqueena Trailhead
Description: Parked here overnight. On a circular loop next to several trailheads. No posted "no camping" signs. It was relatively quiet all night. Nestled right in the forest. A decent little parking spot.

Location: 436, Recreation Road 7, Tilden, McMullen County, Texas, 78072, United States
Name: Near Boat Ramp
Description:
Paved loop in the wood with trails to the lake. Very quiet. More quiet than the boat ramp, because the fishermen come very early in the morning. Otherwise it‚Äôs ok. It was on the weekend, so maybe on weekdays, it‚Äôs quieter.
Bushes/thorns on loop are very overgrown. I wouldn't drive it if you cared about your paint job but totally doable otherwise

Location: Socorro Valley Bosque Trail, Socorro, Socorro County, New Mexico, 87802, United States
Name: Turnaround with Campsite
Description: A small turnaround at the end of a dirt road with a campsite under the trees, camp site had a picnic table and fire ring. Turnaround might be tough for big rigs. Had several cars come by through the night but all turned around and left. Quieter and more private than the nearby site, same site as is mentioned in the comments on the other site.

Location: 1498, Grand Army of the Republic Highway, Bishop, Inyo County, California, 93514, United States
Name: Bishop
Description: Large parking area on the side of Highway 6

Location: 245, Northwest 31st Street, Wynwood, Miami, Miami-Dade County, Florida, 33127, United States
Name: Free Overnight Street Parking in Wynwood
Description: Free overnight street parking 10-15 minutes walk north from Wynwood Arts District. This is in front of houses so be mindful and respectful. No use of awnings/camp sets/exterior stuff, etc. Quiet area out of the hustle of the arts district.

Location: Little Bay Conservation Area, Orchard Street, Pope Beach, Fairhaven, Bristol County, Massachusetts, 02719, United States
Name: Little bay conservation area
Description:
a small car park.  there are tables for eating.  there is also a boardwalk to reach the ocean.
quiet the night. There are only two wind turbine near.

Location: River Street, Drayton Street, Savannah Historic District, Savannah, Chatham County, Georgia, 31412, United States
Name: River St.
Description: 2 hr parking spot from 8am-6pm but free overnight parking. Right on river street with a great view of the river.

Location: 1003, Maple Street, Bandera, Bandera County, Texas, 78003, United States
Name: Bandera
Description: As there wasn't any places recorded in the centre of Bandera we added this one. Flat large spot on the side of the road near playground for children and public barbecues. Few minutes walk to main city attractions and shops. Very calm near the river. Very few cars passing by. Deer and squirrels all around.

Location: Spur 406, Val Verde County, Texas, United States
Name: End of road 406
Description: A nice little spot at the end of the road. We pulled off the road into the Rocky Beach area for the first three nights. The wind got pretty bad on the third night so we ended up moving further up where there was more tree coverage to break up the wind. I do not recommend parking on this if it‚Äôs raining heavily or has rained recently. Toilets available, 20 minute walk away We‚Äôve got a sprinter 170 and we did just fine, I‚Äôd be cautious for anything super big though as you may not be able to turn around down here Border patrol checked on us multiple times and never told us to leave or bothered us . Border patrol planes fly over here through the day when it‚Äôs not cloudy Update: stayed for a week and a half in the area, all but 2 nights here. I loved this place, got to meet some lovely nomads as well Check out ‚ÄúThe Gym‚Äù in Del Rio if you need a good workout, they‚Äôre the only proper bodybuilding gym we‚Äôve found since leaving our hometown.

Location: Boise County, Idaho, United States
Name: Road side pull through
Description: Road side pull through with berm between road. Next to river. Flat. Semi private.

Location: 150, North Wisconsin Street, Gunnison, Gunnison County, Colorado, 81230, United States
Name: Overnight street parking all over downtown
Description: Signage is ‚Äú2 hours, 8am-5pm except Sunday & holiday‚Äù through much of downtown. Good for an overnight if your vehicle is stealth. I like this spot on N Wisconsin St. A single parking spot all by itself, so no one will park next to you.

Location: Big Dunes Road, Nye County, Nevada, United States
Name: Almost to big dune
Description: On the road to big dune. You can see the highway but can‚Äôt hear it. Showed up late at night and didn‚Äôt want to keep driving. Some people driving to and from Big Dune but didn‚Äôt bother us! Great spot, good cell service. Washboard road all the way to big dune but easy with 2wd.

Location: Pima County, Arizona, United States
Name: BLM Oak Tree in Las Cienegas Nat Con.  Empire Ranch area
Description: Great road for any rig to get to.  Lots of space.  Open and cows around.  Potable toilets only.  Flat.

Location: South Avenue 52 1/2 East, Yuma County, Arizona, United States
Name: S Ave 52¬Ω East, east of Yuma AZ
Description: The road had been graded and this was the only place we could cross over the gravel berm. It is a nice place with dozens of BLM disbursed camping spots, all level, and a few with fire rings. There are some shrubs.  Far enough away from I8 and train tracks to not hear them at night. We had the place to ourselves. 1 or 2 bars of Verizon.

Location: Everitt Memorial Highway, Siskiyou County, CAL Fire Northern Region, California, 96067, United States
Name: Sand Flat Adjacent
Description: Large single flat site with 2 fire rings right off the road in Shasta Wilderness. Site is big enough for several vehicles and we had plenty of space to turn around with our 13‚Äô trailer. However, it is probably not big enough for multiple unrelated groups. When pulled all the way back into the site the trees provide a nice break from the road noise. It is on the right hand side of the road just before the upper Sand Flat Road turnoff when going East (uphill).

Location: Hidalgo County, New Mexico, United States
Name: BLM land in the NM desert
Description:
Beautiful desert boondocking about 1/4 mile off Rt 90 on Thompson Canyon Rd. Markers say it is BLM land. no need to verify, see the photo. An employee drove by and waved hello. 360 degree views of the mountains and desert. Pristine, NO Trash anywhere, the way it should be. Nice hiking along gas line or electric post trail.
A lot of bleached bones, which I love to discover. We found a horse skeleton! 

Wide NM sky full of stars at night, yipping coyotes at dusk. Quiet, no highway noise. I love this state. Stars are so bright and the milky way is painting the sky with sparkles. A beautiful planetarium.

Location: State Route 606, Nottoway County, Virginia, United States
Name: Lake Lee Boat Launch
Description: Public boat launch area. Circular paved area for easy turning. We have a 8 meter travel trailer. Informed by a local at Nottoway Courthouse that it was good place to park. This is early April so there is a lot of space for our unit without interfering with the launch area.

Location: 2400, Upper Dorray Road, Glencoe, Calaveras County, California, 95232, United States
Name: Dirt Road Junction
Description: Connection point of 4 dirt roads, wide open dirt area in the middle. Pulled our truck off to the side, set up 1 tent, and stayed the whole night. Not one single car drive by for the duration of our stay. Nice view of the mountains on both sides as well. A couple bars of cell service with Verizon and at@t

Location: 13488, Monte Vista Avenue, Chino, San Bernardino County, California, 91710, United States
Name: Monte Vista Ave
Description: Half residential & half commercial complex. The commercial side of the street has tons of available parking with no signs. Many residents seem to park their spare cars on this side of the street. Even saw a camper doing the same as me. The road is long so you have options. Quiet at night with minimal traffic. But picks up around 7am. Not bad for a nightly spot if passing through.

Location: Rone Bailey Mesa, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: Dispersed near Looking Glass Rd
Description:
This spot is at the end of a dirt track to the south of Looking Glass Rd. The road is easily accessible for medium clearance passenger vehicles/vans and camper trailers. RVs I'm unsure, there's a higher grassy middle to the road and a few dips/slanted sections. There's a loop turn around at the end with a fire ring. The spot puts you nestled in between sandstone formations.
2-3 bars Verizon LTE, no water, toilets, or other amenities.

Location: 13703, US 49, Flora, Hinds County, Mississippi, 39209, United States
Name: Pocahontas Mounds Rest Area
Description: Pocahontas Mounds Rest Area is situated between the 2 lanes of the highway.  It is a historical landmark so it has 24 hr security. There are clean bathrooms. Pets allowed. Room for 5 large rigs. From website: This rectangular platform mound, 175 feet across at the base and about 22 feet high, was built and used during the Mississippian period, between 1000 and 1300 A.D. Remains of a mud-plastered log-post building have been found atop the mound. This structure was used as a ceremonial temple or as a residence of a chief. An extensive former village area surrounds the mound. The site has been incorporated into a roadside park.

Location: Mendocino County, California, United States
Name: Riverside
Description: off of a frontage road of Hwy 101 by a rive, among the trees. Private and quiet... a little traffic noise from the 101. Good for a 25 foot or less RV/van... not a trailer. We loved this spot!

Location: AZ 89A, Yavapai County, Arizona, United States
Name: Outside Sedona
Description: It‚Äôs a nice place and has trails for hiking . It has a lot of space for the big rigs. We recommend this place.

Location: Cabrillo Highway, Cambria, San Luis Obispo County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 93435, United States
Name: Harmony Headlands overflow parking
Description: Coming from the South (Morro Bay), all the pull-offs from Highway 1 have a ‚ÄúNo overnight parking‚Äù sign until just South of this spot where there is a sign ‚ÄúEnd of no overnight parking‚Äù. This is a pull-off on the left of the Highway (ocean-side) with no ocean view. Just rolling hills and obviously the sound of traffic on Highway 1, which is not too bad. It is not quite level, but nothing a block won‚Äôt fix.

Location: Clarence K Kelly Pavilion, East 1st Street, Woodbine, Camden County, Georgia, United States
Name: Waterfront Park And Boat Ramp
Description: Toilet, water, garbage trash, nice waterfront view. Under the bridge but not noisy. No advertising about 'no overnight' parking.

Location: Devils Hole Road, Shenandoah County, Virginia, United States
Name: Devils hole mountain
Description: beautiful spot on top of the ridge off route 691 (judge rye road) close to devils hole mountain. flat grassy spot with a fire pit and views that keep going.

Location: Hot Springs LTVA, Evan Hewes Highway, Imperial County, California, United States
Name: BLM Spot across the road from the Hot Springs
Description: Hard packed sand and easy for any vehicle to drive in . There‚Äôs lots of places to camp and even some spots with Shade. I think you can stay here for free for 14 days . Also Verizon 2 bars 5G !

Location: South Main Street, Lone Pine, Inyo County, California, 93545, United States
Name: Truck pull off
Description: Very large flat gravel lot between the Quality Inn and the Chevron. We stopped here on our way out of Death Valley NP. There were about a dozen trucks parked here overnight and also a very good taco truck! It was quiet with road noise and no one bothered us .

Location: Belleau Wood Lane, South Land Park, Sacramento, Sacramento County, California, 95822, United States
Name: Belleau Wood Lane
Description: Industrial zone across the road from Sacramento Executive Airport. Plenty of free parking for vehicles of all sizes along Belleau Wood Ln, Thiery Rd, 47th Ave and the west side of Freeport Blvd down to the entrance of Maloney golf course. Obviously there are some long-term campers here already but plenty of room to spread out for privacy. Sacramento Police Department is just a few blocks down the road. A nice, new 24 hour Arco gas station conveniently located here.

Location: Walnut St & 7th St, Walnut Street, Boulder, Boulder County, Colorado, 80302, United States
Name: Canyon Point Free Parking
Description: There are a lot of places nearby that are 2 hour parking, but there are 2 spots that are unmarked  in front of Canyon Center 735 building. I parked here for over 24 hours and was never bothered. Super safe feeling, 3 minutes walking to all the best downtown boulder restaurants and coffee shops. (Trident coffee is amazing, space for fast internet and room to spread out). Cheers!

Location: 90, Means Road, Eddy County, New Mexico, 88220, United States
Name: BLM near Carlsbad Caverns
Description: Yet another spot off of the highway near the caverns, in case the others are taken. Nearby to some private land and within view of a farmhouse but definitely within BLM area. A few trucks drove by from nearby properties but you can't hear highway noise. Very flat large area big enough for an RV and tons of service on Verizon. Windy and dusty like all of the other sites around here.

Location: Old U.S. Route 93, Garnet, Clark County, Nevada, United States
Name: Road behind Love‚Äôs
Description: Used my coordinates to get here. I was trying to find a quiet spot away from the trucks and found a good one! No one bothered me, super quiet, and someone else parked a few thousand feet behind me. Basically a gravel road that can accommodate many rv‚Äôs big or small. So much better than Love‚Äôs noisy lot.

Location: US 60, Red Hill, Catron County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Rest Area on US60 near AZ/NM border
Description: NM rest area, lots of room for any RV, a few picnic tables, no restrooms

Location: Valley of the Gods Road, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: Valley of the gods
Description: Awesome large secluded spot far enough away from the road and dust. Two fire pits. Perfect for our sprinter

Location: 113, Lakehurst Street, Roosevelt Heights, Greenville, Greenville County, South Carolina, 29607, United States
Name: Cleveland Park
Description: Street parking along Cleveland Park.  Level ground. No signs prohibiting overnight parking

Location: Otero County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Dog Canyon Dispersed Camping
Description: Huge spot with lots of places to park. Big rig friendly. Saw a few buses here. Gorgeous Mountain Views and sunsets. No amenities on site other than rock-made fire pits. But just up the street, there‚Äôs a campground with water and a dump station just outside their entrance. A few of us at Dog Canyon used that with no issues.

Location: Noisy Water Winery, Rio Street, Ruidoso, Lincoln County, New Mexico, 88345, United States
Name: Public Parking
Description: Public Parking lot behind main tourist street.  Sits right above the river where elk can be watched feeding.  2 bars Verizon signal.  Lighted parking lot.  2 other cars parked for the night but not sure they were sleeping in them.  Quiet, no disturbances. No signs posted saying you can‚Äôt park overnight.  I think I may be here in off-season so that could be a favorable factor for my stay.

Location: Queens Highway, Eddy County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Sitting bull turnoff
Description: small NFS picnic area at the last turnoff to Sitting Bull recreation area. open desert views great for sunset, sunrise, moon and stars. full bars LTE. two covered picnic tables in a dirt lot. more traffic than expected on nearby highway but still quiet. stayed 1 night.

Location: Poverty Road, Kane County, Utah, 84758, United States
Name: Poverty Road
Description: Continuing along Poverty Road beyond the location labeled ‚ÄúBLM‚Äù, the road comes out of the trees again on the edge of another canyon. Giving views to the south. Multiple fire rings. Road just a little bumpy to here. Most vehicles could make it. Unless of course it rains. Then get out of there quickly.

Location: McKeever Trailhead, McKeever Road Spur, McKeever, Town of Webb, Herkimer County, New York, United States
Name: Black River Wild Forest- McKeever  Parking  Area
Description: Parking area for Jeep road to the right or walking trail to the left. 5-6  campsites, 1 on right suitable for truck camper. Not suitable for high or larger vans.

Location: Inyo County, California, United States
Name: East and West pad
Description: abandoned (out of biz) rv park off 190. two sites up a fairly rutted 300 yard road.  you can see the saddle from both directions on 190 .   spot on top of saddle has a cement pad and close to 360 views with some wind that knocks down the  heat.  sunset and sunrise views.  quiet, a little industrial but great spot!   does not require 4 wheel drive but ruts may limit access to some.

Location: 1020, Marron Valley Road, Engineer Springs, San Diego County, California, 91917, United States
Name: Site for one car with great view
Description: A site for one car on Ridge road. It has a great view. Google Fi LTE 1 bar.

Location: County Road A021, Luna County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Good Site Peak Wild Camp
Description: Nice flat spot off Barksdale Road/A021, about 10 miles from Highway 26 on BLM, just south of Good Site Peak. Coordinates take you off the road to established site with ample parking and a fire ring, nestled in rolling hills. We drove in after dark, gravel road well maintained. Watch for cows on the road. 3 bars of Verizon.

Location: KGB, Deschutes County, Oregon, United States
Name: FS 4604 Dispersed Camping
Description: Lots of camping beyond Phil's trailhead.  Drive down past where paved road ends.  I went right at the fork and had no issues with my 2WD promaster.   Good for small RV's and tents.  There are some larger spaces that may work for larger RV's.  Verizon and T-mobile worked in the spot I was in.  10-15 minute drive into Bend

Location: 804, 448th Road, Seward County, Nebraska, 68456, United States
Name: Smiths Creek Recreational Area
Description:
Recreational reservoir, small, with parking area for 5-6 vehicles, not suitable for big trailers, has picnic tables and vault toilet. 
Surrounded by farm lands.

Location: 1403, North Three Rocks Road, Three Rocks, Lincoln County, Oregon, 97368, United States
Name: Pull-off on quiet road off 101
Description: Quiet road off 101, some residential homes, but there are several pull offs away from homes. Stayed on a Friday night and not many cars drove by. Good for a night.

Location: Northshore Road, Clark County, Nevada, 89040, United States
Name: Free Camping at Poverty Flats AKA Snowbird Mesa
Description:
This free boondocking area is conveniently located between Valley of Fire State Park and Overton, Nevada on Route 169 and can accommodate numerous big rigs.
There are several entrances that lead to different fingers of this U.S. Bureau of Reclamation free camping area, hence the above coordinates. Mountain views and scenic canyons surrounded our campsite.¬†Full cell phone service.

Location: County Road 385, Logan County, Colorado, 80726, United States
Name: Tamarack Ranch State Wildlife Area
Description: Grassed lot suitable for any size rig, small trees on perimeter, vault toilet, at entrance to the wild life area. Lovely location.

Location: Inspiration Point Road, San Diego County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, United States
Name: inspiration Point Road
Description: An overlook parking spot just off the 79 a couple miles out of Julian. Room for about 4-6 vehicles.

Location: 40069, Oregon Coast Highway, Curry County, Oregon, 97465, United States
Name: Pull-out on the 101
Description: Huge paved area to the side of road. Easily fits double load semis. Usual highway noise, but actually further away than the two spots just north of here. Sadly not much view... but still something. More grass to the side of you have a dog.

Location: 905, Copper Drive, Macon County, North Carolina, 28741, United States
Name: Wilson Dam Wilderness Camping
Description:
I stumbled on this area while headed to the Blue Valley Dispersed camping area. This spot is much more secluded. High clearance vehicles needed to get to the best spots (4x4 recommend if it's recently rained). No cell service on Verizon or T-Mobile. No vehicle noise or light pollution. Just the babbling creek and singing wildlife. NFS land.

There are good camping areas at the end of each dirt road. 

One area is nice and open if you have solar panels you want to keep in the sun. First right after the road turns to gravel, then left at the Y (to the right is a narrow dirt road that turns into a walking trail after a small bridge. Very tight turn around here but doable in a 19' van).

Location: Issaquah Community Garden, Rainier Boulevard North, Issaquah, King County, Washington, 98029, United States
Name: Confluence Park Street Parking
Description: Nice park with plenty of overnight parking on surrounding streets. No 'no camping' signs seen, back-in parking for class b vans, Rainier Street parking for larger rigs. Bathroom and water in park, may not be open evenings or winter. Covered picnic area. 2 Block Walk to shops, restaurants

Location: US 95, Parker Junction, Needles, San Bernardino County, California, 92363, United States
Name: BLM - about 20 miles south of Needles on the 95
Description: Delightful spot in the shelter of basalt black rock outcrops - plenty of available dispersed campsites with adequate spacing in between sites

Location: Forest Route 1S03, Tuolumne County, California, United States
Name: spot off the forest road
Description: nice spot near the forest road. there is a nice mountain view and quite a big space for bigger vehicles, only problem can be with finding flat spot here but not very disturbing.

Location: 389, Reserve Street, Hot Springs, Garland County, Arkansas, 71901, United States
Name: Stealth camping spot beside Bathhouse Row
Description: We parked on Reserve Street. It‚Äôs fairly quiet and just a few minutes walk from downtown. Great LTE speed and only a 3 degree incline for our van. Perfect stealth camping spot if you want to bar hop and be right beside Hot Springs National Park!

Location: Canadian River Road, Potter County, Texas, United States
Name: River Campsite by the Canadian River
Description: This is an off-road park for ATVs, and you can wildcamp here for free. We have a 4x4 camper van, so it was easy for us to get next to the river. As long as you‚Äôre not in a car or giant RV, you shouldn‚Äôt have a problem accessing this area. It was very windy, but really a nice spot for hikes, to watch sunset and camp. We were the only ones here on a Wednesday night.

Location: Florida Keys Overseas Heritage Trail, Islamorada, Monroe County, Florida, United States
Name: Fishing
Description: After Anne‚Äôs beach if you turn right if headed south there is a blue sign for fishing parking lot. Good for fishing overnight. Super sheath camping otherwise. 2 nights here.

Location: Forest Service Rd 307, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Hwy 307
Description: No need to be in the park.  The sunset from here was amazing. We just turned into the first pullout.   A quiet night in the desert without a sound from cars!

Location: 12295, River Road, Vorden, Sacramento County, California, 95615, United States
Name: Large pulloff by the delta
Description: This is a nice spot for a one nighter. I slept great when i was here. It is large enough for a simi.

Location: 1514, 14th Avenue North, Lake Worth Beach, Palm Beach County, Florida, 33460, United States
Name: Sunset Ridge Park
Description: Quiet,residential street on park. Tennis courts, picnic tables,  playground. very chill.

Location: 151, Boat Landing Road, Orangeburg County, South Carolina, 29112, United States
Name: Carlson park
Description: No facilities.   Small brook  deep enough for swimming.  Shaded.  Small docks.

Location: FR 153A, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Forest Rd Overlook Campsite
Description: If your vehicle has clearance I highly recommend traveling this far on the forest service road. A spectacular view of Sedona and surrounding mountains. Two fire pits and protection from the howling wind. Could this be paradise?

Location: North Eagle Eye Road, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85320, United States
Name: BLM base of the mountain.
Description: Good spot with easy access. Seems there reviews for the nearby spots but our location is a ways up from it. Easy access off the pavement. You can get pretty close to the base of the mountain and be far enough away from the road. Maybe 3 cars went by through the night. Very quiet other than occasional jets overhead. Good for an overnight stop. Didn‚Äôt need 4x4 but higher clearance would help. Late May. Cooled off around 9pm.

Location: Shingle Creek Road, Sevier County, Utah, United States
Name: mountain overlook
Description: full reception att & Verizon. 2x wheel drive accessible. gorgeous view of the mountains far from the highway. you can stay for 16 days. fire pit provided but be careful - there isn't a lot of dirt around the pit and fire catches quickly here. absolutely loved this spot

Location: NF-279, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: FSR 279 D
Description: An easy-to-reach, level camp spot within easy distance of the highway for a quick overnight stop or a longer stay.  No views, but in a beautiful treed area and very quiet.  Room for 2-3 tent sites or small rigs or small trailers; there's a turnaround loop so no backing is needed.  1 bar with At&t, Verizon, and T-mobile.

Location: Forest Service Rd 6, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Welch road
Description: National Forest boondocking. Do not come here in the spring until it dries out, you will get stuck. Can get crowded with people and sheep (when they are there)

Location: Fordyce Jeep Trail, Nevada County, California, 95729, United States
Name: ohv loading area
Description: a hair quieter than the nearby spot but definitely still hear the highway. has a pit toilet and a lot of squirrels. power lines over head  4 bars Verizon LTE

Location: 3839, Central Sarasota Parkway, Vamo, Sarasota County, Florida, 34238, United States
Name: Havertys Furniture
Description: Nice quiet safe place to park. No overnight parking signs here, but there are some in the adjacent lots. No one bothered me and I got a great nights sleep.

Location: Atrisco Vista Boulevard Northwest, Albuquerque, Bernalillo County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Road Pull off
Description:
Added note : can fit a ring of RV‚Äôs here with the addition of a road that leads down behind the hill hidden from road. Would say a total of 4 RV‚Äôs can fit here at one time without 4WD needed or high clearance. 

Good for a one night stay. Can fit a RV but more suitable for a car. Located by the 3 volcano‚Äôs overlooking Albuquerque. No services. Relatively quite as you are 5 to 10 min from the interstate on a less traveled highway.

Location: Forest Service Rd 2604, Tusayan, Coconino County, Arizona, 86023, United States
Name: Kaibab, Hwy 2604
Description: Nice turnaround spot. Large enough for 2-3 vans (assuming they are good friends).

Location: Blue Ridge Parkway, Buncombe County, North Carolina, United States
Name: Mills River Valley Overlook
Description: We spent the night here in our sprinter with another group who was in a short bus. I am unsure if NPS allows overnight camping but we did not have any issues. Came in late and we were the only ones here. People started showing up in the early am for photo ops and such but we stayed and had breakfast. Ok Verizon service. No facilities. Killer view.

Location: Harris Spring Road, Mount Charleston, Clark County, Nevada, United States
Name: Wide open spaces
Description: This specific spot is great! There are many roads available to trail off on and find "your own spot". However this view will be hard to beat! I've seen 2 cars and neither looked like overnighters. The road/trails are bumpy but very do a ble for most vehicles even low car like clearance could make it out here. Drive able roads and trails are marked as stated when you are first entering. Like the signs say "Use it, don't abuse it!"

Location: 6838, Red Wash Road, Jensen, Uintah County, Utah, 84035, United States
Name: Red Wash Road off Hwy 40
Description: Nice quiet spot off rte 40. There were 3 others spots before I chose this one. Next to water, 2 fire pits and a shade tree.

Location: Tonelea Trail, Yavapai County, Arizona, 86333, United States
Name: Tone Lea Trails dispursed camp site
Description:
Easy to get to (although the sign at the start of this road says ‚Äú4x4 recommended‚Äù. I drove my 24‚Äô Class C towing my car on a tow dolly. No problem.
This is a spot right off Tonelea  Trails. It goes back further to a ‚Äúhidden spot‚Äù, but another person on here wrote ‚Äútricks or vans only‚Äù, so I stopped at this spot.
2 bars on Straight Talk (Trac Fone Wireless). I think they use Verizon towers.
Not a level spot. Flat, yes, but not level. Even using leveling blocks, my front end is like 4‚Äù lower than my rear. But I am going to live with it.
Beautiful views!

Location: Buck and Doe Road, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: West grand canyon overnight parking for 25$
Description: Nice place for overnight. paved and flat parking. public restrooms. mobile connection is pour.

Location: Case Ace Hardware, Court Street, Trenton, Dade County, Georgia, 30752, United States
Name: Trenton public parking
Description: a public parking lot in the small town of Trenton. No signs indicating no overnight, spent the night without issue. only a few level spots but large gravel lot room for about 30 cars. no amenities. lots of trash.

Location: Springmaid Beach Resort & Conference Center, Springmaid Boulevard, South Beach, Myrtle Beach, Horry County, South Carolina, 29577, United States
Name: Free St Parking
Description:
A few spots under shade, but several free parking spots along road. I‚Äôve stayed a few night here unbothered.
No signs saying no parking nor no overnight parking.
The ocean is a few steps away.

Location: Banks Lake Wildlife Area, Coulee Corridor, Dry Falls Junction, Grant County, Washington, 99115, United States
Name: WDFW land
Description: Drive in site on Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife managed lands.
