There‚Äôs a dirt clearing / parking area right when you pull in for larger vehicles (there was a truck towing an RV parked in here with plenty of space when we arrived. There is an unmaintained road to your right that will take you to more informal campsites but only really suitable for 4wd vehicles / vehicles not too low. Fires are allowed but check when burn bans are in place as it gets dry and windy here early in the season.

Location: 4291, Casitas Pass Road, Ventura County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 93001, United States
Name: Lake Casitas Overlook 2
Description:
Another pull off on Casitas Pass Rd with an incredible view. Right off the road so your standard road noise applies but nothing unbearable.

Flat, rather large and can accommodate multiple big rigs. 

I don't see any no parking signs only a littering fine sign.

Location: 14338, State Highway 138 West, Kellogg, Douglas County, Oregon, 97462, United States
Name: Large pull off by the river
Description: Vary large flattened gravel pull off for campers. there are trails to the nearby river and 5 gallon buckets interspersed, which appear to be for trash.

Location: Klamath Falls-Lakeview Highway, Klamath County, Oregon, United States
Name: roadside pullout above state park day picnic area
Description: nice pullout off the road good road to picnic area with creek not recommended for large trailers switch back on road to picnic area pullout good all rigs

Location: 2587, Quilici Ranch Road, Fleish, Verdi-Mogul, Washoe County, Nevada, 89439, United States
Name: Tahoe Pyramid Trailhead
Description: Checked in 5/30/2022 at 1am. completely empty area. During my travels I've come to notice that trailheads seem to be a good place to camp for the night. Being memorial day, other places marked on this app had multiple vehicles already there. Much less road noise than the other ones that are off the side of I-80. A beautiful view of the stars right before the light pollution of Reno. However, this is directly along the train tracks, and a train does come through multiple times. It's not a long train, and better than hearing semis all night. There was a porta potty and hand wash station. Potty was locked though. Also, there's a sign pointing in the direction of the trailhead across the tracks, but another sign that says do not cross the tracks. I found it confusing and went over the tracks anyhow and that's clearly the trail. Pretty streams.

Location: Forest Road 287, Custer County, Colorado, United States
Name: Creek side
Description:
Nice area right off 96 on FR287. 4-5 spots, this one right along creek. Fairly private spots; not for large rigs or trailers probably. Road is pretty good, made it fine in minivan. No cel with att at all. 
This spot is mentioned in post across the road as well but wanted to designate spot for accuracy.

Location: Stud Horse Point Trailhead, Wildcat Tank Trail, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Stud Horse Point
Description:
dispersed camping in Glen Canyon NRA. these coordinates are to a generous pull off area where we camped for the night on a beautiful overlook. quiet and nobody came. cell service available. 

need 4WD to reach this point

Location: Sand Dunes Forest Road, Sherburne County, Minnesota, United States
Name: South Sand Dunes
Description: Very nice spots if you drive a little down the road... Google maps won't  get you here. it's on a lake, but for some sites you have to walk a little to get to water... some sites have hidden hideaways, so make sure to check out each one... there are 3 branches off the road, about a dozen spots or more to choose from... no amenities, but some sites are big enough to pull a small travel trailer into... no atvs are allowed on road... very quiet and serene! A true gem! For agate hunters, the road is rich in agates!

Location: Pioneertown Road, San Bernardino County, California, 92268, United States
Name: Near Pioneer Mountains Preserve
Description: Nice little turn off of the trail.  It's super quiet and you are very much secluded.  We were able to get our Airstream Basecamp up there, but be careful.  Super cool little spot. Stayed 3 days.

Location: Ouray Off-leash Dog Park, Platero Place Northwest, Albuquerque, Bernalillo County, New Mexico, 87120, United States
Name: Ouray Dog Park
Description: Quiet, flat, great ATT service. At a dog park parking lot. Showed up around 8:30pm on a Wednesday, only one person at the dog park who left. Looks like other people were using the other side of the dog park, but not close to this side. No ‚Äúno camping‚Äù or ‚Äúno overnight parking‚Äù signs.

Location: Dripping Springs Road, Gila County, Arizona, United States
Name: Hilltop cactus garden with a view
Description: Top notch spot, wrap around views enshrouded with cacti. Nice graded road access, rock firing ring, room for 3 ish rigs, good Verizon signal strength, little windy as it‚Äôs on a hilltop.

Location: Pipeline Road, San Bernardino County, California, United States
Name: Flat camp, wrap around views
Description: Great flat camp you can circle through with a few rock fire rings. Easily fit 4 rigs, ground is solid and only a half mile off pavement. Decent cell reception. Some glass spots but not trashed, our dogs were ok

Location: Jackson / Big Sandy Road, Fish Camp, Mariposa County, California, United States
Name: Jackson Road
Description: Nice off the road site. shady and sunny and very quiet. ATT cell service.

Location: South Jefferson Street, Pensacola, Escambia County, Florida, 32591, United States
Name: Palafox Pier
Description: parking down side of pier with fisherman. all very friendly and helpful. good overnight spot.

Location: UT 222, Wasatch County, Utah, United States
Name: Highway pull out
Description: Somewhat large dirt parking lot next to highway. Far enough from the main highway to be quiet at night. Earplugs recommended. Close to local reservoir etc. Good overnight spot.

Location: Bowen Ranch Road -JF4325, San Bernardino County, California, United States
Name: Bowen Ranch
Description: At least two spots with fire pits. Nice place for an overnight before hitting the hot springs. There are some shotgun shells and a bag of trash.

Location: Swift Street Courtyard, Ingalls Street, Westside Industrial District, Westside, Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz County, CAL Fire Northern Region, California, 95061, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description:
Moderator |Note: Please be sure that parking is legal.
.....
Technically has 'no parking' signs 12-5:30, but we stayed two nights no problem. Fairly level and much quieter than other streets around. All businesses around. Also feels safer and more secluded than the other street spots listed in the area with more full-timers.

There are marked spots, anything larger than 22‚Äô or so probably won‚Äôt fit.

Location: 424, Wright Street, Lakewood, Jefferson County, Colorado, 80228, United States
Name: Wright Park stealth camp
Description: Lots of street parking and plenty of other cars to blend in with. Park to one side and apartment parking lots on the other. Quiet place for a night.

Location: Tallmadge Road, Palmyra, Palmyra Township, Portage County, Ohio, 44412, United States
Name: Palmyra, Ohio. Palmyra Park
Description:
Very large playground. Baseball field and kids fairgrounds. 
Toilets and pit toilets. Very quiet.

Location: Laverkin Overlook Road, La Verkin, Washington County, Utah, 84745, United States
Name: BLM LaVerkin
Description: A wide open free area (BLM rules). Easy in and out, loads of space, easy for tents or big rigs. The borders are marked. All sorts of cell service too. Food, fuel and supplies are minutes away in LaVerkin. The area does get dusty on windy days. There are dozens and dozens of sites in this area. I have never not found one.

Location: Hearthstone Lake Road, Augusta County, Virginia, United States
Name: Hearthstone Lake
Description: Decent sized parking area next to the lake. Two or three smaller pull in spots to be right on the lake! 1 -2 bars of Verizon LTE. Beautiful!

Location: 1305, Hortons Pond Road, Chatham County, North Carolina, 27523, United States
Name: Hortons Pond
Description: Small lake access site with room for a van or small bus to boondock. Public trash can and no other signage. A little road noise, otherwise quiet. No facilities. Parked without issue.

Location: National Trails Highway, San Bernardino County, California, 92368, United States
Name: Dirt Pulloff in Sand Dune
Description: Big Pulloff near the street, but has enough distance to the Route 66. Not so much traffic at night, only the train. Quiet and no one bothered us. More or less level. About 5 or more places for big Campers

Location: Junction Creek Road, Durango, La Plata County, Colorado, United States
Name: Two Dispersed Spots with Tent Sites
Description: Another pull off large enough for a couple vans. If you follow the trail down the hill you will come to a small meadow with a few tent sites surrounding it. There is a small fire ring by the parking spots, and a larger fire ring down at the meadow. Barely any cell service(2 bars -118db from cell sites in Durango.)

Location: Mill Creek Road, Telluride, San Miguel County, Colorado, 81435, United States
Name: Lower Mill Creek
Description: Small pull-off for 2-3 vehicles. We made it up in a 5-window short bus so 4WD and high clearance is not needed

Location: Forest Service Rd 231, Flagstaff, Coconino County, Arizona, 86005, United States
Name: South Woody Mountain Road
Description:
*Winter Closures.
.....
Beyond the residential houses, there is a nice place next to the woods, very quiet (we stayed here because the other spots are closed due to the forest fire). Recommended by locals. 3 signal bars and 4G.

Location: Middle Baxter Road, Sweetwater County, Wyoming, United States
Name: Off i80
Description: Behind a power station, within 15 min of i80 depending on which road your map takes you, much quieter than the other sites near by, gravel patch but easy for any vehicle

Location: Rio Grande County, Colorado, United States
Name: BLM Del Norte
Description: A nice flat open area very close to a cell tower.  There are numerous sites in the area.  This one is big enough for a small group.

Location: Mitchell Park Horticultural Conservatory, 524, South Layton Boulevard, Mitchell Park, Milwaukee, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin, 53215, United States
Name: Mitchell Park
Description: There are 3 geodesic domes here that are quite nice to see and a huge parking area in front. Nice and quiet. No signs saying anything.

Location: Trego County, Kansas, United States
Name: Cedar Bluff Overlook
Description: Rather out of the way for most, but the view is worth it! There is a sign saying no trailers at the turn off to get here, but I haven't seen anything that says "no camping". Very windy, but should be a great sunset tonight! 4x4 not needed, longer vehicles might have trouble with the steep hill near the end. 3-4 bars Verizon service, with 4G LTE.

Location: Thomas Mountain Road, Riverside County, California, 92361, United States
Name: Thomas Mountain Road
Description: Several pullouts on this road with really nice view of the mountains! Right near beautiful trees and a little creek when it rains. The road coming in can be flooded a bit but you can drive your vehicle right through the center. Drove my Ford van through it and a Westy no problem.

Location: Junction Creek Road, Durango, La Plata County, Colorado, United States
Name: In the Aspens
Description: Short back in spot with a trail down into a young aspen grove. Fire ring a short walk away with a possible tent spot. Took a little over an hour for me to make it up here from town. Poor Verizon signal.

Location: Water Tank Road, Mohave County, Arizona, 86431, United States
Name: Big Wash Road Fork
Description:
Before proceeding up Big Wash Road, you can start your search here. The unnamed road that forks here has a site with fire ring right at the beginning.

According to the Public Land Layer of CalTopo, this is already past the state land (sites, but unknown legality) and firmly in BLM land.

1-2 bars of Verizon 5G, but the connection seems reliable.

Location: Los Angeles County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, United States
Name: Angeles NF - Castaic Lake Overlook
Description:
Wonderful location for 1-2 SUVs, Pickups/Truck Campers. 3 might be a little crowded but doable. Fire ring. Amazing view of the lake. 
The initial hill to start this trail can be intimidating and is deeply rutted. There is a path to the left but it's gated off. I'm not sure of 2WD vehicle capabilites, but I personally couldn't see myself in a Sprinter, Transit, or Promaster attempting this. The trail beyond is tight with some deeply rutted areas. Prepare for pin stripes and being at the edge of the cliff. I had to get out 2x to make sure the path was doable and within my own and the vehicle's limits. BUT it's worth it. There is a small trail off to the west of this. On the Satellite map it looks like a continuation of a dirt road but it's not. National Forest land.
(Pic of the large spot with Apiary is where the other pin near this area is).

Location: BLM Route 6102, Fremont County, Colorado, United States
Name: Penrose Commons BLM
Description: Very bumpy and rocky going up hill but once to spot it‚Äôs beautiful! 2WD mini van pulling trailer made it up just fine! Will b me staying the night. AT&T service great!

Location: Road 7175, San Juan County, New Mexico, United States
Name: New Mexico badlands picnic area
Description: Parked at the picnic area because the road to the campground was too muddy from recent rain. Do not attempt to go to the camp ground if it has rained. I had to back down a mile before being able to turn around. 4x4 maybe ok. I was in a 2x4 transit 150. Camped at the picnic area just past the overlook.

Location: National Forest Development Road 58, Lane County, Oregon, United States
Name: Dead end loop off NF-58
Description: NF-58 is paved and well maintained. There are some pull offs good for vans or shorter rigs. The road we stayed on was mostly  loose, wet mud that had lots of ruts (no issue with 4x4) and dense tree coverage so all shade. Area is quiet but lots of trash left behind in some instances. 3 bars LTE with AT&T.

Location: 497, State Highway 17, Saguache County, Colorado, 81125, United States
Name: Highway 17 Pulloff
Description: Nice little pull-off near UFO Watchtower.  Room for several rigs. The view of the night sky is amazing.

Location: Cottonwood Canyon Road, Kane County, Utah, United States
Name: The lunar landscape
Description:
This is the quietest place I‚Äôve ever camped. I never heard a single sound. Watch the weather I would not wanna be here in the rain the soil turns the very slick and sticky mud. The road is a bit washboard.
I always had good cell service three bars with Verizon
You could put up a tent here but it is very windy

Location: 6271, State Highway 91, Birdseye, Lake County, Colorado, 80461, United States
Name: BLM with 2bars Verizon no 4x4 needed
Description: Fairly level spot. This stretch of 90 is bordered by BLM (check Campendium for other spots if you don‚Äôt use the BLM.gov arcgis map). I took the first pullout that is maybe only 15yards off somewhat busy route 90. totally hidden from road. No 4 wheel drive needed for sure, but could be needed further in. Trees, pleasant partial mountain view. Verizon 2bars getting 21Mb download (fast). Spacious enough for minivan or class B but not larger.

Location: Forest Road 376, Sandoval County, New Mexico, 87025, United States
Name: Aspen Grove
Description:
Big enough for 20 big rigs. Huge prairie with flat ground surrounded by trees and mountains. Foragers paradise. Easy dirt road getting in. 45 min from town. Free range cows that might visit your campsite. Moisture is held on top layers of soil for days. If you get a heavy rain, it may be days before you can leave. 
Beautiful drive up the mountain!! One of my favorite camp spots for sure!!

Location: UT 12, Garfield County, Utah, United States
Name: Homestead Overlook
Description:
Homestead Overlook, east of Boulder City, Utah.
√Ä very large rest area, so large that the road is quite silent. 
There are pit toilets. 
Wifi comes and goes, uncertain. 
Very quiet because the beautiful #12 country side road is less used, this beauty is like Zion park with fabulous rocks.

Location: Swing Arm City Iinterpretive Kiosk, UT 24, Caineville, Wayne County, Utah, 84734, United States
Name: Factory Butte Special Recreation Area , Utah
Description:
A place on the moon !

Grey hard sand. Very large space to park. 

Very quiet pace to sleep. Very close the one, with same characteristics, named before on this site the so wonderful and high friendly IOverlander.

Location: 6382, Rose Lane, Carpinteria, Santa Barbara County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 93013, United States
Name: Corporate park cul-de-sac
Description: Just like Cindy Ln just south, the cul-de-sac here on Rose Ln was quiet and well lit overnight. No no parking signs. Good place for a night just off of pch. 5G 3/5 bars verizon.

Location: Upper Macleay Park Trailhead, Wildwood Trail, Forest Park, Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon, 97210, United States
Name: Trail parking lot
Description: Parking lot next to Forest park and the departure of a trail. Sign saying the park closes from 10pm to 5pm but no ‚Äúno overnight parking‚Äù sign. We stayed here and no one bothered us. Bit far from the city center (1h walk) but for the night it is quiet. 3bars 4G AT&T

Location: Oregon Coast Highway, Curry County, Oregon, United States
Name: Pacific Ocean overlook
Description:
One of many 101 pullouts in the area. Less foggy, better view of ocean, and more level than most of the others. 

Like other spots along highway, be prepared for road noise.

Location: Arthur Disterheft Public Safety Center, 101, 4th Street, Point Reyes Station, Marin County, CAL Fire Northern Region, California, 94956, United States
Name: Street Parking. Point Reyes
Description:
Overnight parking/sleeping in vehicle is allowed in Pt Reyes unless specified by signs on particular streets/areas. I confirmed this with the police in town, and then slept in this spot directly across from the police station : )

Nothing special, but town is quiet at night and there is access to lots of beautiful nature right nearby. Plus Brickmaiden Bakery in town is quite legit (open Thurs‚ÄìSunday, usually), and the bookstore here is quite good too, especially for nature-related material (fiction and nonfic).

Public bathrooms: in town, on Mesa Road. They are marked on Google maps.

Location: Umpqua Lighthouse State Park, Oregon Coast Highway, Winchester Bay, Douglas County, Oregon, 97467, United States
Name: Umpqua River Lighthouse Station
Description: Long paved overlook in front of the lighthouse. I didn‚Äôt see any 'no parking' signs. One bar Verizon. Beautiful view. ATV activity below on dunes but quiet at night. Beautiful sunset. Park on North side away from interpretative sign for less traffic. Great site. No one bothered me.

Location: 1602, Babcock Street, Costa Mesa, Orange County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 92627, United States
Name: Industrial street quiet
Description: Super quiet industrial street. A couple Vans and RVs parked in some streets around. It's a couple intersections and a lot of spots available. No signsat all saying "no overnight parking" or street cleaning. I arrived here at midnight from Saturday to Sunday and left 8:30am. No issues. I recommend this place if you are in Costa Mesa or cities closest.

Location: Dredge Tailings Five, County Road B040, Sierra County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Private Caballo - Cottonwood Cove
Description:
Very private and secluded cove on the lake. BLM. Must access on dirt roads, need 4 wheel drive. Not recommended for trailers or RVs. Road is sandy, so might want to air down tires. 
Very Beautiful!

Location: 3370, Mariaville Road, North Mariaville, Ellsworth, Hancock County, Maine, 04605, United States
Name: Mariaville Falls
Description:
2 parking lots. A river and falls. We spent the
night with our 24 footer without any problem.
--------------------
2 parkings. Une rivi√®re et des chutes . Une dizaine de places. Nous y avons passer la
nuit avec notre 24 pieds sans probl√®me.

Location: Shrine Pass Road, Summit County, Colorado, United States
Name: White river national forest
Description: Dispersed camping with a gorgeous view near the vail rest area

Location: Scales, Pine Mountain Road, Grayson County, Virginia, 24378, United States
Name: The Scales
Description: This is an amazing, large open mountaintop field at 4637 feet. The Appalachian Trail, Virginia Highlands Horse Trail, and several other trails cross here. It can be a busy place on summer weekends, especially in early to mid-August when wild blueberries are ripe. Expect to see wild ponies grazing the hillsides. There is a bear box available and pit toilets. Fresh-piped spring on the road up to the Scales on the left at mile 3.6.

Location: Thompson Hotel, Port Street, Robert M Hitch Village, Savannah, Chatham County, Georgia, 31421, United States
Name: Free parking around the Thompson Hotel
Description:
Tons of free parking around the Thompson Hotel. Apparently, the city is going to put meters here someday but it's been over a year. Lots of overnight parking and I've seen some parked in the grass. 

The picture is from the Thompson Hotel looking E SE over the parking area.

Location: Sammy Davis Junior Drive, Winchester, Clark County, Nevada, 89169, United States
Name: Circus Circus Street Parking
Description: Self parking of the circus circus. Lot's of free spaces. Even late. Don't know if it is allowed. Stayed here for one night and had no problem. You also have an RV park here. If you sleep at this cheap hotel they make you park your RV on the side, between building and RV park with a paper on the dashboard. You can pay to go only to the swimming pool also.

Location: El Dorado County, California, United States
Name: Miners Claim
Description: Pretty spot in the forest. Lots of wild flowers. Site has two fire rings. Pretty smooth dirt road to get here. Pulling a teardrop trailer with off road suspension.

Location: 15901, Wilson Road, Woodland Point, Charles County, Maryland, 20664, United States
Name: Southern Park
Description: Great parking lot next to a local park. While the park is closed at dusk, we stayed in the parking lot next to the road for two nights. Beautiful sunsets on the river and a great forest across the road to hang your hammock.

Location: River Walk, Downtown, San Antonio, Bexar County, Texas, 78205, United States
Name: River walk
Description:
Quiet place with access to a small green area along the river walk. Ideal for children.
.....
Spot tranquille avec acc√®s √† un petit espace vert le long de River Walk! Id√©al
Pour les enfants.!

Location: Plateau Road, Gallatin County, Montana, 59758, United States
Name: Plateau Roadside
Description:
Seasonal road closures to be aware of - closed 5/18/23. Road/gate open on 7/26/23.
.....
Pull-off on the side of the road with a fire ring. There are two more spots up the hill for high-clearance vehicles. The road in is bumpy but not bad! We made it fine with a 15ft pull-behind, 2wd and relatively low clearance. Great ATT service

Location: FR 4229, Catron County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Dispersed Camp Site
Description:
Take the dirt road past Cosmic Campground and there are quite a few spots off the road. 

Any vehicle could get you to the first few spots but the further in you go the bumpier it gets.

5G with TMobile

Established fire ring and flat spot for tent at most sites

Location: 2534, Northwest Pettygrove Street, Nob Hill, Northwest District, Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon, 97210, United States
Name: Street parking close to Wallance Park
Description: Calm street in nice neighbourhood, close to restaurants and park. Serveral other campers in this and nearby streets when we were here, both in stealth vans and smaller RV's. Please be respectful to the people living here. Parking sign says maximum 4 hour parking between 9AM and 7PM.

Location: 14039, North Douglas Highway, Juneau, Alaska, 99801, United States
Name: False Outer Point
Description: This is our third night here. This area, even though raining, has been popular during the day. Since the road ends not too far past here, the nights are mostly quiet. There is a waterfall on the hill behind and a beach in front. First day we came here it was sunny and more locals were here, now that it's been raining its mostly just tourists looking and leaving. It's a big area, but since it's on a slope it wont be super level. Good spot for truck campers, or vans. There is also a marmot that comes out when it's not raining, he's cute. I have had no issues staying here and have seen others stay here as well. I also have full T-Mobile service.

Location: Extra Storage, East Lomita Boulevard, Carson, Los Angeles County, California, 90744, United States
Name: Planet Fitness
Description:
I came here for workout and shower, and decided to stay for the night in my car.
I saw other vans and 1 Motorhome parked.
I spend the night with no issues.
* No security guards knocking.
* No signs prohibiting overnight parking

Location: 746, 10th Street, South Hill, Fairhaven, Bellingham, Whatcom County, Washington, 98225, United States
Name: Street parking by the water
Description:
Pretty quiet street near the water and a beautiful park. No ‚Äúno parking‚Äù signs. And great Verizon signal.
Starting from the entrance/ext of boulevard park (bay view dr) almost all the way to the end of 10th street is all free overnight parking. (no parking in the actual park, you will get a knock) bay view drive is slanted so i never actually stayed the night there but i saw many others do it. there‚Äôs a small section of private/permit parking when you turn on 10th and on the off shoot streets but if you stay on 10th there are plenty of great options. bathrooms nearby and a very pleasant walk. some permanent residents at the end of 10th but very quiet and polite. 2 downsides are there‚Äôs minimal shade on hot days and the train is right there, some nights were quiet and some nights the horn was going until midnight, seemed like it depended on the operator added bonus, you can jump off the pier at any tide. people are always doing it (mostly college students) but the water is warm and it‚Äôs a super fun way to wake up or end the day

Location: 16521, South Pacific Avenue, Sunset Beach, Huntington Beach, Orange County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 90742, United States
Name: S Pacific Avenue
Description: Quiet place for one night. Free parking for the night. No signs that you have to pay.

Location: US 180, Kendrick Park, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Wing Mountain Road
Description: Arrived after dark. No issue nice large camp space cup of fire rings circular drive plenty of space for more than one vehicle tall beautiful trees. Two bars of service. Great place.

Location: 801, North New Hampshire Avenue, Inlet, Atlantic City, Atlantic County, New Jersey, 08401, United States
Name: free parking
Description:
large parking at atlantic city
near the beach. theres no aminities

Location: Big Hungry Road, Polk County, North Carolina, United States
Name: Big Hungry Rd
Description: Sign at the entrance says it's a designated camping area. Large gently sloped gravel parking area off quiet rural road. A couple narrow overgrown paths lead away from gravel but we did not explore to see if there are spots for tents. Main road is paved, any car can get here (we're in a 2wd Honda Fit). US Mobile has cell coverage but no data, T-Mobile has neither.

Location: Salisbury Beach, Salisbury, Essex County, Massachusetts, United States
Name: Event/Beach Parking
Description: Large, flat parking lot designated as event or beach parking. The sign says $20 per day. We talked to the parking attendant to see about overnight parking and she said it was fine. She said lots of people leave their cars and Uber home, then come back for cars the next day. She also told us if we go to one of the 3 restaurants nearby the parking was free. So we ate there and parked all night for free. No problem. Right on the beach and quiet. There are several streetlights but we weren‚Äôt bothered by them.

Location: watercourse dr seidewalk, Fort Worth, Tarrant County, Texas, 76132, United States
Name: Gravel Lot at Park
Description: Gravel lot next to Trinity river. Several areas to get under trees. Walk to Whole Foods and REI.

Location: 2749, 25th Street, Curtis Park, Land Park, Sacramento, Sacramento County, California, 95818, United States
Name: Sierra 2 Park Street Parking
Description: A tree lined street next to a small park that allows dogs to run. there are no parking restriction signs along the non residential side.

Location: FS 144, Garfield County, Utah, United States
Name: Farther up Forest Road 148
Description: Keep going on 148 past three side roads.  There is a large circular clearing in the trees.  It could accommodate  several campers. We're the only ones here.  A couple cars, trucks and quads passed by while still light. There are fire rings.  Dark sky.  Big stars.

Location: 6987, West Targee Street, Boise, Ada County, Idaho, 83709, United States
Name: West Targee Street
Description:
A wide business park road with a sidewalk. Perfect for big rigs. Quiet at night with only a few cars and semis after 11:00PM. Morning traffic after 6:00AM and from the airport. At this spot, where the north side of the street gets a little wider, there's not much slope towards the sidewalk. 

No amenities but close to Costco, Walmart and restaurants. About 10 minutes drive from downtown. Nearby side streets may have a little less road noise, but they were angle to the side more. 

I stayed here two nights with no issue. Please be courteous and don't make a mess!

Location: Sam Morgan Regional Trail, Downtown, Saint Paul, Ramsey County, Minnesota, 55146, United States
Name: Sleep along the River
Description:
They limit the parking to two hours from 8am-6pm Monday-Friday 
The rest is unrestricted. 
Seems solid. Bright‚Äôish lights + some light road traffic. Lovely morning city view.

Location: Meteor Crater Road, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Two guns
Description: This is an abandoned gas station and ruins of a past Indian tribe. There are several spots to boondocks in the back or you can park up under the covered area at the abandoned fuel station. I have stayed here a few times and it‚Äôs nice to explore a bit of the ruins. There‚Äôs a bit of road noise in a rooftop tent but should be fine in a camper

Location: South Dolliver Street, Pismo Beach, San Luis Obispo County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 93449, United States
Name: side of the road between Pismo Beach and RR track
Description: there's a wide area of the road with plenty of space for all sizes of rigs. walk over to the beach thru the monarch Grove

Location: Inyo County, California, United States
Name: "The Pads" - Just outside Death Valley
Description: Spent the night here, conveniently close to Death Valley, right before you enter the fee area  for the National park. There was a short RV, and a few vans parked along the way too and no one had any trouble. There are no signs preventing overnight camping, and seems no one cares. Decent view, and fairly nice dirt road had no trouble with our transit or low clearance car.

Location: 271, Dory Passage, Clearwater, Pinellas County, Florida, 33767, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description: Lots of street parking on Dory Passage Street. No street signs on certain sections, safe neighborhood. Stayed one night in a Class C with no issues.

Location: Korean War Veterans Access Area, U.S. Route 2 North, Alburgh, Grand Isle County, Vermont, 12979, United States
Name: US-2
Description: A turn out in the middle of the bridge from New York to Vermont, into a little knoll of land. If light traffic noise bothers you it might not be great but for me it was perfect and right on the water. A beautiful view and breeze all night and morning. Birds, boats and water, what more could you want. lol Oh and there's a porta potty if you use those. lol. Clean and safe.

Location: Field 2, WIlburton Hill Park Trails, Belridge, Bellevue, King County, Washington, 98005, United States
Name: Wilburton Hill Park
Description: Nice and quiet park. No signs for ‚ÄúNo overnight parking‚Äù.

Location: Larson Way, Gardnerville, Douglas County, Nevada, 89410, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description: We stopped by Walmart to see if we can stay for the night but there were signs stating that no overnight parking so we saw few 18 wheels trucks in this street near to Walmart and we decided to parked and stay for the night nest to them. No signs and good for a night. T-mobile 2 bars of LTE.

Location: Saltgrass Road, Clark County, Nevada, United States
Name: Lovell Canyon with mountain views
Description: quite a few pull-offs along this dirt road. Road is in decent condition, made it fine with RWD but it's a little lop-sided at times. camp spot has great views, 2 bars ATT. Only con is that this spot is not very level. would've chosen somewhere else but this canyon is packed and I got here on a Thursday evening.

Location: Northshore Road, Clark County, Nevada, 89040, United States
Name: Dispersed camping
Description: nice, big and fairly level camp spot not far down dirt road with fire ring. I wanted to go further for more privacy, but there are RVs at the end of this road and both right and left turns up the hill were too washed out for my RWD van to handle. This spot has great views and full ATT coverage. Can see main highway from it though.

Location: West Tehachapi Boulevard, Kern County, California, 93561, United States
Name: Tehachapi CA road 202 freeway exit
Description: A couple parking spots hidden behind three large boulders off the side of road 202 into Tehachapi. Road noise and train noise exist but a Great Mountain View. We stayed overnight in our van with no problems, there were also someone with a 5th wheel staying as well.

Location: Forest Road 694, Town of Washburn, Bayfield County, Wisconsin, United States
Name: Wild Camping off of FR 694
Description: There is a small clearing just off of FR 694 (north side of the road) with a small stone fire ring. Nice and quiet spot. Shady from all the trees. One bar of T-Mobile LTE. Fine for messages, not much else. Could probably fit a bigger rig here too. We were looking for the spot marked in iOverlander just west of this spot. There was nothing there but we found this a little further up the road. Thought I‚Äôd update with more accurate coordinates. ‚úåüèª

Location: McDonald's, Main Street, Upper Village, Gorham, Coos County, New Hampshire, 03581, United States
Name: mc Donald parking river
Description: quiet place witch a beautiful river rock and forest beside mcdonalds. the wifi of the mcdo is free so its perfect.

Location: Chilton Road, Sweetwater County, Wyoming, United States
Name: North of rock springs
Description: Two track off county road 17 with places to pull off. BLM land. No 4 wheel drive or high clearance necessary. Nothing fancy but did the trick for the night. Quiet, away from the main road, with decent Verizon and AT&T service. May be difficult to turn around with a big rig.

Location: Spiral Jetty, Box Elder County, Utah, United States
Name: Spiral Jetty wildcamp
Description: It is apparently allowed to wildcamp here. No signs saying otherwise. Cool spot, but lots of visitors coming and going into the night. No facilities. KEEP IT CLEAN. Nice to be here at sunrise, but lots of flies!

Location: Santa Fe Fire Road, San Bernardino County, California, United States
Name: Fire road off of Old Woman Springs Road
Description: Gravel fire road that pulls off from Old Woman Springs Road. There's a couple of pullouts along it as well as a large open area at the beginning of the fire road. I camped here on a Thursday night and did not see anyone else, with just occasional cars going by on the main road. If you drive further down it is very quiet and peaceful, even right by the road was a nice spot. The road is packed gravel, not difficult to drive, most passenger cars should do fine.

Location: 6795, South Saint Vrain Avenue, Estes Park, Larimer County, Colorado, 80517, United States
Name: Pull-off - Longs Peak View
Description:
Unfortunately the best options around here are either pull-offs on rt7 or drive forever down a bumpy dirt road. This pull-off is larger than most of the others because it's a little dirt parking lot to view the mountain. This means you can have ~20ft separation to the passing cars instead of ~5ft ;-)
Not perfectly level but good enough for me!

Location: 2011, Jefferson Avenue Northeast, Renton, King County, Washington, 98056, United States
Name: Jefferson Avenue
Description: Nice quiet tree-lined street with no houses on either side. Street ends at apartment complex. No restrictions for parking.

Location: FR 50, Marion County, Florida, United States
Name: Hopkins Prairie Remote Site
Description: Small site off of a trail right next to the lake/marsh. Apple Maps didn‚Äôt recognize the trail but fits 3 tents and 2 trucks at least. Soft sand to get in. See photo for dusk views of this sight

Location: East Perry Vickers Road, Government Camp, Clackamas County, Oregon, 97028, United States
Name: Road Next To Trillium Lake
Description: PLENTY of spots all up and down the road in this area. Instead of going straight to get to Trillium Lake, take a right and there will be a road that has plenty of space on the left and right sides. Massive area with multiple vans and RV's when I pulled in. Right next to everything and still has service! One to two bars Verizon. Happy camping :)

Location: Shoreline Highway, Marin County, CAL Fire Northern Region, California, 94970, United States
Name: Pullout - Red Rock Beach
Description:
A bit before the parking for Red Rock Beach. Many people stay there, but if you prefer to have a more private place, this could be it. More level than the parking lot as well. It‚Äôs allowed to park here overnight. 

Note: the shoulder is a bit high for low cars. They can make it fine but just know its a bump. 

Fresh natural water source right across the street to fill uyour water bottles.

Location: Billings County, North Dakota, United States
Name: Top of the world
Description: The road coming in has several sites along the way.  We stayed at the very top of the road.  Beautiful views.

Location: 808, Ranch to Market Road 2389, Mason County, Texas, 76856, United States
Name: James River Riverbed
Description: Across the James River from Dos Rios campground is the James River public land use riverbed. Open for public use. No ATV/UTV use, be careful during flash floods. Good open areas but riverbed rocky. Stayed one night, quiet peaceful next to the river.

Location: Hershey State Wildlife Management Area, South River Road, Lincoln County, Nebraska, 69143, United States
Name: East end of the lake
Description:
Great little spot for an overnight but as people have mentioned it‚Äôs a little loud from the highway. 
Had full bars of Verizon service and if we had more time I‚Äôd love to go swimming and fishing. Thanks to this app we found this place and it was a lifesaver after almost hitting a deer on the main highway.

Location: BLM Campground, Kolob Resevoir Road, Virgin, Washington County, Utah, 84779, United States
Name: BLM Camping
Description: BLM campsite. 14 day maximum stay. Incredible view of the mountains. Just off North Kolob Terrace Road. Looks like it‚Äôs right next to a mountain biking trails.

Location: The Goosenecks, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: BLM Overlooking West Side of Goosenecks
Description: Great, isolated BLM campsite right on the cliff edge overlooking the west arm of the Goosenecks, but well outside of the park boundary. Take the road to Honaker trailhead off of Johns Canyon rd (244). There are 2 or 3 other cliffside sites on the section of road after the Honaker trailhead. Full bars of cell service. Great little firepit. Beautiful views. Road is a bit narrow/rough but likely do-able in high clearance 2wd. Likely (?) not suitable for big rigs based of a few sections of road being a bit steep.

Location: Centerpoint Trailhead, Centerpoint Trail, Newton County, Arkansas, 72624, United States
Name: Center point to Goat Trail trailhead
Description: This is the Centerpoint trailhead parking lot. It‚Äôs a gravel parking lot, right off 43, that is a little secluded at night.  We‚Äôre in a Sprinter 144. Wouldn‚Äôt try much larger. Not much room to turn around. Stayed one night to hike next morning.  The local campsite doesn‚Äôt except RV‚Äôs.  There are no signs that say no overnight parking.

Location: Winding Stair Gap Road, Lumpkin County, Georgia, United States
Name: Hillside Tree Ring
Description: This is an awesome spot secluded back off the main forest road with plenty of space. There is an established rock fire ring, a homemade table, plus a neat chair somebody made with a stump and vine branches. There‚Äôs quite a bit of dead trees around for firewood as well. Verizon LTE

Location: Forest Service Rd 700, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: FS Rd 700 / Kelly Canyon East Huge Spot
Description: Huge mostly flat area with established fire ring.  1 mile off hwy17. Entry road was recently re-graveled so my bus looked like it was covered in snow when i arrived with all the white dust. Road easy for big and small rigs. Only one rocky bit just before arrival. Spot large enough for several 40ft rvs with ease

Location: County Highway 5, Wolf Hole, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: BLM close to St. George
Description: BLM Site alongside BLM Road 1069. Some sites with fire pits with a perfect view to the mountains. Only few traffic on the road. Make sure to get past the permit only zone and into the actual BLM land. You'll drive about 3 miles on dirt road, once you pass the cattle barrier, pullout on the left!

Location: Delle, Utah, Delle Frontage Road, Tooele County, Utah, 84029, United States
Name: West of Shamrock station
Description: Go through the large asphalt parking area on the west side of the shamrock station. You‚Äôll see some black gravel roadways in the BLM land you can go on comfortably.  They are wide and easy we drove on them with our 45‚Äô Rv with tow trailer total 71‚Äô.   It‚Äôs a bit further from the road and my dogs love the roaming and chasing rabbits.  Strong cell signal.

Location: SR 173 Roadside Picnic Area, Camp Verde Road East, Camp Verde, Kerr County, Texas, 78010, United States
Name: Penateka Picnic Area
Description:
Maintained Picnic area in Camp Verde. Handicap accessible. Two Picnic tables with trash cans. Lots of shade trees. Access to river and historical marker on site. 
Camp Verde Restaurant and General Store is within walking distance, across the road.

Right off the highway so expect some road noise, but it's primarily local traffic that dies down in the evening.

Location: County Road 53, Juniper Hot Springs, Moffat County, Colorado, United States
Name: Moffat County Public Land
Description: huge area, gravel Road 53, firepits, amazing views, for all Kind of campers, Max 14 days, wonderful quite, we were alone

Location: 2/10 Road, Mesa County, Colorado, 81630, United States
Name: Pyramid Rock
Description:
Free camping on BLM land across from Pyramid Rock (see photo). Two bars of 5G T-Mobile and about 50 yards off the dirt road. A few off road vehicles passed by and waved but zero traffic at night and very quiet.  
Tons of coyotes howling and a gorgeous spot for a sunset!

Location: North River Road, Wayne County, Utah, 84734, United States
Name: Hanksville, Utah.
Description: Very large and isolated picnic area. On a very Sandy, dusty and careless road. But savage and wild beautiful. My 30 feet long RV got it with a little fear‚Ä¶ Very quiet, no service at all. On west 24 hwy.

Location: FR 090, Garfield County, Utah, 84764, United States
Name: Bryce Canyon Dispersed #5
Description: Just off 63 in the NFS there are a number of dispersed camp sites.

Location: 1995, Brooklyn Road, Mount Tabor, Rutland County, Vermont, 05773, United States
Name: AT Trailhead
Description: A wonderful spot in the White Rocks NRA with a fire ring. Turning east off US-7 onto Brooklyn Road, there are a number of pullouts large enough to comfortably accommodate a vehicle; I chose one for its proximity to the trailhead for a morning hike as well as the 3 bars VZN LTE. I only needed a block under one wheel to even the pitch to be nearly flat. Nearby is an overlook with a medium sized parking lot, paved, with a pit toilet.

Location: Graham County, Arizona, United States
Name: Sand Tanks Rd üì∂
Description: Dispersed Camping on the side of the road up Sand Tank Rd. Beautiful views in every direction. There are two pulloffs at this location for small vehicles. One small fire ring. Three bars of Visible/Verizon service.

Location: Beaufort Town Hall, 701, Front Street, Beaufort, Carteret County, North Carolina, 28516, United States
Name: Beaufort, North Carolina
Description:
What a lovely old town bursting with boats, restaurants, breweries and fun things to see and do. 
We parked right along Front Street not far from all the shops. There are picnic tables here and garbage cans. There‚Äôs a public toilet to the west and if we stay here another night we may park closer. 
There are no ‚Äú no parking signs‚Äù I asked one of the shop owners if we‚Äôd be ok parking here overnight and she said we‚Äôd be fine. In the high season they bring in meters and might not allow it but in the month of November it seems to be fine. 
The Outer Banks are beautiful and might be worth reserving a boat ride over to explore them more closely. 
Fishtowne Brewery offers bingo every other Thursday! Check in to see if it‚Äôs on when you get here! You can bring in your own food

Location: National Forest Development Road 9720, Deschutes County, Oregon, United States
Name: One of many pullouts on Lava Cast Road
Description: So many places to pull out for a good nights sleep. It‚Äôs a good place to sleep between Newberry National Volcanic Monument and Bend.

Location: Stampede Meadows Road, Truckee, Nevada County, California, United States
Name: Near Boca Reservoir
Description:
All of the pullouts mentioned here were from the north bound lanes.  This place is accessed from the southbound lanes. Reno to Trukee. 
Take the Boca Reservoir exit, left at the T, go over the train tracks then take the road to the left again to the lookout over the little trukeee river before you get to the dam. 
We had a lovely quiet night.  2 trains before we went to sleep around 10:30 pm but other than that it was very quiet and the babbling Creek muffled any highway noise!
Highly recommend.

Location: 4199, Sunset Lane, Oxnard, Ventura County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 93035, United States
Name: Sunset Lane
Description: nice quiet residential area, there were a few more vans parked on the street. no "No parking" signs, there was a porta potty at the parking lot next door, but it was locked. Very close to the ocean.

Location: River Road, Crockett County, Texas, 79781, United States
Name: Cell tower pull out.
Description: Massive gravel pull out with a bunch of bushes on it. We got here when it was pitch black outside, we drove it bit up the road but lost cell service pretty quick. This gravel spot has 3bars for Verizon (even though we‚Äôre 100meters from a cell tower) big enough for a couple bigger rigs.

Location: Granby Landing Road, Cayce, Lexington County, South Carolina, 20201, United States
Name: Cayce Riverwalk Battlefield Connection
Description: Next to the Cayce Riverwalk Battlefield Connection. Large lot 200 yards x 200 yards with a boat ramp. Very nice biking and walking trail. Lit at night and very safe. No toilets or garbage.

Location: Badger Springs Road, Yavapai County, Arizona, United States
Name: Badger Springs trail head
Description: Nice camp area just east at the end of the trailhead. There are a few campsites with firepits and easy to get to. Some freeway noise but otherwise quiet and out of view of the trailhead parking lot. The short hike down to the Agua Fria river is nice and has some good swim holes. Some cellphone signal, but down in a valley so a booster helps.

Location: Crisp County, Georgia, United States
Name: Rocky Point Park
Description:
A small park on the water.  No amenities. Very quiet.   Some locals came fishing but otherwise very quiet. 

Parking in the grass no paved lot. Mostly level.

Location: Muley Point Road, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: Valley of the Gods overview
Description: Nice view over Valley of the Gods, quiet

Location: County Road, Big Water, Kane County, Utah, United States
Name: Big Water Gravel Area
Description:
Large gravel area with a couple of established campfire rings. It's a large area just off NP-230 with spots for many rigs. We had no problem with our 40' fifth wheel. The sign at the entrance to NP-230 states camping rules for the Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. (pack out trash, self-contained, etc) There's an impressive view looking down over the valley below if you park on the east side. The dirt is a little soft on the rim so don't get too close or you could get stuck. 

With Starlink, we received 130mbps down and 3.5mbps up. Verizon signal on the phone was 5 bars. AT&T signal was 5 bars with our cell antenna.
(Speed update, 3/25/2023- Starlink was 30 Mbps down, 4-5 Mbps up; AT&T was 10-12 Mbps down, 1-2  Mbps up.)

FYI about the spot just to the east (where the water crosses the road), there's construction currently going on down there and the grade makes it near impossible to get into that spot. There's about a 6' sloped drop-off. It would be impossible for our big rig. Maybe a small camper van?? We can almost see that spot from where we are, but there's a hill in the way which does make it secluded.

We were able to get water at the Paria Contact Station. Be sure to get there before 4:30pm though because they close the gate. We had to lug 35 gallons in containers and pump it into our rig because we got there at about 5:30pm.

Location: Ocean Avenue, Santa Monica, Los Angeles County, California, 90401, United States
Name: Ocean Ave Street Parking
Description: Street parking on ocean ave, the only sign says no parking noon-2pm on Wednesday. There‚Äôs a bathroom a little walks away at the park which closes at midnight and opens at 5 am. Decent spot! (I believe there is a height restriction, 8 ft)

Location: 3864, TX 35, San Patricio County, Texas, 78336, United States
Name: Picnic Area
Description:
Three picnic pavilions with tables and trash cans.
Some shade in parking loop. Lots of road noise. Good patch of grass away from the highway for dog

Entrance is a sharp left off the highway; be cautious.

Location: Lees Ferry Road, Marble Canyon, Coconino County, Arizona, 86036, United States
Name: Lee‚Äôs Ferry Road
Description: Left side of the beginning of Lee‚Äôs Ferry Road there is a pump house. No sign that not allow parking or overnight stay. Some houses and a motel nearby. Very quiet in the night (only the pump house makes a little bit noise).

Location: Portsmouth Public Library, Parrott Avenue, Portsmouth, Rockingham County, New Hampshire, 03801, United States
Name: street next to park
Description: Nice quiet street next to a baseball field in a park.  No parking signs AT ALL! A few vans already here.  Across street from a really nice library!

Location: 37436, South Shore Road, Madera County, California, 93604, United States
Name: Bass Lake Dam
Description: At the south end of a beautiful alpine lake and a 28-mile drive south of Yosesmite NP, this is a parking spot on the actual dam with unobstructed views of the water and mountains. It is adjacent to a boat ramp with private plumbed bathrooms (so also sinks to fill water bottles). About a dozen cars a day used the parking lot to access the nice trailheads down to the spillway (a cool short hike) and to the forest. That said, we were the only overnight campers and basically had it to ourselves most of the weekend. We almost parked at the boat ramp but a park employee said that was $40 and the dam was free overnight parking. We hiked and kayaked right from our spot. We would highly recommend, the only downside was no shade but great views, proper bathrooms, full 5G cell coverage, and lots of outdoor rec opportunities, lots to love!

Location: Cane Creek Recreation Road, Logan County, Arkansas, 72863, United States
Name: Cane Creek Rec Area
Description: This place is WONDERFUL. Very secluded campground. No services so pack in and pack out. Boat launch right here and can park your boat right up to campsite. Locals are awesome. We met a couple named Kyle and Ann that live close by and just camp here in their free time. They welcomed us in and made us love Arkansas! We travel full time and they are some of the best people we have ever met. I highly recommend this campground.

Location: Sierra Vista Trail, Do√±a Ana County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Sierra Vista
Description: Past the roundabout of the other camping spots. Road a little rough, but doable with our 4x4 sprinter. Looks like there would be more spots further along the road, but the road is too rough for our van. Gorgeous views

Location: County Road 336, Stephens County, Texas, United States
Name: Hubbard creek lake boat ramp & parking
Description: nice big, flat parking area at a public boat ramp. fishermen were here during the day, but quiet and deserted at night. not much here but trash cans, a kaibo and a shade structure. lovely view of the lake, amazing sunset, coyotes howling in the distance, and lots of mosquitoes. stopped at the place down the highway next to the bridge, but that spot was full of trash so we moved on.

Location: Baylor Canyon Road, Do√±a Ana County, New Mexico, United States
Name: alternate entrance to Baylor Canyon Rd Camping
Description: The spot and many others around it are part of a dirt and rock road that also lead to the other listing on iOverlander. I have found that this area, which is just as awesome as the area 3/4 miles away, is less busy and easier to access (the spots closer to the road anyhow, and I don‚Äôt mind the odd-car sleepy traffic on the main road, is far enough away). Amazing sunsets, beautiful views of Las Cruces down below, and you‚Äôre right in front of the Organ ‚ÄúNeedles‚Äù - super dramatic and sharp mountain peaks. There‚Äôs homemade fire pits but otherwise no amenities.

Location: 352, Tangerine Drive, Loxahatchee Groves, Palm Beach County, Florida, 33470, United States
Name: ATV trail to open field
Description:
This is really just an ATV trail but it leads to an open field.  Only really good for a quick overnight camp.  Full Verizon service.  Flat spots - just be mindful of the loose sand which is present in some areas.  Don‚Äôt try this with a big rig - you're going to get stuck.  There is a bathroom with flush toilet available in the park next door, just a short 5 minute walk.  

Best route into the spot begins at the corner of Loxahatchee Ave and Tangerine Drive.

Location: 1539, Edge Street, Monticello Park, Myrtle Beach, Horry County, South Carolina, 29577, United States
Name: Secluded side street
Description: Secluded, shaded parking on a dead end street. It was quiet and peaceful. There‚Äôs a business at the end of this road called Sunbelt Landscaping. Staff started arriving and leaving between 6:00 and 7:00. No one disturbed us.

Location: The Boathouse at Front Street, 2400, Lennoxville Road, Beaufort, Carteret County, North Carolina, 28516, United States
Name: Beaufort Boat Launch
Description: Parking lot at the water. Most are boat trailer sites, but there is a row of normal parking where we parked our 26ft hanging the back over the grass. Police came by so we checked if overnighting was OK here and they said we were fine. it is a weekday off season and nobody there. super quiet night

Location: Riverside County, California, United States
Name: Spacious BLM site
Description: Great spot for multiple vehicles right off the maintained dirt road Long Canyon. Decently clean and beautiful view of mountains and stars! Plus lots of roads for off roading nearby. You can also visit Palm Springs or Joshua Tree NP very easily.

Location: Hatfield, Hempstead County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Bois D'Arc Paradise
Description: Stunning views, quiet, except for the frogs, cranes, ducks... no one around. flat, private, nothing but the moon. Cell phone good on Verizon and att

Location: 788, Brookshire Road, Boone, Watauga County, North Carolina, 28607, United States
Name: Riparian Zone beyond Brookshire
Description: A huge flat gravel parking lot just beyond AppState Soccer field.  With Verizon cell reception.

Location: Lee County, Arkansas, 72352, United States
Name: St Francis Lee 217 Pull-Off
Description:
Pull-Off into a closed forest service road in St Francis National Forest.  Lee 217 is a well maintained gravel road fit for all vehicles.  Very low traffic.

Verizon service very weak.

Location: Forest Service Rd 761, Cottonwood, Yavapai County, Arizona, 86326, United States
Name: FS 761
Description: Several sites on Arizona State Trust land. Permit required.  Close to town and nice gravel road. Many large rv‚Äôs camping further up where the road turns into national forest. This spot was good for several vans.

Location: Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: BLM south Lake Havasu City
Description: lots of space. good for big rigs and trailers closer to the road. more privacy and softer gravel further back. good at&t and Verizon.

Location: Greene County, Alabama, 35462, United States
Name: Lock 7 PUblic Use Area
Description: A large asphalt parking lot with boat ramp. Located along the Warrior River. Free site. Two bars on Verizon. No amenities. Some noise at night from a few cars turning around and a few barges going by but not much traffic after midnight.

Location: Pinal County, Arizona, United States
Name: Arizona Trust Land
Description:
Permit is required for all trust land camping, but it‚Äôs a fast process that is instantly approved. There‚Äôs a lot of sketchy BLM land around Phoenix, so paying a one time fee for nice land + privacy is very worth it!

My Toyota Camry was able to get deep in this area with no issues, but there are a lot of big holes sporadically so be careful. 

If you go in at least half a mile there are a bunch of good spots tucked behind small tree clusters that provide shade in the evening. A few rock fire rings found in random places. Beautiful sunset views of the nearby mount range. 

Don‚Äôt forget to pack everything back out with you!

Location: Zinc Mine Road, San Bernardino County, California, 92366, United States
Name: Mountaintop
Description:
This is a gorgeous spot on top of a mountain. Very private, slight road noise way off in the distance. Amazing view! Slightly unlevel, so blocks would help but there‚Äôs a few more level areas. 5 bars of LTE at this spot. Starlink is great here with wide open skies. We got to it easily with our 2wd for transit van with good off-road tires. Might be tricky if it was raining. There‚Äôs two spots more level before this one.

edit Jan 3rd, 2023
I recommend using the southern road to enter the camping area, as the eastern entrance has a troublesome ditch I had to scout out. it's just slightly more driving time on Zine Mine Road.

coords leading to southern enterance: 35.4408627, -115.5064468

For vans and smaller vehicles only, too many rough twists and turns on this road for bigger vehicles.

Location: N2740 Road, Empire City, Stephens County, Oklahoma, United States
Name: wild camping area
Description: off the road to the west. road in is primitive and bumpy and little muddy,  narrow for rvs, aggressive for cars. my van got through driving carfull. beautiful sunset. peaceful night, gentle wind. I enjoyed it greatly to rest.

Location: Riverside County, California, United States
Name: BLM leftside
Description: This is Joshua Tree blm land. 3 bars verizon. huge opened space. The main dirt road has raised rocky side & this is the only spot I found that has a flat spot to turn off into! not a single person out here. Stayed 3 nights. gorgeous night sky & really quiet. I parked by some taller shrubs & trees & made a little fire ring to mark the spot.

Location: Sojka Drive, Simi Valley, Ventura County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 90363, United States
Name: Street parking next to trees blocking the highway.
Description:
Stealthed with an SUV:
A surprisingly quiet street parking considering it's not far from the highway, maybe 150 feet away.  The thick line of trees block a lot of the noise.  Across the street is a very tall cement fence blocking any view from the house, and there's limited street lights (and almost no traffic) at night.  

Very little foot traffic even at 7am.

Location: Old Hwy 93, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: S Blake Ranch Rd turnoff
Description: Left off of S Blake Ranch Rd over a couple cattle guards and a short washboard primitive road. A number of pull offs along the road to park up suitable for all sized rigs. Parked overnight in our ‚Äò87 Ford Club Wagon with 4 puppies, a dog, and a cat. Quiet and beautiful views and starry sky. There was a cluster of other vehicles and rigs parked in a larger area together but they were quiet. A couple of quads drove by in the morning with no bother to us

Location: Edmonson County, Kentucky, 42207, United States
Name: Nolin Dam Tailwater Rec Area USACE
Description:
US Army Corps of Engineers operated recreation area with boat ramps and picnic shelters, toilets and a playground.  Area is just upriver of Mammoth Cave National Park.

No camping sign at entrance. Doesn't say anything about overnight parking being prohibited.

Weak Verizon network.

Location: CAL Fire San Bernardino Unit, California, United States
Name: Fire-ring near Fence
Description: This spot is right next to the fence.  Gas, a fire ring & 4 bars verizon. Stayed for 3 days, only saw 3 other cars the whole time.  very peaceful

Location: Clark County, Nevada, 89026, United States
Name: BLM land near seven magic mountains
Description: As described in the notes for seven magic mountains, this is the BLM land about one mile south. The paved road leads to several other gravel roads where camping is easily accessible. It's much more private than the parking lot for seven magic mountains. great spot!

Location: Interstate Highway  10 Access Road, Kimble County, Texas, 76874, United States
Name: Dead end road hideaway
Description: Hidden,little windy, dead end road, fairly level, big rig friendly with a backup camera or spotter. Fairly level too. Not seen from the highway or exit.

Location: 6989, El Sol Avenue, Twentynine Palms, San Bernardino County, California, 92277, United States
Name: 29 Palms Dog Park Street parking
Description: There are no parking restriction signs anywhere along this street (El Sol Ave) the dog park is at the end of the street and has water fountains that accommodate water bottles and 1 gallon jugs. there are running toilets up the block, at the park.

Location: Kistler Memorial Highway, McDowell County, North Carolina, 28647, United States
Name: Pisgah National Forest Information Cabin
Description:
I pulled off at this parking lot for the night - plenty of space for larger rigs, right by a walking trail. 
Whole lot isn‚Äôt level but I found a nice flat space to park. Extremely quiet, no lights, but safe.

Location: Hatch Point, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: Canyonlands Overlook
Description:
The view from this place is Wonderful! You will have a incredible view on Canyonlands! You can park or put your tent near the cliff. There is also a pit fire and lot of dead woods on the ground around. The track to come here is ONLY for 4wd with high clearance! There are big rocks and also sand. 
I advise to stop here and continue by foot to go to the end of the track to go to the overlook, it is around 1.5km. Indeed the track begin to be VERY difficult with big rock steps (around 30-40cm).
The sunset and sunrise are so beautiful! Enjoy!
On our side this spot is in our TOP 5 of hundreds overland nights.
In bonus there is ATT signal.
If you need there are toilets at the overlook (1.5km).

Location: Howland Preserve, 546, Vosburg Road, Vosburg, Tunkhannock, Wyoming County, Pennsylvania, United States
Name: Vosberg Neck
Description: Several pull outs between Howland Preserve and Camp Lackawanna. Boondocking overnight only, no camping. Popular parking for hunters.

Location: 4895, High Street, Elyria Swansea, Denver, Colorado, 80216, United States
Name: Elyria Park
Description: Quiet street next to Elyria park. No 'no overnight parking' signs.

Location: Port Orford Heads State Park, King Street, Port Orford, Curry County, Oregon, 97465, United States
Name: Port Orford Heads
Description:
Dead end road with large loop & parking.
Adjacent to the Lifeboat Station Museum where there is a chemical toilet. 
Lovely quiet location-  we didn‚Äôt hear another vehicle all night.
A great spot with 3 bars of cell signal.

Location: Old Cumberland Street, Ashland City, Cheatham County, Tennessee, 37015, United States
Name: Riverbluff Park
Description: Nice little park by the river full of industrial and treated wastewater! No signs banning overnight parking and  cruiser rolled through when we were getting ready to leave at 5am and didn‚Äôt even stop. Nice quiet place to spend the night and much darker than the Walmart up the road.

Location: Pinal County, Arizona, 85145, United States
Name: BLM Wash with shade
Description: Small road with marker near roadway. there are some pretty large trees for shade in the wash. I had visible service when I arrived but it has been spotty. Area is pretty clean. I did find two golf balls and a pile of wire duct. This spot is pretty close to the road but gunfire seems quite a ways away. Sixty percent less pew pew than Cattle Tank Rd.

Location: Hector H. Henry, II Greenway, Concord Mills, Concord, Cabarrus County, North Carolina, 28027, United States
Name: Greenway Parking Lot
Description: Stayed one night at this dog park/greenway. Pretty quiet and easy night of sleep. Some people at the dog park until about 9pm. Large paved flat parking lot. No ‚Äúno overnight‚Äù signs. Bathrooms were locked when we got here at 8pm. Keep it clean!

Location: Dagmar Road, Dagmar, Monroe County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Dagmar Rd WMA Dispersed Camping #1
Description: This is the first marked dispersed camping site off of rt 70. It's approximately 1.5 miles down a dirt/stone road. The road isn't in bad shape. I made it slow-going with a 29 ft TT. There were 2 others farther down the road.  There are places to turn around all the way until the end of the road. Great spot. Some traffic because of boat ramps, maybe 1 car per hour today (weekend day). No amenities. There is a bridge with 15"4' clearance posted.

Location: Woodmarsh Trailhead, High Point Trail, Mason Neck, Fairfax County, Virginia, United States
Name: Trailhead Parking @ Mason Neck Wildlife Refuge
Description: Dirt parking lot for a couple trailheads at this wildlife refuge. Stayed overnight and was the only person parked when I arrived and when I left. There is an outdoor toilet but didn't check to see if it was locked or not. There are no "No Overnight Parking/Camping" signs, only signs to not park on the main road leading up to the parking lot. No patrols when I was there. Don't believe I had reliable cell service with T-Mobile.

Location: CAL Fire San Diego Unit, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, United States
Name: Middle of the damn desert
Description: Was looking at one of the other spots on here and just copied the GPS location. This is definitely not the spot on the map but it‚Äôs a pretty cool area. Saw a couple other cars coming in from the main road but I am definitely out here with plenty of privacy.

Location: 12635, North 42nd Street, Sweetwater Garden, Phoenix, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85032, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description: Decent spot to park for the night. Lots of cars from neighboring apartments parked along this section of road. Paved path at this point, so not in front of houses.

Location: E Forest Service Rd 732, Yavapai County, Arizona, United States
Name: State land off I-17
Description: Just about a mile or less, off I-17. A dirt road, a little bumpy, east of I-17. State Land. Free dispersed camping. Pull offs are not too level, but not too bad. I came in with my 24‚Äô Class C RV towing my car. Found a spot off the main dirt road far enough from the freeway that the noise was minimal. Good cell service. Great views.

Location: Tonelea Trail, Yavapai County, Arizona, 86333, United States
Name: Tonelea Trail - Aqua Fria National Monument
Description: Last good spot. Level. The next spot at the base of the steep hill is in a ‚Äòwash‚Äô and has some mud and cow carcass. The hill was a no go with my fwd Solis, but that‚Äôs ok. Over the hill is the town of Cordes Lakes. Stayed 5 nights at this spot. Still can hear I-17, unless the wind is blowing (which is most of the time)!

Location: SC2, Kern County, California, 93519, United States
Name: Jawbone Canyon Rd #1
Description: Designated camping spot #1 on BLM land. Nice "views" of the pipeline. Far away from the road to be quiet.

Location: 7370, Hawthorn Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, 90046, United States
Name: Los Angeles street parking
Description: Flat quiet neighborhood, no "no parking" signs except for street cleaning. Level and big rig accessible. No services nor stores. Stayed night, no problem, another Class A down the street. Our vehicle is Class B  Sprinter CamperVan.

Location: Speedway, 1008, Plaza Drive, Grass Valley, Nevada County, California, 95945, United States
Name: Grass Valley street parking
Description: Behind 24 hour gas station with convenience, store, in the business district, and just off the freeway. Other parking available nearby, lots of business during the day. No amenities, but the local and pave, and there are dark spots between the street lights.

Location: North 22nd Avenue, Phoenix, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85021, United States
Name: San Valiente Apartments
Description: Street parking outside the gates of the San Valiente apartment complex. Visited a friend who lives in these apartments and we spent a few nights in our Class C here. Lots of truckers who live here park their cabs/rigs outside and we had no problem just parking among them. We didn‚Äôt have any problems with safety but it does seem like homeless or drug addicts pass through the area so lock up and keep valuables out of sight.

Location: County Road 75, Franklin County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Ozark St Francis National Forest
Description: Large pull out with a fire pit on the side of a dirt road. 1 bar of AT&T LTE. Room for a few vehicles. Pretty leveled area.

Location: Wimberly Park, Hope Highway, Hope, Eddy County, New Mexico, 88250, United States
Name: Picnic Area near Highway 82
Description:
Great quiet and level spot in Hope, NM.
On picnic rd near Wimberly Park.
Close to Highway 82 but very low traffic at night and speed limit reduced so very quiet.
Good pit stop when rest is needed and picnic tables available.

Location: 29080, Shoreline Highway, Anchor Bay, Mendocino County, California, 95468, United States
Name: ALPHA Level, no signs pull out w view
Description:
pull out on gravel with nice view of the ocean, no signs and doesn't seem to be an "official" pull out so looks good.
Level. no shelter or privacy from the road.
decent size maybe good for 2 rigs.
att and t mobile service decent enough browsing. probs 3-12 Mbps.

Location: Soda Springs Road, Yavapai County, Arizona, 86342, United States
Name: Soda Springs cliffside view spot
Description:
Stunning spot overlooking the canyon.  Established fire ring.  Scrubjays, grey foxes and coyotes.  Amazing sunsets.  Within walking distance of beaver creek swimming hole and the petroglyphs.
Not reccomended after rain if dont have 4wd.  
Easy access for big rigs when dry - although some potholes and deep ruts to be negotiated.  Im sure the surface of this loop changes often.  There are about 10 more sites on this loop.  All amazing.

Location: Lower Cedar Mountain Road, Emery County, Utah, United States
Name: Roadside
Description: Nice spot with firepit and decent cellular coverage. Close to Buckhorn Draw. Located up behind the corral. Road up to site is very narrow but the site is huge

Location: Devils Garden, Riverside County, California, 92282, United States
Name: Devils Garden
Description: An awesome spot on a ridge top with great views. 4wd only. Two bars T mobile. A fair bit of highway noise but worth it for the views. Really only room for one vehicle.

Location: Charles Brown Highway, Inyo County, California, United States
Name: BLM land off the road
Description:
Entrance is about 100m past this spot if your heading east. 
Quiet night, with plenty of space and options and just far enough off the main road not to hear too much traffic. A couple of bars cell service.

Location: 2900, Colorado Boulevard, Argo Mill, Idaho Springs, Clear Creek County, Colorado, 80439, United States
Name: Great overnight spot
Description: Winter weather moved in so we wanted to stop for the night. Called the Starbucks in Idaho Springs (+13035672578) if we good camp overnight in their lot: no problem. Great quiet paved parking lot behind their building just off I70 and .... coffee served starting at 5am. McDonalds and Subway are next door.

Location: Beaver Creek Road, Yavapai County, Arizona, 86342, United States
Name: Off the road
Description: Right off the road fairly flat. Nothing special good overnight spot

Location: 126, North MacDonald, Mesa, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85201, United States
Name: Mesa Public Parking
Description:
Parking lot at the corner of N. Macdonald St and W. First Street, 1 block north of Main Street, in downtown Mesa. Steps from Museum of Natural History, which is amazing. Lots of restaurants on Main Street, Post Office one block east from the parking lot. Quiet. Residential area. We camp in a 32‚Äô Class C. We parked by the fence in the back as far as possible. Please no big RVs.

Great van overnight place to enjoy downtown Mesa. Be sure to try Outcast donuts and visit the artist studios at Main and Macdonald.

Location: Logtown, Pearlington, Hancock County, Mississippi, 33333, United States
Name: Log Town Boat Launch
Description: Plenty of parking places on the grass and gravel near a gravel boat launch on the Pearl River. No signs posted about anything. Even on a Saturday morning in December no one is launching boats. Very quiet all night long, but a few scattered empty beer cans.

Location: 325, Northeast Hernando Avenue, Lake City, Columbia County, Florida, 32055, United States
Name: Parking Lot with Electric
Description:
Lake City Main Street is nicely revitalized. Its a block away and has good shops and night life. A nearby brewery mention the parking lot was available and commonly used by RVs. The man said they do food truck events here, hence the electric pedestals. I surmise the lot is owned by the city. This is a well lit and not terribly level lot.
We pulled in about 8pm and before bed we saw a police car just drive on by. Saw another on drive by in the morning. Seems we are not where we shouldn't be. Address for this lot is 325 NE Hernando Ave, Lake City, FL

Location: Pima County, Arizona, United States
Name: Quail's Creek
Description:
GUNSITE WASH BLM is a huge place with many spots.
We stay here over one week and love it. So, we name our spot because of many quails in the creek, also hummingbirds around.

Location: Holdridge Road, Imperial County, CAL Fire Southern Region, California, United States
Name: Holdrige Road
Description:
Big dirt space. Two spaces close by to the north, both occupied. Tres Palms was fully occupied, so I pitched up here for the night.
I'm getting 2 bar 5g Verizon.

In the good spaces south of the hot springs, I also passed about 15 or more units.

Beware if it's raining or rain is predicted. 

If a large motorhome makes it down the sandy track. It could pitch up here and easily turn around here. It's up to those drivers to get out and inspect each dodgy spot. While remembering those turnarounds, they've already passed. If not proceeding, they will need to reverse back to an earlier turnaround.

Location: Easy Street, Twin Falls County, Idaho, 89825, United States
Name: Rabbit Spring
Description: Several camp spots and pull throughs for boondocking. Closer to the highway spots are big enough for any RV. Open range land with sage brush for some privacy between sites.

Location: Sidewinder Road, Imperial County, California, 93383, United States
Name: Nisim Village (The Mound)
Description: Close to Los Algodones, close to highway, really good road, large area. Can fit any size of rig. Some noise from the train, but not so bad. 3 to 4 bars on T-Mobile.

Location: ICO Vista Station Building A, 13132, Vista Station Boulevard, Greenfield Farms, Draper, Salt Lake County, Utah, 84020, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description:
Huge shoulder on the west side of this entire road is basically free game. The location is on the west shoulder of Vista Station. Primarily where the coordinate is but the entire road has parking. There are numerous campers along the road.

Galena Hills Park (open 6a to 10p) at the North end has flushing toilets near the baseball dugouts.

Location: Pinnacle Hotel Road Parking Lot/ Mountain Trail, Corridor Trail trailheads, Corridor Trail, Surry County, North Carolina, 27043, United States
Name: Corridor Trailhead
Description: Good sized parking lot with good cell service clean pit toilet and beautiful trail. no parking restriction signs or online. Right on the corner of 2 not very busy roads.  was all quiet until Mr Rooster started carrying on,  he's a big fella too!!

Location: 10619, US 79;US 190, Milano, Milam County, Texas, 76556, United States
Name: Cedar Park
Description: Picnic area. Room to park. Sign says Up to 24 hours, no tents.

Location: 1093, Woodward Avenue, Fort Davis, Jeff Davis County, Texas, 79734, United States
Name: Woodward Avenue
Description:
FREE. No facilities.
Western end of dead end gravel road. Level ground, no street lights, no shade nor privacy. Quiet.  Not ideal for ground tents but possible.

Location: 4792, North 15th Street, Phoenix, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85014, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description:
*Please respect signage.
.....
Calm street parking besides apartments and planned parenthood. Had quite a quiet night besides some briefly loud pedestrians (who probably live in the apartments). Very chill. Probably can't fit big rigs but did see a van here.

Location: Peoria, Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: 360 degrees of spectacular views!!
Description: This spot it probably only accessible by truck or van. The road getting here looks similar to a creek and has a bit of a hill climb at the end, but I made it with a 1 ton stock dually with a truck camper on the back. This spot sets on top of your own private hilltop overlooking lake pleasant and 360 views of beautiful desert landscape and thousands of saguaro cactus and picturesque mountains!!
