We were facing West. beautiful sunset. lots of places back here to camp and plenty of firewood but the dead junipers. We are in a 170 4x4 sprinter van and we made it just fine.

Location: Forest Service Road 762, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Easy Forest Road
Description: 0.9 mile gravel road to camp, just 15 minutes from Flagstaff

Location: State Highway 90, West Vancorum, Montrose County, Colorado, 81422, United States
Name: Dirt Road off Hwy
Description:
Didn‚Äôt sleep here, but did stop to let the pup outside. 

Nothing special here, good for a quick night. Pull onto the dirt road and there‚Äôs a big dirt lot that is on BLM.

I had one bar of T-Mobile. I think I heard people shooting guns nearby (?) so be alert just in case you have animals you want to let run off leash.

Location: Hodgeman County, Kansas, United States
Name: Buckney Valley
Description:
You can go round the river until the dam which you will see on your left hand when you arrive. You can not pass the dam. 

So there are more nice spots to stay.

Location: 1035, Battle Acre Road, New Hanover County, North Carolina, 28449, United States
Name: 1921 Fort Fisher Monument
Description:
MODERATOR NOTE: This site may not be legal (year-round).

This site was suggested by police. Since there seems to have been no places to sleep around Kure Beach, I decided to call the Town Hall to ask if there was a place where we could sleep without having to pay. The lady transferred me to the police department. They said that on Battle Acre Rd, facing the water, it was okay. Yes, there is a big sign with rules that says no, but since we were November 9 and not in summertime, I presume they tolerate it. Pickups with noisy mufflers woke up us a few times, but when do we have the privilege of sleeping close anough to the beach to hear the waves and wake up with a beautiful sunrise, absolutely free? Bonus: Many pelicans were fishing at sunrise. I would go again! :)

Location: Rock Wall Trail #608, Coconino County, Arizona, 85544, United States
Name: FR 608
Description: Nice quiet area right off Forest Road 608. Accessible with 2WD high clearance vehicle if you're coming from the North. if you come from the South entrance GAIA shows it as Rock Wall 608 and looks to be a challenge to climb up but try it if you want adventure. Overall a nice spot, wooded with some dead limbs for a campfire and a premade fire pit.

Location: Nye County, Nevada, United States
Name: Tonapah Dunes
Description: Large parking area next to the Tonapah sand dunes and Crescent dunes solar energy project.   Fascinating place to spend the night.    Decent cell reception, no other facilities.

Location: Dodecanese Boulevard, Tarpon Springs, Pinellas County, Florida, 34689, United States
Name: Bord de rue
Description:
Parking near Tarpon Spring attraction No sign no overnight parking No charge. Spent one night after meal and evening at the restaurant
_______________________________-

Stationnement pr√®s du centre d‚Äôinter√™t Tarpon Spring   Pas pancarte no overnight parking   Pas de frais. Pass√© une nuit apr√®s repas et soir√©e au restaurant

Location: Art Center Lofts, 1501, Doyle Carlton Drive, Clarkes, Tampa, Hillsborough County, Florida, 33602, United States
Name: Bord de rue
Description:
Sign says: 4 a.m. MAX - MON to FRI Slept in on a Saturday night. Perfect. Edge of the riverwalk
_______________________

Pancarte dit : 4 h MAX - MON to FRI   Dormi un samedi soir. Parfait. Bord du riverwalk

Location: Forest Road 151, Rio Arriba County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Riverside dispersed camping
Description: Rolled up to a fire ring and small trail leading to a sandy beach by the river. Here in an Astrovan, high clearance NOT necessary. However, I wouldn‚Äôt come here if it rained recently, as it looks like the side road would turn to mud. No cell service.

Location: 124, 1st Street East, Sonoma, Sonoma County, California, 95476, United States
Name: Street parking by baseball field
Description: We didn't love the two nearby spots, since they were right in front of homes and felt a bit invasive. We parked here instead, on the street right next to a baseball field. Spot was fairly level, very quiet at night and without parking restrictions.

Location: CA 20, Lake County, California, United States
Name: CA Hwy 20 E Roadside
Description: Paved, side of road, level space to pull far over if you need to rest.  Road traffic noise.  There is a truck parked on the other side, so it appears there is also room if driving west.  Pitch black out here, so I decided to pull over and wait for sunrise.  I‚Äôm guessing the traffic will slow down later.  It‚Äôs 7:15 p.m., over two hours since sunset.

Location: Moody Boat Ramp Road, Clay County, Middle Tennessee, Tennessee, 38551, United States
Name: Celina boat ramp
Description: Huge paved parking lot at the boat ramp, fairly level. Porta potty, 3 bars Verizon and T-Mobile. Some locals drove in and out but none stayed. Nice and quiet with birds singing.

Location: Daniel Boone Forest Rd 193, Whitley County, Kentucky, United States
Name: Schoolhouse Arch Campsite
Description:
Small campsite near Schoolhouse Arch landmark. Marked a fire pit made out of stones from the area. Campsite is not level and overall seems more suited for tent camping. From the campsite, you can easily see Schoolhouse Arch!

There is a small turn-off ) on Daniel Boone Forest Road 193 near the marker. The forest road is a well-maintained dirt road, but the turn off is much less maintained. There are many large rocks and deep rutting. I wouldn't risk taking my class B camper (or anything larger) down that road.

Decent cell service in Google Fi

Location: North 89 Pathway, Teton County, Wyoming, United States
Name: Grand Teton Sign Lot
Description: We stayed here last night with no problems. The big Grand Teton sign (on the right if you‚Äôre leaving Jackson or on the left if you‚Äôre entering Jackson) has a pull-out that‚Äôs somewhat tucked away from the road and has quite a few parking spots. No signs about overnight parking and no one bothered us from about 8pm-7:30am. Closest place we could find for informal overnight parking to Jackson (after Nov 1). RAM ProMaster.

Location: Sugar Creek Gap, Jackson County, North Carolina, United States
Name: The Pines
Description: Camp site off a forest service road. Right under the pine trees.

Location: Carolina Moon Trail, Madison County, North Carolina, 28754, United States
Name: Airstrip Camp
Description: Camp spot next old airstrip, need 4x4, good views

Location: Blow Memorial Hall, 262, Richmond Road, Williamsburg, Williamsburg (city), Virginia, 23186, United States
Name: Richmond St at William & Mary College
Description: The only signs were for 2 hour limits during the day.  Seems like a busy road but it was actually quite quiet overnight.  Lots of other vehicles.  WaWa across the street (no bathrooms), and at least some buildings on the campus were open (we went to check out some architecture).  There's a bike lane running between the road and parking spaces, so there's a little extra space.  Very good Verizon signal.

Location: General Crook National Recreation Trail, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: FR 9246R Dispersed Camping
Description: Lots of spots on the first mile of FR 9246R. Suitable for any rig. Entry requires opening a cattle gate that is held closed by a loop of wire. Road noise is audible from these spots.

Location: 533, North Franklin Street, Fort Bragg, Mendocino County, California, 95437, United States
Name: Fort Bragg
Description: Open Parking lot behind First Baptist Church

Location: 1296, Yajome Street, Napa, Napa County, California, 94559, United States
Name: Street Parking by Skate Park
Description: Street parking without restrictions on the streets surrounding the park. Spent one day and night on Yajome St right next to the park, since it was the most level section. Central location in a safe area, really quiet at night and nobody seemed bothered by us staying here!

Location: 1944, 8th Street, Boulder, Boulder County, Colorado, 80302, United States
Name: last parking
Description:
last parking spot in the row. Closest to the alley, unmarked.
most of the parking on this block is 2hr parking or pay to park/permits. However this spot is unmarked & not directly in front of a residence or business. Van friendly. close to your downtown amenities & a little market on the corner.

Location: Forest Road 376, Deer Creek Landing, Sandoval County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Sunny spot above the Rio
Description: Originally stopped at some of the spots father north. However, was disappointed that they put barriers up to get to the Rio in the van and had to park on the road. This spot turned out to be the hidden gem, with a short trail access to the water and a bit farther off the main forest road. 2WD and low clearance, no problem! About 3 or 4 different fire rings also.

Location: FR 50, Marion County, Florida, United States
Name: near a lake
Description: A little place sandy but not too much. Between √† lake , grass and forest. easy access. very quiet.

Location: Yellow Circle Road, San Juan County, Utah, United States
Name: BLM Black Ridge area
Description:
This area is part of the accepted dispersed camping around Moab. Need to go 0.6mile from the road like says the sign. No issue with 2WD.
Very nice spot, plenty of spaces and plenty of rigs but quiet unless you are beside someone with an annoying generator.
See rules on the website of the BLM
https://www.discovermoab.com/blm-campgrounds/

Location: Secret Lake Road, Canton, Capitol Planning Region, Connecticut, 06001, United States
Name: Parking Lot near shops
Description: Parking near Dicks sporting goods kinda. Slept here got down to 27 degrees in my car. Was a bit quiet. Some ominous music playing from one of the stores 24/7 other than that was pretty good. Pretty well lit and there are some gas stations within driving distance that are 24/7.

Location: Chelan County, Washington, United States
Name: Close to the lonely tree
Description: Much space, not super flat, but fine, amazing view on the town and mountains, nobody around. Verizon 1-2 bars.

Location: Jackrabbit Road, Iron County, Utah, United States
Name: Above Parowan Gap
Description: Open area above Parowan gap. Large, flat open area with fire ring, big enough for large rig. Road is a little rough, but fine for lower clearance. 2 bars of verizon 4g, with fast speed test. No facilities, but pit toilet about 1 mile away at Parowan gap petroglyph parking area.

Location: North Pioneer Road, Amber, Clark County, Nevada, 89021, United States
Name: Wild camping Amazing sites beautiful area
Description: This is the main road. Take this into the park. You‚Äôll pass a trailer spot on your left. You can wild camp in hundreds of sites. Fun off roading. Really beautiful area and super spread out. Keep going and get some solid scenery and solitude.

Location: foot path from boat ramp to shell mound, Shired Island, Dixie County, Florida, United States
Name: rampe de mise a l eau ile shired
Description:
Launching ramp before the Shired Island campsite which no longer exists, a picnic area and a ramp area with boat trailer parking, be careful not to park there
The area was devastated by a hurricane the road in places was destroyed but remains very passable we have a non-4x4 camper van which is 7 meters
no service just dry toilets and not much network but no noise and the fishermen didn't say anything to us
Small path to go to the destroyed beach but follow the road and pass by the old campsite

rampe de mise a l eau avant le camping de l ile shired qui n existe plus ,une partie pique nique et une partie rampe avec parking remorque bateau attention de ne pas s y garer
le coin a √©t√© d√©vast√© par un ouragan la route par endroit a √©t√© detruite mais reste tr√©s praticable nous avons un camping car non 4x4 qui fait 7 metres
pas service juste des toilettes seches et pas beaucoup de r√©seau mais aucun bruit et les pecheurs nous ont rien dit 
petit sentier pour aller a la plage d√©truit mais longer la route et passer par l ancien camping

Location: US Highway 67, Midway, Hot Spring County, Arkansas, 71941, United States
Name: under bridge
Description: great spot under the bridge. paved spots and it's right by the water. quiet  and great place for dogs. stayed one night no problems

Location: County Road 7950, San Juan County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Pull off in BLM
Description: Small, hard surface pull-off for one van. Beautiful sunrise and sunfall. A stunning night sky, shimmering with millions of stars. Step out and enjoy the dark sky. It is rare to be in a place with zero light pollution!

Location: 9473, Santa Rosa Creek Road, San Luis Obispo County, California, 93428, United States
Name: Streetloop
Description:
Easily accessible place to stay on Santa Rosa Creek Road.  
Fine for one night. The space is in a loop in the road.  Very quiet at night and little traffic during the day.  
Santa Rosa Creek Road is narrow and steep. Not suitable for large vehicles.  From the square there is a great view through the valley to the west.

Location: 39498, Cuyama Avenue, San Bernardino County, California, 92365, United States
Name: Serena and Cuyama Roads
Description: A good road for an easy overnight behind 76 station on Hwy 15. Needed to exit hwy with a bad accident and backed up traffic.There is some trash but good for a morning walk with dogs. Cool hearing the train in the distance.

Location: South Mammoth Creek Road, Garfield County, Utah, 84762, United States
Name: Near Bowers Cave off Hy 14
Description: Spacious pull off at the edge of a meadow.  plenty of big rig room; no pull-throughs.  Room for 2  - 4 vehicles.  There are a few more spots on the dirt road nearby.  Very close to Bowers Cave, a free cave on BLM.

Location: 2255, North Gemini Drive, McMillian Mesa, Flagstaff, Coconino County, Arizona, 86001, United States
Name: Street parking
Description:
Street parking near federal offices and Buffalo park. [DO NOT CAMP IN PARK OR OFFICE PARKING] Very quiet at night, great for star gazing. Slight slope to packed dirt parking, don't block the bike lane.

bathrooms available at Buffalo Park during the day.

Location: West 11th Street, Pueblo, Pueblo County, Colorado, 81004, United States
Name: Empty Dirt Parking Lot Near Strawberry Fields
Description: its an empty dirt lot. i spotted it a few days in advance when I saw an rv sitting there. i stayed the night. it was quiet besides road traffic noise and pretty dark to be right off a main road.

Location: Washington County, Ohio, United States
Name: Small plateau at the end
Description: Extremely quiet spot. There‚Äôs two trails to walk. Turned around and parked my Minivan on level ground. Wouldn‚Äôt go bigger than that.

Location: Hookipa Park, Kuau, Maui County, Hawaii, 96779, United States
Name: Above Ho'okipa Beach Park
Description: Place for a tent above Ho'okipa beach park. Next to the water tower or something like that. Close to the road but quiet at night. Wind protection. There are toilets in the parking lot, and a restaurant down the road.

Location: Schwenk Drive, Stockade District, City of Kingston, Ulster County, New York, 12401, United States
Name: Fair and Schwenk Streets
Description: Municipal Parking. No "no overnight parking" signs. We see a schoolie parked here early Saturday morning .  Signs say "pay parking 9am to 6 pm Monday through Saturday". Seems quiet... right in Historic District. I have 3 bars Verizon.

Location: East 700 North, Porter County, Indiana, 46383, United States
Name: closed rv campground
Description: This is now a primitive campsite, no RVs are accepted anymore, however I got to the group parking spot around 3pm and started overnight no questions asked. I think it's okay for winter season, I'd go back confidently. but not in the busy season, my guess is that they'll be monitoring this back area more. very quiet, and some nice little hikes in the woods.

Location: Tillamook County, Oregon, United States
Name: scenic spot
Description: this is the location of the scenic spot near the gravel pit

Location: 57238, Afton Canyon Road, San Bernardino County, California, 92338, United States
Name: Afton Road Pulloff
Description: Just another pulloff on Afton road, this one was easily accessible with a big rig. Stayed here for a night, no highway noise.

Location: Buttermilk Road, West Bishop, Inyo County, California, United States
Name: Another in INYO forest
Description: Just another spot in the Inyo National forest. Seems like there is a lot of people who disperse camp out here. I took the first site I could find. Fire pit and level if you don‚Äôt drive up the hill. 1 bar Verizon and 1 bar TMobile home internet. Texting is fine but anything else is slowwww

Location: Eden Terrace, Sedgefield, Rock Hill, York County, South Carolina, 29730, United States
Name: Cherry Park
Description: City park. Nice quiet place with a lot of parking spaces. Other RVs were here when we visited. Only visible sign was ‚Äúunoccupied vehicles left overnight will be towed at owner‚Äôs expense‚Äù.

Location: East Park Link Drive, Pinal County, Arizona, United States
Name: BLM land
Description:
nice roadside spot on relatively quiet highway. we were able to back in our 25' class C with 15' trailer. rock fire ring from previous campers.
Decent road goes to farther off the road, spots for smaller rigs.

Location: Designated Campsite, Mineral Canyon Trail, Grand County, Utah, United States
Name: Canyon land view
Description: Four designated campsite with fire pit. 4x4 is preferred. Amazing view. Just wow!

Location: Sandy Flat Road, Stone County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Sandy Flat Hilltop
Description: Clearing at the side of Sandy Flat Road on a hilltop.  Great view over the hills.  No trees overhead, so great solar charging.  So far no traffic despite hunting season.  Ok Verizon and good T-Mobile signal.

Location: Speaker Road, Speaker, Josephine County, Oregon, United States
Name: Speaker road pull-out
Description: Wide and level spot just before Speaker Rd. starts to branch off into BLM roads. Under huge Sequoia and Ponderosa pine. No cell service. Quiet. No services.

Location: Whitley County, Kentucky, United States
Name: Buzzard Road
Description: Pull in off of Buzzard Rd. Large enough for 1 vehicle and roof top tent. Good ATT service. Small fire ring.

Location: Carroll Summit Road, Churchill County, Nevada, United States
Name: side road tree hideaway
Description: after spending about 2 hours trying to Hot spring at Smith's valley, which was a bust, we had to take off and find camping for the night. turned on the forest road. drove down it but was washed out so turned around and hunkered down behind some trees. Nice enough spot for the night, beat a campground. built a fire ring and is on BLM land.

Location: Moose Creek Trail, Teton County, Wyoming, United States
Name: Moose Creek Trail Access
Description:
Trailhead parking and several level gravel campsites with fire rings and bearproof food storage boxes.

Good gravel road adequate for two wheel drive Promaster 

Five day camping limit sign posted

Stayed one night, very quiet, spotty Verizon cell coverage

Location: Washington County, Colorado, United States
Name: Reserve area
Description: Another spot in the Prewitt Reservoir. Wild, quiet and level for a van. Wide gravel road coming in that loops for easy access. Fire pits in some areas.

Location: B Street, Crescent City, Del Norte County, California, 75531, United States
Name: pull out before pier
Description: small pull out before the pier big enough for a few rigs possibly. 3 bars of signal. theres a bigger pullout that was marked but it was flooded when i was there so this spot before it worked fine. stayed from 3pm to 10am in van. 1 other van stayed the night also. no "no" signs. no one bothered.

Location: Shoreline Highway, Bivalve, Marin County, California, 94956, United States
Name: Tomales Bay Scenic Turnout
Description: Really scenic spot overlooking the bay. Very little traffic passing and the spot is fairly level. No signs other than a call box, so I believe overnight stays are fine. Adequate 4G signal (7mbps). Only big enough for one large van or two smaller vehicles.

Location: Blaylock Creek Road, Polk County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Blaylock Creek Site
Description: This spot has become one of my favorites in the area. A tad technical to get in, as you will need to navigate between two trees. Room for plenty of vehicles and tents, with ample flat spots. Two fire rings. Creekside. Close to plenty of camping. Enjoy!

Location: 2023, Linden Highway, Hohenwald, Lewis County, Middle Tennessee, Tennessee, 38462, United States
Name: Roadside Pulloff
Description: Large, gravel, flat roadside pulloff is good for a quick overnight stop. Bordered by the road and woods. Quiet at night, but you'll be up early (8am) with lots of travel and truck noise. Rolled in at 9, out at 9, no problems. Woods are posted for no hunting. No other signage.

Location: BLM Route 6101A, Fremont County, Colorado, United States
Name: Curly limit sunset with Mountain View‚Äôs
Description: You can see the outline of the city, as well as Mount I‚Äôve views and trails everywhere. Established fire pit. Very Rocky. I have a jeep wrangler so very easy for me. Will be back! :)

Location: Forest Service Road 126, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Remote near Twin Arrows
Description: South of Hwy 40 at Twin Arrows, at the end of Twin Arrows Rd the road leads to a wide gravel/dirt road extending miles into the wilderness.  The road is labeled Pollock Ranch Rd and/or Forest Service Rd 126.  The road is primarily used by hunters and extends through cattle pastures, national forest, tribal land and more.  There is a white posting near the entrance which requests you to log your vehicle and to respect the land.  You can go as far as you want to escape the noise of the highway, there are not a lot of turnouts but good spots can be found.  We went a few miles up the road before the fork in the road, it was super quiet and a nice spot.  Great views of the stars!  4WD not required, but be mindful of heavy mud in stormy conditions, you may end up being stuck if you are not prepared.

Location: National Forest Development Road 2652, Bonner County, Idaho, United States
Name: On the edge of National Forest
Description: Noticed there weren‚Äôt a lot of good quiet spots in the area so here‚Äôs a good legal one! A nice open area with a small fire pit. Any car can get here, but it may get very muddy or snowed in at times. Didn‚Äôt explore much but I‚Äôm sure there are probably lots of good options further down this road and the others near by. Hope this helps those looking for a good private spot while traveling throughüëç

Location: 99, Chester York Road, Rabun County, Georgia, 30525, United States
Name: Tallulah River Boat Ramp
Description: Large 1 acre or so flat and level gravel parking area with some grass right next to the river and boat ramp. It‚Äôs in the middle of the forest. There are no ‚Äúno camping‚Äù signs nor anything prohibiting overnight use. Extremely quiet and pretty. Only about 5 minutes from the main road, hwy 76. The road leading here is all paved. Perfect place for a quick and quiet overnight. 0-1 bar of service on Verizon but Starlink worked great.

Location: Robert Louis Stevenson Elementary School, 34th Avenue, Sunset District, San Francisco, California, 94166, United States
Name: Sunset District Street Parking
Description:
Great spot that we stayed at for almost a week. One of the few spots we were able to find in the sunset district that wasn't directly in front of someone's home but didn't have any restrictions. It's street parking right by a school. Were able to park on 34th ave right by the intersection with Pacheco St. This is the most level area on the street, further down it gets pretty slanted. Might have to arrive in the evening to find a spot since there aren't many. 

It's a very safe residential area that is super  silent at night, nobody seemed bothered by us and the only parking restrictions are a couple of hours twice a month for street cleaning (2nd and 4th Thursday each month). Please be respectful and stealthy if parking here since it's close to homes and a school.

Location: West 14th Street, Fort Stockton, Pecos County, Texas, 79735, United States
Name: Large ruff dirt parking.
Description: We stayed overnight many times. Never be disturbed by authority. Many tractors van in and out all night but not bad if you park away of the middle.

Location: 70, Linwood Road, Linwood, Fraser Township, Bay County, Michigan, 48634, United States
Name: Linwood Boat Launch
Description: large parking area on Saginaw Bay Just outside the campground at the boat launch. I wouldn't recommend parking an an RV here since the campground is literally next door, however it's great for a van or passenger vehicle for a night. Got here late and woke up with no issues in the morning. Porta potty on the property. quiet and non-descript.

Location: 4242, Southeast Harrison Street, Hector Campbell, Milwaukie, Clackamas County, Oregon, 97222, United States
Name: Street Parking Behind Safeway
Description: Van or car parking on the north side of the street behind Safeway. Close to gas stations and shopping. Fairly quiet and out of the way.

Location: Steinhatchee Falls Trail, Taylor County, Florida, United States
Name: Near river
Description:
the gps brought us here while we looked for the other location nearby, but it was on the other side of the river. Here there is a clearing for 3 or 4 large platforms and a few smaller ones on the edge of the stream, super peaceful, quiet and dark at night.

--------------

o GPS nos trouxe at√© aqui enquanto procur√°vamos outro local pr√≥ximo, mas era do outro lado do rio. Aqui h√° uma clareira para 3 ou 4 plataformas grandes e algumas menores na beira do riacho, super tranquila, silenciosa e escura √† noite.

Location: US 287;WY 789, Fremont County, Wyoming, United States
Name: Johnny Behind The Rocks BLM Trailhead
Description:
Trailhead parking lot, level gravel, no signs prohibiting camping, nice 12 miles of non-motorized trails for hiking/biking/horseback 

Poor Verizon cell coverage even with booster.

Location: Lakeside Drive, Chapman, Corte Madera, Marin County, California, 94939, United States
Name: Street parking
Description: Street parking all along this road and a few roads over, it is 2 hour parking from 7am to 6 pm and no limit overnight. We stayed one night with no issues, the whole area felt very safe and restaurants and coffee were all within walking distance. Not recommended for big rigs, it‚Äôs essentially stealth camping.

Location: Frog Lake Trail, Snohomish County, Washington, United States
Name: Frog Lake
Description: Nice spot next to the lake, at the end of the aide road east of the lake. Enough space for two vans. 1 bar AT&T cell reception.

Location: Morlaine Road, Cayce, Lexington County, South Carolina, 29033, United States
Name: Grandby Gardens Park
Description: This is just a strip of parking spots next to a park right before you enter the municipal building. I slept here overnight in my car, no issues and very quite. I highly recommend the little church across the street, Calvary Chapel, to visit. They were so, so nice to me on Sunday.

Location: 3538, North Calle Rosario, Pima County, Arizona, 85750, United States
Name: Tucson
Description: Large gravel lot which accomodate rigs of any size.

Location: 522, Southeast 26th Avenue, Buckman, Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon, 97214, United States
Name: Street Parking - Lone Fir Cemetery
Description: Angled spots directly in front of cemetery or parallel parking on the other side of the street. Very quiet and peaceful. Good for vans or smaller rigs. Added bonus: You can enjoy a cup of coffee in the morning while strolling through Lone Fir.

Location: Foresta Road, El Portal, Mariposa County, California, 95318, United States
Name: Yosemite El Portal
Description: On 140, about 300 fit before El Portal on your left side of the road, between the trees, there is a good gravel road. We entered with 31 fit motorhome with no problem. The place is leveled. There is place for 3-4 RV. No signs at all. You see a white trailer, park neer it.

Location: Osage County, Oklahoma, United States
Name: Caney Bend (COE Land)
Description: Old abandoned and overgrown campground. This spot is a little clearing with a fire pit, overlooking the water.

Location: Boat Ramp Parking, Seaview Avenue Northeast, Ballard, Seattle, King County, Washington, 98017, United States
Name: Golden gardens park
Description: Lots and lots and lots of parking space. No no camping signs. A beach, BBQ grills, picknick tables and restrooms at the building north of the beach.

Location: West Houser Road, Eloy, Pinal County, Arizona, 85131, United States
Name: Huge open field
Description: Quiet place to stop. Huge open field. Railroad tracks close by. But I parked way on the other side of them. I was able to let my dog run. That‚Äôs always helpful. Not really any trees or bushes or anything. Just a big huge open field.

Location: 64C, Kane County, Utah, United States
Name: Arch camp
Description: Sweet spot past ‚Äúcamp dream‚Äù, plenty of space, easy drive in Tacoma

Location: 375, Hope Avenue, Ballpark, Salt Lake City, Salt Lake County, Utah, 84115, United States
Name: Street parking next to Walmart
Description: The street next to the Walmart parkade. A few big rigs parked overnight as well. Was quiet. Definitely nothing special but stayed 2 nights with no issues

Location: National Forest Development Road 4818, Kittitas County, Washington, 98925, United States
Name: Kachess Dam Power Lines
Description: Another wild camping spot suitable for big rig. As you enter you‚Äôll see power lines crossing left to right. Two dirt roads each side, with lots of connecting strips between. We parked on one of these in our 40ft MH. Frozen ground but not an issue. May be muddy after heavy rain. Starlink works surprisingly well and two bars AT&T.

Location: I 20, Pyote, Ward County, Texas, 79788, United States
Name: Safety Rest Area
Description: Huge pull throughs, smooth roads, and lots of spots. However, if you have dogs, watch for the goatheads in the "grass"

Location: Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: Route 88 past Tortilla Flats
Description: Very big parking spot , actually there are few different spots along the road , of course no amenities we are in the wilderness about 2 miles past Town Tortilla Flat ( even if it says road closed in 2 miles) going  up 2niles to the end of paved road.Very quiet , peaceful and felt very safe.Enjoy Respectfully!

Location: Saline County, Arkansas, United States
Name: Primitive roadside spot
Description: Good sized, mostly flat area on the side of a gravel road. Has a nice fire pit, and plenty of space for tents. Small rigs can use it with no problem. Too many trees for large rigs. There's a  2nd spot nearby, both are well used by locals.

Location: Stewarts Point, Clark County, Nevada, United States
Name: More on Lake Mead
Description: Another spot on Lake Mead right near the water. This one has a fire pit. Gorgeous views, tons of space. We‚Äôre here on thanksgiving and so are plenty of others but it is quiet and beautiful. 1-2 bars Verizon - usable but a little slow at times.

Location: Old US 80 (Abandoned), Owl, Yuma County, Arizona, United States
Name: Another west side
Description: Just inside the BLM Boundary. Can hear a bit of interstate noise but quieter overnight. Lovely views & sunsets. Keep it clean. Pack it in & out. 5 bars service.

Location: County Road 1910, Tyler County, Texas, 77663, United States
Name: Sundew Trailhead
Description: spots for 6 vans, pit toilets, picnic shelter, quiet, in the woods, no signs banning overnight parking. We just had lunch and a walk.

Location: 1025, Highway 665, Point-Aux-Chenes, Terrebonne Parish, Louisiana, 70377, United States
Name: Bayou Montegu
Description: Very large gravel parking. lot of fishers. Very quiet. no issues.not for big RV because access by √† little bridge

Location: Natchez Trace NP - Rocky Springs, Claiborne County, Mississippi, United States
Name: Natchez Trace mile marker 54
Description: About 20 sites with fire pits and bathrooms.

Location: Camp Rock Road, San Bernardino County, California, 92327, United States
Name: Camp Rock Rd.
Description:
FREE. No Facilities.
This is a large level pullout with commanding views. 
Plenty of other options on this gravel road which is a great alternative (for intrepid explorers) to Highway 247 from Daggett to Lucerne Valley.

Location: South US Highway 83, Asherton, Dimmit County, Texas, 78827, United States
Name: Summit County Northbound Picnic Area
Description:
2 picnic benches with awnings. pretty over grown and lots of trash. Super busy hwy lots of road noise.


Texas Law allows 24hr park at all rest areas and picnic areas.

Location: 171, Tully Road, San Jose, Santa Clara County, California, 95111, United States
Name: Side of the street parking.
Description: There has been vehicles parked here every time I have driven by. I needed a place in a pinch and stopped here. It was surprisingly quiet. There are lights and cars, but not many until morning. I hit it after dusk and left right after dawn.

Location: Vekol Valley Road, Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: Nice spots.
Description: Right behind where I stayed are a number of spots with fire rings. Hard to see from the road. Better for tents and smaller rigs.  Pickup with a RTT is perfect. More secluded but spots are fairly close together so if there were neighbors it wouldn't be.

Location: Jacob's Crosscut Trail #58, Pinal County, Arizona, 85218, United States
Name: Broadway Trailhead
Description: Nine parking spaces of various sizes. Far right is long enough for any class B.  Access to Tonto National Forest.  Parking only. No amenities.  Residential area, so stealth parking.

Location: 31896, Plaza Drive, Plaza Del Obispo, San Juan Capistrano, Orange County, California, 92675, United States
Name: Road parking in Avenida Padre
Description: We spent the night here with our small RV. We parked on the road in line with many other cars. There are no signs about parking. Next to highways so we had some car noises throughout the night but nobody bothered us. We stayed on a Saturday to Sunday night so the parking of the businesses next to us stayed empty and quiet and we slept in until 8 am. Might be different on weekdays.

Location: Lake County, Oregon, United States
Name: Clifftop Spire
Description: Awesome, scenic spot between the junipers and rock formations on top of a sizeable sheer cliff with a volcanic rock outcrop above. Great views but protected. Not for big rigs or RVs, but fairly easy to reach, depending on the weather 4x4 may be recommended. No services, but a fire pit. Good cell service. Super quiet.

Location: Wey Lane, Bella Vista, Benton County, Arkansas, 72715, United States
Name: Pinyon
Description: Decent spot down double track. After getting off main road, cross a bridge then right onto a double track. A few pull offs. Spotty cell service. Did fine with an extender.

Location: 1907, 20th Street, Potrero Hill, San Francisco, California, 90103, United States
Name: 20th and Carolina
Description: Good spot with no parking limitations aside from street cleaning between 8am and 10am on Mondays. Parked here to stay in the city for a few days with several other vans nearby. Not lots of flat options but safe neighbourhood for a night or to leave your rig while in the city. Coordinates are in front of a fence and hedge so didn't feel like we were too close to any residents to be respectful!

Location: Keyesville Road, Lake Isabella, Kern County, California, 93205, United States
Name: lake Isabella valley
Description: This is a nice place for overnight stay. We are with motorhome 31 fit. No problem to get in. No any signs, some trees around, very quiet and most of it is leveled. We met uther RViers that told us that thete is a little water flow during winter and spring. 2 lines T-Mobile, good internet. No water, no toilets, no electricity.

Location: Sage Crest Drive, Orcutt, Santa Barbara County, California, 93455, United States
Name: Rice Ranch Open Space
Description: A quiet and very nice gravel parking lot on a dead end road on the outskirts of the city. Asphalted access road. Very good 4G reception. No indication of no camping or no overnight parking. Several hiking trails start from here.

Location: 10735, Ocean Drive, Culver City, Los Angeles County, California, 90230, United States
Name: quiet street parking culver city
Description:
we used this spot to visit a Thanksgiving event. arrived around 4pm left at 9 next morning. its a long quiet streer with streetparking in booth directions.
no parking for street cleaning on fridays 10am to 2pm and on thursdays 8am to 12noon. didn't see any other restrictions.

Location: Campanula Avenue, Saticoy, Ventura, Ventura County, California, 93004, United States
Name: Campanula Avenue
Description: Flat wide street between a mobile home park and berry fields. No signs indicating any restrictions. Nothing blocking the sun to the east, but good shade to the west. Beautiful view of the mountains. Nice and quiet.

Location: 85, Julian Street, Ventura, Ventura County, California, 93001, United States
Name: Julian Street
Description: Street parking on the north side of this short, dead end street with no signs indicating any kind of restrictions. Very well lit industrial area. Gets busy on weekday mornings. Some highway noise but not too bad. Be aware there‚Äôs a large homeless tent encampment on the opposite side of the freeway on the Ventura river and people wander by here all day and night. Camp at your own risk.

Location: 9016, Santa Ana Road, Live Oak Acres, Ventura County, California, 93001, United States
Name: Santa Ana Road
Description: Roadside parking with a great view. No restrictive signs. Can fill up quickly on busy weekends. Road gets busy if Hwy 33 is jammed.

Location: 635, South Montgomery Street, Ojai, Ventura County, California, 93023, United States
Name: S Montgomery Street
Description: Well shaded area on a moderately busy road near the south end of Libbey Park. Very quiet at night. Beautiful setting. Park restrooms and water fountains easily accessible. A short walk to everything downtown Ojai.

Location: Galena Gulch Road, Summit County, Colorado, United States
Name: Flat secluded spot
Description: Flat spot off of a wild forest service road. Next to A stream. In winter, need 4x4. Maybe a van will fit but a truck for sure will. I  camped here in the winter and a van. Would have a difficult time turning around.

Location: Forest Service Rd 288, Haywood County, North Carolina, United States
Name: Forest Road 288
Description: Nice level pull off that is level for both tent camping or overland/camper van, additional room if you had a second vehicle but not very level.    Road is single track, rock/dirt with few places to pass every few hundred yards.  Traveled road during rain and was not terrible or too slick.  Would not recommend trailer or traditional camper vehicle on this road. Drive is about 20 min from main road.

Location: Palouse to Cascades State Park Trail, Grant County, Washington, 99321, United States
Name: Tortuga Flats
Description: Nice (almost level) spot a quarter mile off the road and next to the abandoned railroad path (Palouse to Cascade Trail)

Location: Shoreline Highway, Anchor Bay, Mendocino County, California, 95445, United States
Name: Large flat paved pull out
Description: Big enough for a few large RVs. Spent one night with another van and an RV. Road gets calm after 10.

Location: Red Bluff Road, Shasta, Shasta County, California, 96087, United States
Name: By an Old Bridge
Description:
Pullout by a small old bridge that has been decommissioned. Lot can fit a few cars/vans but it's not very level. This is an alternative to the spot near HWY 299 that is exactly opposite to a house.

UPDATE: Night was extremely quiet as there was barely any traffic in the area. However, in the morning cops knocked on my windows looking for someone that broke into a school nearby and stole stuff. This might be a rougher area so stay at your own risk.

Location: Angelina County, Texas, United States
Name: Holly Bluff
Description: Dispersed camping deep east Texas. Good road in,  Very difficult to set up trailer. Pretty messy. Due to trees probably little to no solar.

Location: Grand Street, Yeso, De Baca County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Yeso Village (Ghost Town)
Description: This town has only 8 people living here in three houses. The remaining houses are abandoned and rundown. The Post Office actually has potable water outside in a faucet... So you can refill your bottles. I asked permission to camp by one of the residents and she said that this old abandoned church was a fine place to take shelter from the wind. I cleaned up the church and put steel panels on the broken windows for added wind protection. Please keep this place clean. You can fit several tents inside the church. Leave it in better shape than you found it. I left a pile of nails and a good hammering rock for you to continue making repairs. I also left a homemade broom for you to sweep the floor.

Location: FM 2262, Nigton, Trinity County, Texas, 75926, United States
Name: ACWHA
Description: Flat spots to camp. Did have Port-cans but full of disposable diapers. Right new to FM 2262. Noisy at night.

Location: Broad River Road, Newberry County, South Carolina, 29126, United States
Name: Hellers Creek Boat Launch
Description: Large slightly sloping gravel parking area. Pit toilets not in great shape, but usable. Busy during duck hunting season, but most leave before noon. No signs prohibit overnight parking.

Location: BLM-0065, La Paz County, Arizona, United States
Name: BLM land
Description:
Nice elevated flat area just beside road - don‚Äôt need 4x4 although the track is a little rough coming in 

Check your weather forecast first as this site is surrounded by wash and you may find yourself stuck if there is heavy rain in the surrounding area

Location: NM 1, Socorro County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Pull off on highway 1
Description: Gravel pull-off on a quiet road, gorgeous 360 degree views. A few other spots between here and bosque del apache.

Location: Muddy Creek Road, Eagle County, Colorado, United States
Name: BLM near Wolcott
Description:
Flat space within the BLM just past the private property area. Left after cattle guards is a flat spot with 1 fire ring. Great views with zero noise. Big rig to small tent friendly. About 8K ft high. 2wd/FWD could make it in dry conditions. Ground was frozen with some snow and was a non-issue. Easy to get to but washboard roads of course. 

2 bar VZW 9dn .47up - yuck
3 bar AT&T 30dn 15up
4 bar T-Mobile 5G 287dn 90up - wow

Location: 1435, Northeast Beech Street, Sabin, Portland, Multnomah County, Oregon, 97212, United States
Name: Street Parking next to Whole Foods
Description: side street parking next to the whole foods parking lot. good for one night for vans or other small rigs

Location: Forest Service Rd 217A2, San Jacinto County, Texas, United States
Name: Hunter‚Äòs Camp SHNF
Description: Hunter camp in the forest. No amenities. access to lone star hiking trail, very nice to walk your dogs or hike by yourself. 2 bars AT&T and open space to get Starlink connection.

Location: North US Highway 83, Real County, Texas, 78873, United States
Name: Simple Pull-Off
Description: Simple pull-off on side of road large enough to fit whatever size vehicle you are in/towing. There‚Äôs nothing for many, many miles heading north - this was the best/safest spot we came across. No distinct pull off but hard dirt pad is clear near wildlife fencing. You may need to restart your phone to get service.

Location: 29095, Airline Highway, Pinnacles, San Benito County, California, 95043, United States
Name: Beside a quiet road
Description: A large flat pull-off. Quiet. Beautiful hills. Only a half hour north of Pinnacles National Park.

Location: Double Hot Springs, Humboldt County, Nevada, United States
Name: Double Hotspring
Description: Roomy camping below Double Hotsprings. 3 sketchy outhouses, fire rings and vista over the northern playa. A bathtub where hot water can be piped in, but currently pipes are not in good shape. The springs themselves are way too hot, stay out and stay alive! Access road from 217 is very slow going and will give your suspension a shake-out. Expect to drive 20km/h most of the way due to rocks and little washouts, that can catch you off guard. During or after rain it might be impassable. High clearance and good tires a definite must!

Location: Black Rock Hot Spring, Humboldt County, Nevada, United States
Name: Black Rock Hotspring
Description:
Dispersed camping min 300ft from the spring, situated just below Black Rock Point pyramid  with stunning views over the playa! No services, no cell reception, but a wonderful natural pool to soak up the heat.
The last 10km coming in from Double Hotsprings may be slick and muddy after rain. When dry, access via the playa can be much easier.

Location: 2712, South Ponte Vedra Boulevard, South Ponte Vedra Beach, Saint Johns County, Florida, 32082, United States
Name: Sandy Parking Lot, Hear the Ocean
Description: Great sanded parking lot. Quite. No street lights. You can hear the ocean waves crashing. Bonus Gas station next door that closes at 11pm

Location: East Amado Road, Palm Springs, Riverside County, California, 92292, United States
Name: A parking lot
Description: You guessed it‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a parking lot. Not sure what it‚Äôs actually associated with. Well lit, quiet except for some street noise. Most of the parking lot is closed off currently. Looks newly renovated.

Location: 1651, East 8th Street, Tempe, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85281, United States
Name: East 8th Street
Description: plenty of overnight parking spaces along e 8th st in front of dog park. between 8a-4p on weekdays 90 min only, but no restrictions otherwise. close to a coffee shop and a brewery.

Location: East US Highway 277, Eagle Pass, Maverick County, Texas, 78853, United States
Name: EB Maverick County Line Rest Area
Description:
right on East bound side of 277 between Carrizo and Eagle pass just  about 2 miles west of the Border patrol check point is a 2 picnic table pull out. Garbage cans only. No bathroom, no water no nothing. 
super busy highway lots of noise.
Texas Law allows 24hr parking at all rest and picnic areas.
ok T-Mobile cell service

Location: Rock Lake Road, King County, Washington, 98288, United States
Name: Clearing near Evan‚Äôs lake
Description: Continue all the way up the road to where it dead ends. Nice and flat, room for a few rigs. Decent views through the trees. About 8in of snow here in November. Nice and quiet, didn‚Äôt see anyone the whole time I was here. Big rigs won‚Äôt fit here. I was brushing up against vegetation in my taco

Location: US 89, Page, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Another spot
Description: The road is a little rough coming in so I turned left at the fork and this is the first site on the left hand side. The road keeps going - I‚Äôm sure there are more. There‚Äôs a fire ring here. It does get pretty windy. 3 bars Verizon signal. Very quiet.

Location: Deep Creek Road, Graham County, North Carolina, United States
Name: Deep Creek Rd - National Forest
Description: Remote tree-covered spot with creek, hard cover, fire ring, and table. NO internet with Verizon or ATT.

Location: Commerce Street, Danebo, Eugene, Lane County, Oregon, 97402, United States
Name: Douglas Gardens Park
Description: Street parking near a park. Seasonal restroom nearby (closed in winter), garbage cans, good cell service.  No parking restrictions.

Location: 550 - 29, Forest Road 550, Jefferson County, Colorado, 80425, United States
Name: Site 29 dispersed camping
Description: Large and off the road. Site next to it up the road did have a porta potty. Site 28 is very close to this site at the road side 550. No useable cell signal even with signal booster. Narrow road getting to the site so I will not recommend for rigs larger than us at 24 ft.

Location: Millard County, Utah, United States
Name: Sevier Lake Hwy50 Utah
Description: a quiet spot four or five miles off of highway 50 on a passable single lane dirt road. should be passable in wet weather. desert with sagebrush. not near the lake. on again off again Verizon connection. I'd stay here again.

Location: Crooked Creek OHV Staging Area, Shotgun Creek Road, Mabel, Lane County, Oregon, 97454, United States
Name: Shotgun Creek BLM
Description: This is an OHV day use staging area on BLM land.  Shotgun Creek Recreational Area. We stayed in this small parking lot off season and had it to ourselves in a truck camper after a couple OHV's left. There is a couple staging areas around here, all paved roads and a vault toilet if needed. It might be a bit busy in the "go" season, but now it is good.

Location: British Petroleum Wildlife Area, Grandview Road, Birch Bay, Whatcom County, Washington, United States
Name: Hunting Trailhead. Birch Bay
Description:
A decent-sized gravel and dirt lot that's used as a trailhead mainly for hunters.
There is always one or two people who come in to idle or play their radio loud at night and early morning. Fills up in the morning and lessens by afternoon but is empty near dusk. I've stayed here many times, a security vehicle comes by and parks for a minute between 6-7 PM. Not the best Verizon but it still loads.

Location: Chaves County, New Mexico, United States
Name: BLM camp spot off Alamo Rd
Description: Nice camp spot next to some craters, will need a high clearance vehicle since the roads are pretty rough. Would be careful if it's been wet due to possible muddy conditions. Great overlook of Roswell.

Location: Piccadilly, 533, Lapalco Boulevard, Timberlane, Gretna, Jefferson Parish, Louisiana, 70056, United States
Name: Open parking
Description: The parking is next to a racetrac fuel station. I use it as a place to stay overnight when I‚Äôm car camping to work in the city. The station is open over night. Provides general goods and a clean restroom. I see overland conversion vans stay here from time to time. Very temporary of course. Small rvs and small conversion trucks can get away with overnights here.

Location: San Juan County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Badlands spot for cars/vans. best cell signal
Description:
Small spot with room for 2 cars/vans. 4wd not needed in dry weather, though road is bumpy in some parts. 4 to 5 bars 4g w/Verizon. Good view on top of a ridge overlooking the badlands. 

1st spot is behind a tree, 2nd spot is up a slight incline behind another tree.

I wouldn't recommend large trucks/rvs for this spot, since space is a bit tight.

Extra directions: when putting the coords in Google maps, the virtual road stops short as the road continues. Simply go up the hill w/ the bumpy road then take the left located right after reaching the top of the hill (this left can be easy to miss if arriving after dark). Continue pass an oil rig, the spot will be by a standing tank.

Location: 13, Mule Canyon Road, Chaves County, New Mexico, 88339, United States
Name: Ntl forest boondocking
Description:
Up this dirty road, not too rough. as soon as you pass the national forest sign, there's is a large area with fairly flat grounds. could fit many campers. 

no views but easy hike up to the surrounding hills and have huge views. no services whatsoever.

Location: CR 30, Eleven Mile, Franklin County, Florida, United States
Name: Apalachicola Bay Overlook
Description:
Sandy road, dead end, beautiful overlook spot. At low tide, there are dozens of beach Islands. Fairly quiet main road. The end of the sandy road is about a tenth of a mile off the main road.  No neighbors. Super quiet. No bugs.  
No amenities beyond the view.

Location: Forest Service Road 764, Coconino County, Arizona, United States
Name: Another FS spot
Description: All the way up the road there‚Äôs a small clearing, literally nothing else. I managed to fit my class B. I don‚Äôt think anything larger would make it without ruining plants. The other spot was taken, and I was desperate, it worked for the night! 1-2 version bars. Good t mobile home internet

Location: Riverside Road, Mesquite, Clark County, Nevada, United States
Name: Flat Desert Canyon Camping
Description: Open flat space with views of canyons and mountains

Location: Lassen County, California, United States
Name: Ft Sage Hwy 395 Doyle CA
Description: Sail Rock, a beautiful little spot up high with a gorgeous view of the valley below next to a large rock. it's a little hard to get level and good only for a small rig. I was able to level my 18 ft travel trailer. the last section of road is a bit bumpy but manageable. two bars of Verizon. About 2 or 3 miles from the main area Ft Sage camping area, which is also nice.

Location: Mitchell Mine Road, Plomosa, La Paz County, Arizona, United States
Name: Outside Q on EAST dome Rock Rd
Description: Nice flat areas with decent Verizon. Starting to fill up I. December though. Lots of noise from I-10. Otherwise checks all the boxes for a decent spot. BLM 14 day limit

Location: Hovander Trail Parking, Nooksack River Trail, Whatcom County, Washington, 98248, United States
Name: 2 Trail heads on each side of road.
Description:
There are 2 trailheads on either side. Both have packed gravel and rock roads.

The northern one is smaller and exposed to weather in an open field. But very empty at night and in the morning. Has a small amount of night activity from idling to loud music. Has lots of car lights shining from the road.

The south side lot is much larger and has a trash can. It has some trees to block the wind and has much fewer car lights shining in. However, during hunting season, it fills up quickly in the early morning. 

I have stayed at both for multiple nights and have had no issues.

Location: 138th Trail, Harrison County, Iowa, 51545, United States
Name: Loess Hills State Forest
Description: Primitive camping in the Little Sioux Unit of the Loess Hills State Forest. No amenities, but free and secluded

Location: Shrimp Boat Lane, Old Village Historic District, Millwood, Mount Pleasant, Charleston County, South Carolina, 29964, United States
Name: Shem Creek Boardwalk
Description: Public parking next to restaurants and public bathroom. Slept here all night with no issues.

Location: Carter Cove, Tupelo, Lee County, Mississippi, 38804, United States
Name: Empty Street - Dead End
Description: Dead end street behind a major chain hotel. No street lights. Large grass field next to it. Cars, Sprinters no problem, towables or larger are doable without us of the turn around at the end. This site may get developed in the future but for now it's perfect for parking and being left alone.

Location: 1199, Southeast Veitch Street, Gainesville, Alachua County, Florida, 32601, United States
Name: Park D√©p√¥t
Description:
very large car park, next to the D√©p√¥t park, possibility of free parking, no signals, no No Overnight signal. This is a former municipal depot which is no longer used. We haven't tried it but there is water along the blue building. Very little traffic and possibility of parking with a very large RV. Be careful not to get too close to the waste container because there are houses behind it (let's avoid the noise!)
--
tr√®s grand parking, √† c√¥t√© du parc D√©p√¥t, possibilit√© de stationnement libre, pas de signaux, pas de signal No Overnight. il s‚Äôagit d‚Äôun ancien d√©p√¥t communal qui n‚Äôest plus utilis√©. Nous n‚Äôavons pas essay√© mais il y a de l‚Äôeau le long du b√¢timent bleu. Tr√®s peu de passage et possibilit√© de stationnement avec un tr√®s grand VR. Attention de ne pas se mettre trop pr√®s du container √† d√©chets car il y a des habitations derri√®re (√©vitons le bruit !)

Location: Lanfair Road, San Bernardino County, California, United States
Name: Lanfair Road south of Bobcat Hills
Description: Great place for a night or a week.  Part of the Mojave National Preserve right on the wilderness boundary.  4 official metal campfire rings and 2 additional rock rings.  room for 2 rigs with privacy, 4 or 5 reasonably, and 10 to 12 if you are friendly with your neighbors. We have not seen 1 vehicle go by and we are the only ones here. This is on the edge of a wash, so you are slightly above the desert floor and exposed to the wind.  1 bar of Verizon 4g.

Location: Govt Wash Road, Clark County, Nevada, United States
Name: Lake Mead open area
Description: A lot of places to boondocking, easy to get in. Free if you have America the beautiful pass. Nice view to lake mead. Very very quiet. There are signs that parking is aloud to 14 days, but people here told me that thay are here for 5-6 months. T-Mobile 3 lines.

Location: Logan Turnpike, Union County, Georgia, United States
Name: Raven Cliff Wilderness
Description: Trail parking. Appalachian Trail crossing. Easily fit several vans. Level with shade. Stayed one night with no problems. Close to Helen. Georgia.

Location: Brush Creek Trail, Polk County, East Tennessee, Tennessee, 37317, United States
Name: Boyd Gap Overlook
Description: Trailhead and Overlook parking. No signs prohibiting overnight and lot is rarely used, especially in winter. Stayed here one night, no problem.

Location: Nf Rd 1460, McDonald County, Missouri, 64856, United States
Name: Huckleberry Ridge Conservation Area.
Description: Several spots along FS Rd 1460 with the first one suitable for Med length trailers/ RV/ small group. The rest are Campervan/ Truck camper/ tent sized.

Location: National Forest Development Road 200, Okanogan County, Washington, United States
Name: Bannon Mountain Trailhead
Description:
Trailhead provides parking for horse and Off- Road Vehicle trailers. The site also has a livestock corral, unloading ramp, 3 picnic tables/fire rings, and 1 toilet. The roads designated for Horse and OHV travel in the Bannon Mountain area can be accessed from this site. These are a series of old Forest Service Roads that have been converted to trails.

Clean toilet, usually stocked with toilet paper. Way more then 3 picnic areas, popular in winter as well. Lots of nearby locations for private camping. No cell phone service of any kind, most people bring a starlink. Most important, get water in Tonasket, NO WATER ON SITE! I paid people near the bottom of the dirt road for filling up on water.

Location: National Forest Development Road 200, Okanogan County, Washington, United States
Name: Bannon Mountain Old Gravel Pit
Description:
When nearby spots are full, or you want some privacy from ATV's running around, this place never fails. Good for hammocks, van, and campers that are class B or shorter trailers. Nearby bathroom is a short hike around the hill.

No water, no cell service.

Location: 398, East Santa Maria Street, Santa Paula, Ventura County, California, 93060, United States
Name: E Santa Maria Street (Frontage Road)
Description: No signs on the eastbound side of the frontage road near the Santa Paula airport. Some highway noise. Quieter at night. Very flat. Good for RV‚Äôs.

Location: 2090, Harrison Street, Santa Clara, Santa Clara County, California, 95050, United States
Name: Harrison st
Description: Quiet parking along the back side of a mall. Residences across the street. No signs, slept well. I've been here twice without incident.

Location: Lower Ted Lake Parking Area, Ted Lake Trail, Fauquier County, Virginia, 22642, United States
Name: GR Thompson wildlife management area
Description: Huge parking lot at trail head parked here before with no issues

Location: E Diamond Bar Road, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: Sothebys
Description: Gate is run by Arizona wildlife commission. Close it and find a spot. Saw no one for a day.

Location: I 10, Kingsbury, Guadalupe County, Texas, 78638, United States
Name: I10 Eastbound Rest Area - Guadalupe County
Description: Couldn‚Äôt find on Apple Maps - must be new! Really nice rest area. Indoor bathrooms, vending machines, covered picnic tables, trash cans, and a play ground. Some stray cats hanging in the parking lot. Can stay <24 hours. Decent Verizon and okay AT&T service.

Location: Arizona State Highway 564, Navajo County, Arizona, United States
Name: Alcove off 564
Description: Nice little alcove/pull off just off the road. Nice for a night!

Location: West Dike Road, Sugar Hill, Berkeley County, South Carolina, 29461, United States
Name: E Jarvis Morris Boat Ramp
Description: Large gravel parking lot at the boat ramp. No amenities at all, and a little trash around. Doesn‚Äôt seem particularly busy. Quiet and dark. Good for a night. No signs prohibiting overnight parking. Limited Verizon.

Location: Community Beer Garden, 1, Sands Beach Road, Port Royal, Beaufort County, South Carolina, 29935, United States
Name: Sand Beach Road
Description:
Beautiful spot. Quiet. Near Shellring Ale Group brewery. Excellent beer garden on River and charcuterie board. No tent camping but overnight parking up to 48 hours at lot adjacent to boat ramp.

Previous reviewer noted sketchy people in the area but we did not experience this.

Location: CR 142, Grand County, Utah, United States
Name: Hailey's turnout
Description: I my opinion this is the best spot before the BLM flat area just above here. perfect 5g on T-Mobile and att. flat spot with a super sweet fire pit. lots of cows, shoveled a bit of *** off the spot. there is a nice sunset to be seen here. coyotes in the area so keep your animals close by at night. sweet dreams

Location: 478, Guthrie Lane, Brentwood, Contra Costa County, California, 94513, United States
Name: Street Parking
Description: Parked after dusk under a streetlight. There is some industrial work nearby that was occasionally loud, but it stopped before 10pm. Left just after dawn. There are signs posted that commercial vehicles may not park in this area.

Location: Fenders Ferry Road, Delta, Shasta County, California, 96051, United States
Name: Under bridge off exit 707
Description: Great spot, right off the exit. Didn‚Äôt hear anything all night. Smaller spot, but worked great for my truck camper

Location: Tap & Bottle, 403, North 6th Avenue, Warehouse District, Tucson, Pima County, Arizona, 85705, United States
Name: Street Stealth Camping Tucson
Description: This is where I stayed and had an unbothered night. According to the city's website, Tucson has free on-street meter parking from 5pm until 8am the next morning. I tried it here and again near the university and had no problems, though I did have all windows covered. Theoretically, any meter parking spot that you need to pay between 8 and 5 would work (you might want to fact check to be sure!)

Location: Palmetto Street, Arts District, Los Angeles, Los Angeles County, California, 90013, United States
Name: Arts District
Description:
Nice spot for long term parking. no restrictions whatsoever. a bit busy in the morning with buses, but very calm nights.

stayed here for a month without any problem.

Location: 163, Outlet Center Drive, Music Valley Village, Nashville-Davidson, Davidson County, Middle Tennessee, Tennessee, 37214, United States
Name: Street Parking. Scoreboard Bar & Grill
Description:
This is a quiet road for cars just behind Scoreboard Bar and Grill which has good beer and live music. It‚Äôs a wide road with room for parking both sides.   Don‚Äôt park in the car parking which says no overnighting as another camper had been moved from car parking another time . There is also truck that parks there to sleep.

Walking distance to Grand Ole Opry

Location: Hodgeman County, Kansas, United States
Name: Isolated Meadow Tree Lined
Description:
Beautiful isolated meadow/field lined with trees along a river. opportunity for good sun or good shade whichever you pick. 
Phenomenal stargazing. nicely sheltered from winds. the road in is quality gravel. great spot for dogs to run around in roam. 
Two to three bars of Verizon.

Location: Yuma County, Arizona, United States
Name: Two trees in the maze.
Description: Spot in the maze with a great view, in a rtt. May have added a few scratches to the truck getting here...

Location: 311, Ocean Boulevard, Coronado, San Diego County, California, 92118, United States
Name: Street Parking. Ocean Avenue
Description: Lots of street parking on Ocean Ave at Coronado Beach. The north end of the road is quiet after dark, near the dog park. The south end is busy & loud until pretty late. Traffic and pedestrians can get loud, and start early in the morning (6am). There are bathrooms and a drinking fountain.

Location: 4961, East McKellips Boulevard, Apache Junction, Pinal County, Arizona, 85119, United States
Name: BLM near Lost Dutchman SP
Description: Heading east on Apache Trail Road take a right on Nodak then a left on E Mckellips and there are a couple of lots at first and second left turn you can see. Lots of Tmobile  cell signal(3-4 5g bars). 10 min to Apache Junction and the state park. No signs. Ppl stay a long time here. Pretty quiet, horses go through so there are some flies. Great view of Superstition Mountain. Tons of hiking. I stayed 3 weeks.

Location: Downes Brook Trailhead Parking, Downes Brook Trail, Albany, Waterville Valley, Carroll County, New Hampshire, United States
Name: Downes Brook-Mt Potash Trailhead
Description:
Parking lot at the Mt Potash trailhead off the eastern side of the Kancamangus Highway. Plowed in winter for easy access. Perfectly quiet when I pulled in after dark with one other vehicle which left an hour later. No noise the rest of the night.

As with most trailheads "no tenting" sign but that was all.  (In NH you are not allowed to pitch a tent within a minimum of a 1/4 mile from the parking areas/trailheads.  You are allowed to sleep at trailheads as most of the trails in the National Forest  lead to extensive multi-day trails/backcountry sites where longer term parking is required and accepted, as are overnight vehicle stays for hikers.)

Location: NM 51, Engle, Sierra County, New Mexico, United States
Name: east of norc
Description: one of the rare pull off the freeway that isn't blocked by rocks. with high clearance, you can get maybe 500ft from the road and hidden from it. great views all around, quite a bit of room.

Location: South Mount Lemmon Road, Pima County, Arizona, 85619, United States
Name: Sunrise point
Description: Amazing view on the range east of Mount Lemon. On the way up to the summit by the control road. Maybe not with a low clearance car, but it was fine with a Toyota Highlander 2wd. Several camping spots along the road, every thousand feet. Quiet and secluded. On the way up we passed two or three spots with RVs. Fire ring and a cute dog tombstone.

Location: 729, Truman Avenue, Queensgate, Richland, Benton County, Washington, 99352, United States
Name: Richland near Queensgate
Description: offroad parking near apartments and shopping center. I stayed overnight with no issues. relatively quiet.

Location: 10297, Cleary Street, Manassas, Virginia, 20110, United States
Name: Manassas
Description: Good spot no problem

Location: North Sibyl Road, Cochise County, Arizona, United States
Name: desert cow county
Description: decent place to overnight, near the highway but you barely hear it. likely there are more opportunities down the road, lots of off shoots. lots of cow poop, so not a place to walk barefoot

Location: Vicksburg Road, New Hope, La Paz County, Arizona, United States
Name: dirt lot by pride station
Description: large dirt lot behind/ beside pride station.  nice stop over for the night. parked in the far back away from the trucks.

Location: Crawford Path Trailhead, Crawford Connector, Carroll, Co√∂s County, New Hampshire, United States
Name: Crawford Path Parking Lot
Description:
Parking lot for one of many trail access paths to Crawford Path. Requires a $5 parking fee. This parking lot generally fills up summer 24x7 on weekends and during daylight hours in winter. Avoid during these peak times.

Arrived late afternoon as most hikers were departing and had the lot along with two other cars, both occupied by  other hikers. Very quiet night.

Location: Bloody Basin Road 9269, Yavapai County, Arizona, United States
Name: Large Dirt Lot
Description: Pulled in here just after dark. It is a large space, but slightly uneven. We were able to mostly level the van easily but a bigger rig might have trouble. A couple fire pits scattered about. Some trash, but not too much so please pick up afterwards. Highway noise is apparent but not bothersome. We opted to stay here instead of the spots farther down the road because we didn‚Äôt want to deal with the washboards on the roads for 3 miles. Awesome stargazing too

Location: Coyote Canyon, Pima County, Arizona, United States
Name: nice spot
Description: the nicest spot around here, views on Tucson and the mountains behind. in a little knoll. however, hard to get to. need high clearance, I hit the ground a few times with my bike carrier. narrow, I made it in with a dually but was rubbing all along. not sure I'd do it again.

Location: Powerline Road, Gateway to Lake Havasu, Mohave County, Arizona, United States
Name: Public Land off I-40
Description:
FREE. Lots of spots hereabouts suitable for vehicles and tents. Close to freeway so traffic noise but also close to Pilot, Chevron, Starbucks, and Love's for toilets, showers, WiFi, convenience stores, etc.
There were a couple of RVs that papered to be snowbirder types.
Access from SE corner of Pilot parking (34.727746, -114.314784) for small vehicles or Gateway Drive (34.726645, -114.308142) for slightly larger.

Location: AR 215, Fern, Franklin County, Arkansas, 72947, United States
Name: Devils Canyon
Description:
The most open campsite on the road. Clearing here is decent for Starlink, but you‚Äôll still need a pole!

Easily accessible by 2wd, nothing fancy. Some low hanging trees so stow any antennas

Location: Rocky Point Road, Maricopa County, Arizona, United States
Name: Desert Boondocking
Description: 360* View. A compass on the ground with a fire ring. Great Star gazing.

Location: Forest Road 40S06, Colestin, Jackson County, Oregon, United States
Name: Klamath NF large campsite
Description: Dispersed campsite in the Klamath National Forest. A large clearing on a mountain, nestled in pine trees, up a somewhat dubious dirt road. Fire ring and enough space for 4-5 cars. Pretty clean. Accessible in good weather, but probably snowed in for a lot of the winter. I‚Äôd guess in summer you could get here in any car, and I had no trouble in the rain in a 4wd pickup.

Location: Donahoe Spur Road, Engineer Springs, San Diego County, California, 91917, United States
Name: Sycamore Canyon BLM
Description:
I found this trying to find  another location. It‚Äôs in the mountains and quiet. It‚Äôs a place where people have shot their guns as there are targets and shells on the ground. There is a shooting range that you can hear in the distance that you drive past to get to this place. Good for a van. The road up is not bad but not great either. Has cell service. 

I cleaned up a lot of the trash, please leave it cleaner than you found it.

Location: 1830, Slaughter House Canyon Road, Kingman, Mohave County, Arizona, 86401, United States
Name: Slaughter House Canyon
Description: Dirt roads with pullouts right above slaughterhouse canyon. Roads a little bumpy but made it through in my kia optima just fine. Spent 2 nights, my second morning one of the locals called the police and they came out to do a welfare check but said it wasn‚Äôt a problem being there as long as I‚Äôm not leaving a mess or causing trouble. Canyon below is supposedly haunted.

Location: Forest Route 22S04, Tulare County, California, United States
Name: Forest Rd 22SO4
Description: Down the road from Parker meadow there are a few sites off the road with fire rings. Flat and fairly easy road, some offshoots toward the end that I wouldn‚Äôt do in a 2WD low clearance. Quiet and peaceful.

Location: White Trail, Wise County, Texas, United States
Name: Outside of TADRA
Description: This is a camp just a short distance from TADRA trailhead. There is water available at TADRA as well as vault toilets. There are no amenities at the campsite location.

Location: 182, East Willetta Street, East Evergreen Historic District, Phoenix, Maricopa County, Arizona, 85004, United States
Name: E Willetta Street
Description:
Incredible spot, near the Central Library and Downtown.
High residential towers give shade until late in the morning (about 9am).
Very calm spot. Phoenix is a calm city.
Stayed for 2 weeks, zero problems, except one guy at night who tried to open my driver door, but he walked away when he saw it was locked, but that's part of the game when you sleep in your car near the heart of the city.

Location: Winter Camp Ridge, Grand County, Utah, United States
Name: Arches view
Description: Secluded, out of the way level spots just below a little hill with sweeping views over the southern rock formations and Arches in the distance. The hill is the highest feature around and provides 360 view! Fire ring, no services. 4x4 and high clearance required, but mostly ok from the north. Full cell service.

Location: Blue Belle Mine Road, Yavapai County, Arizona, 86333, United States
Name: FR93 Dispersed
Description:
Nice spot just inside Prescott National Forest. On the right on FR93 close to Antelope Creek Rd.  A small ring/pull-through with a couple fire rings. Easy drive. 2-3 bars T-Mobile. Pack it in, pack it out. 

Centennial Park in Mayer has flush toilets and running water.

Location: Uptown Boulevard, Altamonte Springs, Seminole County, Florida, 32701, United States
Name: street parking
Description: Lots of free street parking all over this area. No signs. Good for stealth camping. I stayed for 3 nights in my campervan. There is a lot of traffic during the day but quiet at night. There is a whole foods nearby with clean bathrooms.

Location: Volcanic Tablelands BLM, Casa Diablo Road, Inyo County, California, 93514, United States
Name: Another spot along the road
Description: Another spot along the road. smaller than the 2nd pulloff listed on iOverlander and not as rocky as the first. Single campsite with a fire pit. 2 bars Verizon 3bars ATT without booster.

Location: 11123, Old Friant Road, Fresno County, California, 93730, United States
Name: Side of the road
Description: side of the road with gravel near a cycling and walking place

Location: County Road A021, Luna County, New Mexico, United States
Name: flat open space
Description:
flat open space near an old corral and windmill
there are several flat spaces along this little area suitable for camping, big and small rigs. on the south side of the road there is an old corral in windmill with a huge flat area. Right across the road there's another large flat area. hoping range, so watch for cows. No cell phone service with Verizon unless you move around a little bit. I never remote for just a one-night stop however, it's a great spot if you're in the area and need a place to stay.

Location: Hatch Highway, Luna County, New Mexico, 87937, United States
Name: picnic area right on highway
Description: This is a nice little pull out with a gravel road and several picnic tables. easy to access from the road, big enough for a couple of big rigs. very level. obviously some road noise because it's right on the road but seems to die down at night. Good alternative to driving the dirt roads for a quick stop overnight. one bar of Verizon service. No facilities, just a pull out

Location: New Mexico State Road 27, Lake Valley, Luna County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Small pull out
Description:
Small pull out at the beginning of the Lake Valley National Backcountry byway
This is a pretty small pull out, wouldn't be suitable for a big trailer or RV but great for a van or small rig. Right at the turnoff to start the Lake Valley National Backcountry byway. Small relatively level turnout with some signage. zero cell service for Verizon but you can backtrack out on the highway about 2 minutes and get service. No facilities or trash. leave no trace.

edited to add... When you get to Lake Valley town site, if you go north a little bit on the byway, there are lots of county roads leading into the hills. did not check any of them out for camping but definitely a possibility.

Location: 318;320, 19th Street, Glenwood Springs, Garfield County, Colorado, 81601, United States
Name: street parking
Description:
19th street, side of church
Quiet free street parking on the side of the church (the other side is no parking sign). No sign of no overnight. Felt secure. A bit of noise between 5 and 6 in the morning, since there's a hospital nearby (probably the workers shift). Small forward slope. Sidewalks and a bit of grass for the pups.

Location: Evergreen National Bank, 2394, Colorado Boulevard, Argo Mill, Idaho Springs, Clear Creek County, Colorado, 80452, United States
Name: Street parking on Colorado Bld
Description: Free Street parking on Colorado Boulevard, on the other side of street from Safeway (grocery store). Slept there 2 nights, felt secure and the sheriff was going up and down the road without bothering us. Next to a park with flush toilets (were open 8-9 december 2023!) and grass to take a walk with your pup. Argo gold mines and mill is just next to the spot and open for visits 7/7.

Location: US 395, Mono County, California, United States
Name: Off forest service road
Description: Flat spot off forest service road big enough for a van or small RV. There is a tower right in front. No highway noise. Great ATT and Verizon.

Location: Mound Road, Emery County, Utah, United States
Name: Price River
Description: 3 separate spots within a couple 100m. First is on top of the highest mound around, just south of the road a short steep ascent and 360 views, breeze and full stars await with plenty of room to turn around. The second is where the marker is, an overlook over the meanders of Price River, a wildlife magnet, 2x4 easy access, less windy. The third is down by the river under the wild olive trees and poplars, turn east just south of the bridge, easy 2x4 access too, fresh in summer but colder in winter. No services. Good cell signal on all 3.

Location: Lincoln Pond Road, Town of Elizabethtown, Essex County, New York, 12932, United States
Name: stop area, texte area
Description: nice stop text area, far from highway, must be calm at Nights.  no idle motors accept√©s.  Picnic tables, Lebel parking.  did'n stay here for the night. no signe saying you can't park for the night. paralel parking, good for cars and small camper.

Location: 7446, Route 66, Flagstaff, Coconino County, Arizona, 86004, United States
Name: Secret Pullout
Description: This place is almost invisible to traffic. Excellent hiding spot. Slightly unlevel, high side right if facing west. Very noisy from traffic. Loads at 6pm.

Location: Emery County, Utah, United States
Name: Valley View
Description: Amazing view 360, but off the "main" road and a little more secluded. Right on the edge of a cliff Artisan fire ring. Easy 2x4 access close to the highway. No services. Full cell signal.

Location: De Baca County, New Mexico, United States
Name: Bosque Redondo Riverside
Description:
